loans.name: Erney

texts.es: Erney, tiene la edad de 19  años, está soltero y vive con sus hermanos y sus padres. El pretende con el crédito comprar los insumos necesarios para la asistencia de una siembra de café que realizo. El cuenta con un almacigo que tiene sembrado y necesita asistirlo para su siembra en el campo donde se establecerá. El almacigo está en buenas condiciones y quiere mejorarlo para así obtener buena produccion cuando se pueda obtener cosechas. El piensa en el futuro propio y la de su familia por lo cual quiere ayudarle a su padre para alivianarle la carga con las responsabilidades de su hogar. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Erney is 19 years old, single, and lives with his siblings and parents.  He plans to use this loan to buy the supplies he needs to tend to the coffee plants that he has sown.  He has a seedbed in which he has already sown his plants and he needs to tend to it so that he can then plant them out in the field.  The seedbed is in good condition and he would like to improve it so that he can obtain a good production.  Erney is thinking of his own future and also that of his family.  He would like to help his lighten his father's load by taking on some responsibilities for their household.

This is Erney's first loan through FUDECOSUR.  He hasn't received previous loans from state banks but FUDECOSUR have given him this loan with better repayment terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to care for his coffee plants

loans.name: Juditha

texts.en:
Juditha is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Juditha has a retail shop that sells used clothing or ukay-ukay. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of used clothing.

Juditha is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Juditha hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more used clothing to sell

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 55 years old and is married with seven children. She lives in Dipolog City. For the past three years, Julieta has run a general store where she sells variety of goods. She joined PMPC this year.

Julieta is requesting a 3,000 PHP loan to purchase a variety of goods for her general store.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase peak milk, sardines, butter, sugar, and batteries

loans.name: Janina De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Janina de profesion reponsable de importaciones en una empresa privada, lleva tres años laborando, en donde logra apoyar a sus padres, ya que vive con ellos aun. Es soltera y tiene previsto tomar un curso de ingles.
Su objetivo ha sido, un mejor techo para sus padres, en donde opta al financiamiento, para lograr hacer el cuarto propio de ella, que aun no termima, pero le es de gran relevancia, poner techo en la parte de atrás, como un bajarete y embaldozar, ya que el agua se le mete para adentro de la casa, y desean mejorar esa condicion. Lo que comprara materiales de construccion, laminas de zinc, perlines, golosos, cemento, hierro y comenzar la obra, siendo este medio el mas viable. Ya que distribuye sus gastos, y mantener el apoyo a sus padres. Mientra forma su propio hogar.
texts.en:
Janina is in charge of imports for a private company.  She has been working there for three years, and manages to support her parents, as she still lives with them.  She is single, and plans to take a course in English.  

Her goal has been to have a better roof for her parents, and she opted for a loan to build her own room, which is still not finished.  But it is also really important for her to put a roof on the area behind the house. This will consist of a covered porch and tiled area.  This is because water is getting into the house, and they want to deal with that situation. 

She will buy construction materials such as zinc sheeting, purlins( structural roof members), sheet metal screws, cement, and iron, then start construction. This is the most viable approach, as she is spreading out her costs, and continuing to support her parents.  In the process, she is completing her own home.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build a covered porch and tile the area behind her house.

loans.name: Buenafe

texts.en:
Buenafe is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. 
Buenafe has a shop that sells hypo (cleaning) agent by the liter and gallon. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for making her cleaning agent.
Buenafe has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Buenafe hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients needed for making hypo (cleaning) agent

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 35 years old, married, and has two children. She has been engaged in the poultry raising business for five years. After feeding her chickens and ducks, she sells some of her grown-up native chickens for at about 150 PHP per kilo to have income for the family's daily meals. 

Marites is requesting a loan for 5,000 PHP, which she will use to buy and sell native chickens and ducks in the market. She hopes to expand her poultry business to save for future emergencies and the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase and sell native chicken and ducks in the market.

loans.name: Evamie

texts.en:
Evamie is married with one child. She is 26 years old and lives in Panduma Sr. Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur, Philippines.

To earned a living, Evamie has a business selling personal products, and she has had this business for two years. Each month, she earns PHP 5,000 doing this work. 

She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

Evamie has been a member of GDMPC for almost one year. In the future, Evamie hopes to improve or expand her small business.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

location.town: Panduma Sr. Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Damas Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
El comité “Damas Trabajadoras” tiene  casi 3 años de formación y trabajo con la Fundación Paraguaya. Ellas son 16 mujeres que se unen con el propósito de servir de ayuda a sus familias, ya que son mujeres de escazos recursos pero con muchas ganas de superación. Anhelan un futuro mejor para sus hijos es por eso que se esfuerzan el doble para facilitarles los materiales para su desarrollo y formación.
Un ejemplo de arduo trabajo es la señora Ruth. Ella se dedica a la venta de verduras, gracias a esto ella puede ayudar a su familia con los gastos diarios y a la vez sostener su negocio. Comenta que ya tiene una clientela definida, es decir, que ellos siempre compran de ella sus verduras. Se define como una señora muy sacrificada y trabajadora.
Ella solicita el crédito para comprar verduras, como ser tomates, locotes, cebolla, zapallos y demás con lo que podrá ayudar a su variedad de productos, con lo cual piensa atraer a mas clientes.
texts.en:
The “Damas Trabajadoras” committee has been in operation for almost three years working with Fundación Paraguaya.  It has 16 women members who join together to help their families since they are all women of few resources but with a strong will to get ahead.  They hope for better futures for their children and that’s why they work twice as hard to provide the tools for their development and formation.

One example of hard work is Ruth.  She sells vegetables and thanks to this has been able to help her family with daily expenses while supporting her business.   She comments that she has an established clientele, that is, they always come to her to buy their vegetables.  She defines herself as a very self-sacrificing, hardworking woman.

She requests the loan to buy vegetables like tomatoes, chilies, onions, squash and others to have more variety of products to attract more customers.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for subsequent resale.

loans.name: Tawana Nyasha Group

texts.en:
Erita is a 42-year-old married lady with three children, age 14, 9 and 6. All of them go to school. Her husband operates a grinding mill and they have other dependents whom they stay with. 

She sells her products at a flea market in town. She buys clothes, shoes, vases and curtains products  Zambia and South Africa for sale at her market. She has been in the business for three years and has no employees. The business faces a challenge of fluctuations in exchange rates. 

Erita wants to own various shops in town. She will also be able to provide a better life for her children and dependents from the profits.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, vases and curtains.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is 41 years old and married with four children.

Regina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more goods like snack foods, detergents, and other groceries.

Regina has borrowed and repaid 20 loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the general store for 12 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Regina aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more goods like snack foods, detergents, and other groceries.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul, 52, is a hardworking businessman. He is widowed and blessed with two children. 

For the past three years, he has been running a tailoring business to bring up his family. He describes his business as busy, since his potential customers are the local residents. 

He has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to add to his stock of fabric. 

Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has become more business-oriented. In the next five years, he wants to expand his business. Paul dreams of buying a piece of land in the future.

loans.use: to add to his stock of fabric.

loans.name: Mukhuyu Y.g.a Group

texts.en:
Caleb is the facilitator of the Mukhuyu Y.G.A. group. Caleb and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Caleb and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Caleb takes care of seven children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to have additional maize profits to send his children to school and secure enough food for his children. In the recent 2011 season, Caleb had an excellent maize yield harvesting 11 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Caleb was only able to harvest 2½ bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With income from maize sales, Caleb will educate his children and ensure food security for his family.

In 2012, the members of Mukhuyu Y.G.A group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

Caleb is pictured with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Cherry Jane

texts.en:
At age 22, Cherry Jane got married to Jorge. They have two children now and their family is less well off. The couple had to increase their income so that they can afford to send thier children up to college level of education and someday earn a degree. This is Cherry Jane's goal in life. 

Cherry Jane vends fruits and vegetables at the public market of Centro Southeast. Cherry Jane is now asking for a loan in order to buy onions, garlic, cabbages, and potatoes to sell. She wants to stock more fruits and vegetables. She is asking for 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP). This will help make her business more profitable, and increase her earnings too.

loans.use: To buy onions, garlic, cabbages, and potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna is 31 year old and married with four children who are all in school. She has had a business selling bread in Buluk, South Sudan for six years. Anna is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase breads. She will use her extra income from this loan to buy a plot and build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase bread to sell

loans.name: Sophy

texts.en:
Sophy, 48, is widowed and resides with four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia.  She has been involved in agriculture for over twenty years, has extensive experience and is successful in her career.  Sophy grows rice and raises cattle. Three of her children are employed at the garment factory. 

In order to improve her family’s livelihood, Sophy requests a USD 600 loan to purchase rice to sell at the rice mill. In the future, she would like to expand her rice trading business, rehab her house and support her youngest child to study until he/she gets a bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase rice to sell at the rice mill

loans.name: El Cedro Group

texts.es:
El Grupo El Cedro esta integrado por 13 mujeres trabajadoras, alegres y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, cada una de ellas tiene una diferente actividad economica, las principales actividades son la siembra y cultivo de caña y la recoleccion de la recina de los arboles de hule. 

La señora Rosalia es una de las integrantes de este grupo, ella tiene la edad de 38 años, estudios hasta el tercer grado de secundaria y es madre soltera. Doña Rosalia nos platica que siempre le ha gustado trabajar pero desde que  es madre soltera tuvo que trabajar mas duro para poder sacar adelante a su hijo. Doña rosalia desde hace algunos años abrio una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su hogar y con el tiempo fue ganando clientes lo cual ayudo a que su negocio prosperara actual mente su tienda esta hubicada en un local mas amplio y esta mas surtida de todo tipo de abarrotes, refrescos y productos para la limpieza, ella abre todos los dias su negocios de ocho de la mañana a ocho de la noche y nos dice que gracias a Dios su negocio esta estable y con el paso de los dias esta susrtiendo mas.
  Ella invertira este credito en la compra de jabon en polvo, sal, azucar, papel de baño, veladoras,leche, frijol, arroz, productos enlatados, crema queso, dulces y refrescos para resurtir su negocio.

Doña Rosalia espera que con este credito su negocio continue creciendo para poder dar a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida.

los demas miembros de este grupo son:
 Cenorina-pollo
Camerina-ropa
Maria Lucrecia-abarrotes
Eva-abarrotes
Yuridia-club de nutricion
Genoveva-Calzado
Elodia-cosmeticos
Dora Maria-ropa
Maria del Carmen- costura
Lindsay-refrescos
Martha-cocina economica
Guadalupe-refrescos
texts.en:
The “El Cedro” (The Cedar) group is composed of 13 hardworking, cheerful women who very much want to get ahead.  Each has a different economic activity.  The main activities are sugar cane farming and collecting resin from rubber trees.

Rosalía is one of the group members.  She’s 38 years old and studied up to third year of secondary school; she’s a single mother.  Rosalía tells us that she’s always liked to work but because she’s a single mother she has had to work even harder to support her son.  Rosalía opened a small grocery store at home a few years ago and in time has secured customers which helped the store to prosper.  Currently, her store is located in a more spacious locale and is better stocked with all sorts of groceries, soft-drinks and cleaning products.  She opens the store every day at 8am and she tells us that thanks to God her business is stable and as time goes by it’s getting better stocked.

She will use the loan to buy powdered detergent, salt, sugar, toilet paper, votive candles, milk, beans, rice, canned goods, cream, cheese, candy and soft-drinks to stock her store.  Rosalía hopes that with this loan her business will continue to grow so that she can give her son a better quality of life.

The other group members are:

Cenorina-chicken
Camerina-clothes
María Lucrecia-groceries
Eva-groceries
Yuridia-nutrition club
Elodia-cosmetics
Dora María-clothes
María del Carmen- sewing
Lindsay-beverages
Martha-low cost eatery
Guadalupe-beverages

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Dababougou Benkadi 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  Dababougou Benkadi 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Soké, un des villages de San, 4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le riz  avec  MARATOU,  1ere debout de la droite vers la gauche  sur  la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter, des petits matériels agricoles, des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,75 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et au marché de San, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 195.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the group "Dababougou Benkadi 2" are married women averaging 37 years of age and five children each all living in traditional families in Soké, a village in San (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali) The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their second loan with the institution. The past loans have indeed been paid back. 

The crop grown is rice, as is the case with MARATOU, the first one standing from the right in the photo. With her loan, she intends to buy farm inputs, some seeds, and sundry farm equipment and to cover the cost of plowing for maintaining 0.75 hectare.

The produce will be sold in the village and at the San market after the harvest. The customer base is composed of men and women. 

She expects to make an average profit of 195,000 francs CFA per planting season. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and also to help her husband to cover day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to cover the cost of plowing and to buy farm inputs, sundry equipment, and some seeds

loans.name: Rustam

texts.ru: 60 летный сильный и опытный дехканин, Рустам. Он житель района Хуросон. Его на районе все знает и уважает. Рустам в течение 45 лет занимается животноводством. Такого дехканина мало встретишь. Рустам имеет большой коровник для скотов, и хорошее удобство для выращивания скота. Рустам  в районе живет вместе с женой, детьми, невестками и внуками. Он учить своих детей к этому делу, чтобы они сохранили его деятельность. Рустам просит сумму денег для купли больше баранов для увеличения их численность. Путем увеличения численность скотов расшириться животноводческая деятельность. Рустам мечтает о расширения деятельности. Вы можете поддержать его сейчас!

loans.use: Для купли несколько баронов и расширения животноводческой деятельности.

loans.name: Somat

texts.en: M. Somat lives with his mother and older sister. His mother is in poor health and is currently in the hospital. M. Somat feels responsible for his family, and desires to provide a good income for them. M. Somat used to be a motor taxi driver. However, he has been out of work for the last 10 days because his moto bike was stolen. During this time of unemployment he has been assisting his sister in her cake baking business. However, he would like to be able to earn additional income for the family; therefore, he is applying for a loan for $700 so that he may purchase a tuk tuk (a type of passenger taxi cart which is attached to a motor bike). The entire $700 will be spent on the tuk tuk. As a motor taxi driver M. Somat earned about $5 a day. After consulting his brother-in-law, who is currently a tuk tuk driver, M. Somat anticipates being able to earn about $12.50 a day with the new tuk tuk.  M. Somat looks forward to being able to earn money for his family again, and even raise their standard of living with the increase in income that he anticipates from the tuk tuk.

loans.use: Purchase Tuk Tuk

loans.name: Vugar

texts.en: Vugar is resident of Beylagan town and until 2006 he earned his living as a market retailer. He decided to run his own business and first he borrowed $800 from Normicro Beylagan branch and constructed a shop. Now he needs 1200$ to increse working capital to increase the volume of sales.

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Senila

texts.en:
Senila is 34 years old and is married with three children.

Senila operates a stall at the local flea market. She purchases jewelry and traditional wares from local Samoan handicraft artists and sells them at her stall.

The income from the flea market stall is critical to keeping current with her children’s school fees and purchasing their uniforms and school supplies. She is passionate about keeping high quality items in supply for both local customers and tourists.

Senila will use loan funds to purchase additional inventory for her stall.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for flea market stall

loans.name: Celina

texts.pt:
Celine M. is 47 years old, a native of Bilene Macie, Province of Gaza. She grew up with her grandparents, and the family situation created few opportunities, and she studied until the 4th grade. She's now a single mother of 4 children. At 18, she took on the management of the business to support her family and has a commercial store in the Km 16 Market. Starting in 2006, after referral from colleagues and friends, she found out about Hluvuku-Adsema, and approached them and requested a loan to apply to her business. Since then, her business has really changed.

Currently, her business is going at a good pace, and provides employment for herself and supports her family responsibilities.

With a loan of 21,000 meticais, she plans to increase the volume of her business in order to respond to her clients' needs. Her business has greater impact in the community given that, in addition to bring products closer to the customer, it provides a job for herself and supports her family responsibilities.

Translated from Portuguese by a Kiva volunteer.

LOCALIZAÇÃO : Km 16 – Boane CLIENTE : Celina M. SECTOR DE ACTIVIDADE : Comercio VALOR DE EMPRESTIMO: 21.000,00MT (840.00US$) APLICAÇÃO DO MONTANTE : Compra de produtos para revenda INICIO: 18/06/2007 FIM: 31/07/2008 Celina M. de 47 anos de idade, natural de Bilene Macie, Provincia de Gaza, cresceu sob responsabilidade dos seus avos, a situacao financeira da familia criou lhe poucas oportunidades tendo estudado ate 4 classe, solteira mae de 4 filhos. Aos seus 18 anos de idade vem assumindo na integra a gestao do negocio para sustento da familia e possui um estabelecimento Comercial no Mercado do Km16. A partir do ano 2006, por indicacao de colegas e amigas teve conhecimento da existencia da Hluvuku-Adsema, tendo aproximado e solicitado um emprestimo para aplicacao no seu negocio. Desde entao, a sua actividade conheceu outra dinamica. Actualmente o seu negocio esta num bom ritmo e providencia emprego para ela propria e suporta os encargos familiares. Com o emprestimo de 21.000,00Mts pretende aumentar o volume de negocio de forma a responder com as exigencias dos clientes. A sua actividade tem um impacto maior na sua comunidade dado que, para alem de colocar o produto mais perto do cliente providencia emprego para ela propria e suporta os encargos familiares.

loans.use: To increase stock in her shop

loans.name: Thun

texts.en:
Mrs. Thun S. is 44 years old and lives with her husband and her five children in Kompung Cham province, Cambodia. She and her husband, along with two children, work in a brick-making factory. Together, they generally earn about $9 each day.

Mrs Thun S. requests this loan so her husband can purchase a fishing net and a boat. He wants to fish when he is not working in the factory.

loans.use: Purchase a fishing net and a boat.

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
Oksana started her small business eight years ago so that she could earn extra money to pay for medications for her daughter who needed medicine from abroad. Since that time, her daughter is doing better and her business has greatly expanded.

She currently sells a variety of linens and bedding material at one of the markets in Kharkov, Ukraine. Oksana is a busy entrepreneur who looks for new ways to add to or improve her business. She has benefited from a total of six different loans from Nadiya Ukraine that have helped her develop and expand her business.

Recently, Oksana requested a new loan to help her purchase a car. While the car will likely help with her current business, she’d also like to be able to make money by renting it out. It will be exciting to see how Oksana’s business will continue to develop and provide the means to improve the lives of her family members.

loans.use: Purchase a car

loans.name: Hindun

texts.en: Hindun is 45 years old and married. She produces and sells some cakes together with her husband. They usually earn $5 per day, and it's just enough to cover their daily needs. She requests $125 loan to expand her business and sell various cakes. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To produce more various cakes

loans.name: German

texts.es:
Sr. German is 31 years old and married to Sra. Carolina Candia, also 31 years old, who is a teacher. They have 2 daughters who are still in school.

German worked previously selling newspapers. His brother, who is a mechanic, taught him the skill of automobile repair. At present he has his own mechanic shop with a very good clientele.

In the future he would like their daughters to finish their studies and pursue a profession. Today he requests a loan to invest in the purchase of lubricants, oils and some replacement parts for vehicles.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. German tiene 31 años esta casado con la Sra. Carolina Candia de 31 años que es docente, poseen dos hijas que se encuentran estudiando en la escuela.-

El señor anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de diarios, su hermano que es mecánico le llevó a trabajar con el enseñándole las técnicas de la automotriz. Actualmente posee un taller mecánico propio con muy buena clientela formada. -

En el futuro le gustaría que sus hijas culminen sus estudios y tengan una profesión. Hoy solicita el crédito para invertirlos en la compra de lubricantes, aceites y algunos repuestos para vehículos.

loans.use: purchase of oils, lubricants and some replacement parts for vehicles.

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Doña Adela is 62 years old. At the present she lives in the town of Trujillo and her business is located at the “Chacarero” market. She is dedicated to selling all kinds of groceries (milk, cooking oil, noodles, rice, etc.) balanced food, vegetable stews, and cheese. At 19 years of age doña Adela started to work at a furniture store while she was studying a technical degree which she did not finish as she became ill. When recovered she had several jobs and little by little she saved money which she spent on buying clothes to sell in the mountains, as she was living for some time in Mache and was accepted in the community bank “Progresistas”. After getting married she returned to the town of Trujillo, bought a house, and some years later managed to get a stall at the “Chacarero” market which slowly has grown into her present business.

With a previous loan of S/.300 from the community bank “Progresistas” she traveled to Mache to purchase lamb, ground meat, cheese, wheat grains, dry potato, and “chufla” (pudding made of corn) which she sold in different parts of Trujillo. With the requested loan of S/.2,300, ( $800) to be repaid in 4 months, she will buy rice, sugar, milk and noodles by wholesale. It is doña Adela’s dream to start a chain of general stores offering the same products as she is now selling.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Adela tiene 62 años de edad. Actualmente vive en la ciudad de Trujillo y su negocio está ubicado en el mercado “Chacarero”. Se dedica a la Venta de toda clase de abarrotes (leche, aceite, fideos, arroz, etc.), alimento balanceado, menestras y quesos. Desde la edad de 19 años la señora Adela trabajó en una tienda de muebles, en paralelo estudiaba una carrera técnica, pero no terminó debido a que se enfermó, luego de mejorarse trabajó en varios empleos y poco a poco fue ahorrando dinero con el cual compró ropa para vender en la sierra, porque un tiempo vivió en Mache e ingresa al banco comunal “Progresistas”. Después de casarse regresa a vivir a la ciudad de Trujillo, se compra una casa y después de unos años consigue un puesto en el mercado “Chacarero”, en el cual poco a poco ha ido surtiendo el negocio.

Con un primer préstamo de S/.300 que recibió en su banco comunal “Progresistas” viajó a Mache para comprar carneros, molidos, quesillo, granos de trigo, papa seca y chufla para ofrecer por las diferentes urbanizaciones en Trujillo. Con el préstamo de S/. 2,300, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará arroz, azúcar, leche y fideos al por mayor. El sueño de la señora Adela es tener una gran empresa, es decir, tener una cadena de depósitos que ofrezcan los mismos productos que ahora ella vende.

loans.use: Purchase groceries (rice, sugar, milk, etc.) to increase business.

loans.name: Dragica

texts.en: Dragica is from Nova Bila, a suburb of the town of Travnik. She is 58 years old and she is married. Her husband has a full-time job and he can earn 200 KM monthly. They have two children, 35 and 32 years old. She wants to use this loan of 1000 KM to buy a sewing machine and expand the business. She hopes that she will increase her monthly income.

loans.use: Buying a sewing machine.

loans.name: Yu

texts.en:
Mrs. Yu N., 58, and her husband, Sat Siv, married in 1979. They have five children; three sons and two daughters. One of their children is married and lives outside the family house, two children weave silk at home, and the other two children are garment factory workers. The family lives on Koh Dach Island on the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Yu is in the business of weaving silk. She learned weaving from her mother and started silk production in 1980. She sells her finished products in her village. Her husband helps her spin the silk.

She is requesting a loan for the sixth time in the amount of $700 to purchase silk material for weaving and to buy a motorbike to use in the family. Based on her business success so far, she will have no problem in repaying the loan to MAXIMA.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving and to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Hadija's Clothes Seller Group

texts.en:
Hadija is 47 years old and is married with 3 children, aged 16, 15 and 12. Hadija is a clothes seller; she started in 2007. Every day she works from 8am to 5pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Zuhura and Christina, who have businesses dealing in fish sales and charcoal sales.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Rosa Lastenia

texts.es:
Rosa Lastenia P. is 71 years old. She is a native of the district of Mache in Otuzco province. She does not have an education, since her parents did not consider it a good investment to send their daughters away to school to learn. Rosa has 6 children, all of whom are independent of her and married. She lives at Calle Las Jadeitas Mz. 31, lot No. 38 in the La Rinconada neighborhood in the city of Trujillo, department of La Libertad, Peru.

Rosa has a small grocery store, which she started 10 years ago when she decided to move from Mache to the city of Trujillo. She has been working with Kiva Partner Manuela Ramos for almost 5 years now. Her store is located in a room in her house; she and her husband attend to the store every day, and the income that it brings in allows them to support themselves financially.

The first loan Rosa received from Manuela Ramos was for 300 Peruvian Soles ($100), which she invested in her small business by purchasing fruits, vegetables, and rice, etc. She belongs to Las Jadeitas Communal Bank.

Rosa will use the loan of 600 Soles ($225) to purchase products to sell; the loan will be repaid in a period of 4 months.

Rosa wishes to live peacefully in her old age near her children and grandchildren.

Translated from Spanish by Chris Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Rosa Lastenia P. tiene 71 años de edad, es natural del Distrito de Mache provincia de Otuzco, no tiene estudios, cuenta que sus padres no consideraban una buena inversión el hecho que las niñas vayan al colegio y puedan estudiar por lo cual ella no pudo ir al colegio. Tiene 06 hijos todos independientes y casados; vive en la calle las Jadeitas Mz. 31 lote Nº 38 en la Urb. La Rinconada en la ciudad de Trujillo del departamento La Libertad – Perú.

La señora Rosa tiene una pequeña tienda en la cual vende abarrotes, empezó hace 10 años cuando decidió irse de Mache a la cuidad de Trujillo y viene trabajando con Manuela Ramos casi 05 años. Su tienda esta ubicada en la sala de su casa y junto a su esposo la atiende todos los días con estos ingresos se ayudan para poder vivir y sostenerse económicamente.

Su primer prestamo fue S/.300 de Manuela Ramos, este dinero lo invirtió en su pequeño negocio, comprando verduras, frutas, y arroz, etc. Ella integra el Banco Comunal “Las Jadeitas”

Con el préstamo de S/. 600.00 el cual pagará en un periodo de cuatro meses. comprará productos para su venta

Ella desea vivir tranquila su vejes cerca de sus hijos y nietos.

loans.use: Purchasing more products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase clothing to sell in her community in order to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.name: Lucely Patricia

texts.es:
Lucely is married and has 4 sons, who are 18, 15, 12, and 8 years old. For some years now she has been working selling cold drinks, but she noticed it wasn’t such a good business because the profits were lean, that is how she looked for other products to sell and found that natural products had a higher demand among her friends, and she decided to sell them. These products are leaving her a better profit, she sells among her neighbors and her clients have increased day by day.

She needs a loan of 4250 that she will pay in 3 months to buy more products and be able to supply her clients. With your help she will be succeed.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Lucely es casada y tiene 4 varones de 18,15 12 y 8 años. Desde hace algunos años se decida al comercio, ella vendía refrescos en su casa, pero empezó a ver que no era tan buen negocio ya que no le dejaban mucha ganancia, fue así como empezó a buscar otras opciones para vender y encontró que la venta de productos naturistas tenia mucha demanda entre sus amistades, fue entonces que decidió dedicarse a la venta de estos productos los cuales les dejan muy buenas ganancias ya que los vende también entre sus vecinos y sus clientela ha ido aumentando cada día.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mas productos y poder abastecer a su clientela. Con tu ayuda ella saldra adelante.

loans.use: To buy merchandise / comprar mercancia

loans.name: Zainab's Vegetable Sales Group

texts.en:
Zainab, 24, is married with one child. She has been selling tomatoes and potatoes since 2006. She works from 6AM to 6PM and can earn a monthly profit of about $145 from her sales.

Zainab has taken out one successful loan to expand her business. She is now requesting a loan to buy more potatoes and tomatoes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, Mwanausi, who has a business dealing with coconut and bite sales.

loans.use: To buy more tomatoes and potatoes for resale.

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr: Marié et père de trois (03) enfants, monsieur Kokou A. est né le 08 Novembre 1988 à Lomé. Il a arrêté ses études très tôt faute  de moyens financiers et s’est lancé alors dans l’apprentissage de la menuiserie. Aujourd’hui il dispose de son propre atelier qu’il a loué. Faute de moyens financiers, il lui manque le plus souvent de la matière à travailler notamment le bois et à faire des expositions de ces œuvres et à payer à temps le loyer. Ce crédit lui permettra de s’approvisionner en bois et de satisfaire les commandes de ses clients.
texts.en:
Married and the father of three children, Mr. Kokou A. was born on November 8, 1988 in Lomé. Due to financial issues, he abandoned his studies very early on and learned furniture making. Today, he has his own rented workshop. Lacking financial means, he often does not manage to buy wood, display his works or pay the rent in time. This loan will enable him to buy wood and meet customer demand.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wood and planks

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To start a small business selling costume jewelry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: A Refrigerator and a Microscope

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice T. is 42 years old and a mother with three kids. Two of them are in school now and the youngest has not started school. She has been selling grocery products for five years on a table in her neighborhood, to support her family. She says business is doing well, and she therefore wants to use the loan to buy more products to increase her inventory. Beatrice believes the loan would help her increase her savings towards the welfare of her two children who are in school now. She is a member of the group called Boldness. Members in the group agree in unison to guarantee for each other to repay the loan. She does not sell on group meeting days and her picture was taken during her group meeting. Her child is also in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products like tins of fish and tomatoes, cocoa products, skimmed milk, vegetable oil, etc. to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth E. sells food, drinks and groceries. Her shop is open daily from 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. 

She needs a loan of N70, 000 to purchase more food, drinks, and groceries to sell. She is 42 years old and is married with 6 children. Her husband is a commercial driver. She says "thank you" to everyone who has made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more food, drinks, and groceries to sell

loans.name: John

texts.en: John A. is a local manufacturer. He is 48 years old, married and has six children. Currently, five of his children are in school. He lives with his family in Bawjiase, near Accra, the capital city of Ghana. John is a blacksmith and manufactures hoes, cutlasses, sickles which he sells in nearby market squares to the local farmers. He is not able to meet his customers demand due to insufficient working capital. The costs of his working tools and materials have also risen considerably. John requests a loan to purchase raw materials such as metal plates, an anvil, blower, Bedford frame, hammer etc. to scale up production and meet demand. He hopes to raise more income and use the proceeds to expand his business and also support his family. He is a member of the community group called Special Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loan and provide assistance to one another to handle repayment.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials such as metal plates, an anvil, blower, Bedford frame, hummer etc.

loans.name: Mrangi Rangi Group

texts.en:
Mwanahamis K., age 51, is married with five children ages 28, 23, 20, 18 and 16.  She has a chicken business. She started this business in 1996 and works daily from 5:00 a.m. until 11:00 p.m. She is able to earn a monthly profit of around $150. 

This will be Mwana’s third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her stock from 300 to 500 chickens and has repaid all of the loans successfully. She now hopes for a third loan to open a café to sell snacks and tea.
	
Mwanahamis will share this loan with her loan group, Mrangi Rangi, which has 21 members. The members of the group hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture,  Mwanahamis is 1st on the left in a pink dress.

loans.use: Increase her stock from 300 to 500 chickens

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
La señora Lidia es socia del Banco Comunal “El Comercio”, del Barrio Nueva Esperanza, en el distrito de Desaguadero, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; tiene 39 años de edad, ella es madre soltera y tiene 01 hijo a su cargo, ella no pudo culminar sus estudios de superiores de Contabilidad en la Universidad José Carlos Mariategui de Moquegua, pero si culminó sus estudios técnicos  (Laboratorio) en el tecnológico de Desaguadero. 
Ella Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 03 años, su negocio es el la venta útiles de escritorio y abarrotes al por menor y; su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, con lo que pudo adquirir mercadería para su negocio.  
Actualmente ella requiere un nuevo préstamo de S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles, el mismo que se comprometa a pagar en 03 cuotas, con el préstamo ella desea colocar un negocio de venta de útiles escolares (Cuadernos, papel, lapiceros, lápices, plumones, borradores, etc.) puesto que es la época ideal para este negocio ya que le brinda buenas ganancias; su anhelo es contar con una bodega propia con diferentes productos y brindarles una adecuada educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ms. Lidia is a member of the Communal Bank of “Commerce” from the “New Hope Neighborhood” in the Desaguadero district, Chucuito Province, of Puno. She’s 39 years old and is a single mother. She has one son in her care. She could not complete her university level studies in accounting at the Jose Carlos Mariategui de Moquegua University, but she did complete her technical studies at the Desaguadero Technology (Academy). For three years she’s been working with the Manuela Ramos movement. Her business is selling retail school supplies and groceries. Her first loan was s/.300.00 nuevos soles, with which she purchased merchandise for her business. She currently seeks a new loan for S/.3000.00 nuevos soles; she promises to pay back this amount in three installments. With the loan she wants to establish a business selling school supplies (notebooks, paper, mechanical pencils, pencils, pens, erasures, etc.) as it is the ideal time for this business and it already offers her good profits. Her wish is to have storage space of her own with different products and to provide her children an adequate education.

Translated from Spanish by Jo Longnecker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Start a school supply business (notebook, paper, mechanical pencils, pencils, pencil, erasures, etc.)

loans.name: Malek

texts.en:
Malek is a 53-year-old man who lives in Nabatieh, southern Lebanon with his wife and their two children. For the last two years, Malek has made a living selling dairy products. He is applying for a loan of $2,000 from Al Majmoua to buy a new refrigerator. This is the first time that Malek has requested a loan from us, but we are confident he will be able to repay because he sells a wide range of products and knows how to treat his clients, who come from all across his area.

When Malek first started his business, he didn’t have startup capital, but he did have lots of experience that helped him succced. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To buy a new refrigerator for his business.

loans.name: Rerika

texts.es: Rerika tiene 25 años de edad, vive con su pareja y padre de sus 3 hijos, en una casa alquilada. Desde su infancia trabajó cuidando los animales que tenían sus padres, pero lo que ella anhelaba era tener un negocio de venta de ropa, sueño que no pudo realizar, ya que cuando formó a su familia, continuó criando animales, pero esta vez, junto a su esposo. Mayormente tiene cerdos, los cuales cría para vender su carne, esta actividad no le resulta muy costosa porque luego de su cosecha y selección de papas, las sobras, le sirven de alimento para sus cerdos. Rerika está muy contenta con la crianza de animales y las labores agrícolas que realiza en compañía de su esposo, sus metas son de adquirir una casa propia para el bienestar de sus hijos que aun están muy pequeños. En todo este tiempo que viene trabajando con MFP ha demostrado ser una cliente muy puntual en cada uno de sus pagos, y acaba de solicitar su 4to préstamo. Con este dinero comprará alimento concentrado para el rápido engorde a sus cerdos, y también abono para su chacra de papas.
texts.en:
Rerika is 25 years old. She lives with her partner and father of her 3 children in a rented house. She took care of her parent's animals beginning in her childhood, but what she longed for was to have a clothing sales business, a dream she could not fulfill, as when she formed her family, she continued caring for animals, but this time together with her husband. She has mainly pigs, which she raises to sell the meat. This activity has not been expensive for her because after harvesting and selecting her potatoes, the leftovers serve as food for her pigs. Rerika is very happy with caring for animals and the agricultural work that she carries out with her husband. Her goal is to buy her own house for the well-being of her children, who are still very young. In all this time that she has been working with MFP she has proven to be a client who is very punctual with each of her payments, and she has just requested her 4th loan. With this money she will buy concentrated food for the rapid fattening of her pigs, and also fertilizer for her small potato farm.

Translated from Spanish by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of food for her animals

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. SOFIA; ella vive en miraflores la cantuta A-3, ubicado a 30 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 24 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene un pequeño hijo de 6 meses, ella alterna sus actividades y su labor de madre con la venta de productos por catálogo, ella trabaja con 3 líneas y una de ella vende ropa y carteras por catálogo, la socia solicita el préstamo para poder hacer un pedido mayor de sus productos y estos venderlos a sus clientas en las diferentes fechas que no llegan los pedidos.

La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete a pagar toda su deuda en el tiempo estipulado, ella está muy feliz por este apoyo y valora y bendice a las personas que hacen posible todo esto.
texts.en:
This client is Sofia and she lives in Mirafloras, La Cantuta A-3, located about 30 minutes from the city of Cusco.

Sofia is 24 years old and lives with her 6-month-old baby and his father. She balances her activities and her work as a mother with the sale of products by catalogue. She works with three lines, one being a line of clothing and bags via catalogue. She is requesting a loan to make a large order of products, which she will sell to her customers on those occasions when orders do not arrive.

Sofia is thankful for this loan and is committed to paying it all back within the designated time. She is very happy for this assistance and appreciates and blesses the people who have made this all possible

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Novesky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beauty and clothing products for sale.

loans.name: Miguel De Los Santos

texts.es: El señor Miguel de los Santos C. Gutiérrez , tiene la edad de 43 años , habita en el barrio Pablo C. , ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su compañera de vida , la cual le apoya con los gastos del hogar ; ellos tienen dos hijos a su cargo los cuales estudian actualmente y le apoyan en los trabajos agrícolas en sus tiempos libres , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento , durante veinte años trabajando duro para poder sacar adelante la producción , todavía no logra sus sueños . El inicio la actividad agrícolas con sus propios esfuerzos, Con el financiamiento disponible a va comprar fertilizantes e insumos para aplicar al cultivo y poder tener una buena producción.
texts.en:
Mr. Miguel de los Santos C. Gutiérrez is 43 years old and lives in the Pablo C. neighborhood in Ticuantepe. Miguel lives with his partner who helps him with the household expenses. They have two children who are students but who also help him with his agricultural work in their free time. The biggest problem he faces is lack of money. During the 20 years he has been working hard to produce more, he still hasn’t been able to achieve his dreams. He started out in agriculture on his own. With the available loan, he will buy fertilizers and supplies for his crops and hopefully get a good return.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar insumos y fertilizante para aplicar al cultivo

loans.name: Math

texts.en: Math S., 44, has been selling groceries for more than five years, a skill she learned from a friend many years ago. She is now married with five children, all of whom are school-aged. Her husband owns a truck and uses it to transport soil to sell. Math S. is applying for a $1200 loan from Kiva’s partner HKL; she will use half to buy additional grocery inventory to sell and the rest to repair a truck that has broken.

loans.use: To buy additional grocery inventory to sell.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina, 29 years old, is single and the mother of two kids who are currently in school. She operates a clothing shop and sells jeans, blouses and skirts and women's slippers and dressing bags for the past three years.

Regina is constrained by lack of sufficient funds to run the business. She needs the loan to inject more working capital into the business to scale up business progress. She believes the loan will help her to be more resourced to purchase good quality and large quantity to upgrade her inventory. She says she would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To inject more working capital into her business

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Faith O. is 49 years old and married with two children. She sells sarongs and baby items such as diapers, flasks, etc. She has been in this business for a long time. Faith is requesting the loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more sarongs and baby items to sell. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs and baby items to sell

loans.name: Jimy

texts.es:
El señor Jimy V. vive en casa de sus padres, en la zona  de Valle Hermoso, ladera norte de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposa, la señora Wendy Guzmán y sus dos hijos.
El señor Jimy es prensista y trabaja en una imprenta privada de La Paz y su esposa vende cosméticos de promoción de puerta a puerta, ingresos con los que mantienen a su familia.
Con sus ahorros lograron construir una pequeña vivienda que se encuentra en obra gruesa.
El crédito solicitado es para la conclusión de la construcción de su vivienda y así habitarla.
Esta es la primera vez que solicitan préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califican favorablemente y pueden acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Señor Jimy V. lives with his wife, Señora Wendy Guzmán, and their two children in his parents' house in the Valle Hermosa (Beautiful Valley) neighborhood on the north side of the city of La Paz. Jimy is a printer and works for a private printing house in La Paz, while his wife sells promotional cosmetics door-to-door, and with these incomes they support their family. With their savings, they have built a small residence that is still unfinished. The loan they are seeking is to finish the construction of their home so that they can move in. This is the first time that they have sought a loan and the socioeconomic evaluation they completed rates them favorably, which thereby qualifies them for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To finish construction of his home.

loans.name: God Is With Us Group

texts.en:
This is Fatmata K. S., Ya Namina S. and Isatu B.. They are local businesswomen in Magburaka town. They named their group God is With Us. They have received several loans from Kiva through SMT. Previous loans have made tremendous impacts into the lives of these borrowers. They were able to use the proceeds to look after themselves and their families. Having repaid their previous loan successfully, they are now requesting a new loan to further expand their businesses.

Fatmata K. S. (right) sells jewelries. She is the leader of this group. She was born in Magburaka, in Tonkolili district, in northern Sierra Leone. She is age thirty-four, married to a farmer and they have three children. One of her children is in secondary school, the other in primary school and the last is still not of school going age. Fatmata has got more than ten years of experience in business. With this loan, she will be able to further strengthen her business.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Ilem Group

texts.en:
Rozalia is a member of the Ilems borrower group in Mwanjelwa, Mbeya. She is 40 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 4 children. Her children are 19,16,14, and 8 years old.

Rozalia has owned a charcoal business for 6 years. She works 10 hours a day  and she earns a monthly profit approximately 100,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Rozalia`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the a,mount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more charcoal for her business. 

With the additional profit she gains from the use  of this loan, Rozalia hopes to save more money, pay school fess, and expand her business.

Atuganile,Neema  are another member of the a same borrower group. They also requested the loan amount of 200,000 each one in order to expand their business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal fro her business

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy T., who has no educational background, is married and has three children. She has been selling plastic containers, buckets, ice chests and so on near Nyankumasi since 2002.  Nancy, who uses her income to support  her husband in the payment of utility bills, will use the loan to purchase more plastic containers for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to save to further expand her enterprise.

loans.use: Nancy will use the loan to purchase more plastic containers for sale.

loans.name: Oghoye

texts.en: I. is 54 years old and married with 6 children. He is farmer and has been in this business for years.  He is requesting for the loan amount of N100, 000 to cultive his farm. He says thank you to all kiva lenders for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more seedlings to plant.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon O. is from the village of Baclay, Tukuran Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 49 years old. Corazon is married and has 8 adult children. To make a living, Corazon owns and operates a specialized store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling nipa hut products to the community. 

In 2007, Corazon joined GDMPC in order to gain access to financial services that could help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Corazon has already successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Corazon is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Corazon from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchasing additional products to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth S. is from the village of Iligan City. She is 52 years old. Elizabeth is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Elizabeth owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Elizabeth has been engaged in her business for more than four years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Elizabeth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Elizabeth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Elizabeth is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Elizabeth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn B. is a hardworking lady who lives at Barangay Cataggaman Viejo Tuguegarao City. She is 42 years old and married. Her husband is a local operator of motor transport in their village. They are blessed with two diligent children: Avelino, 22 years of age college graduate, now working in Globe as a retailer and Randy, 18 years old, college student taking up Information Technology. She is a responsible mother and helps her husband in supporting their daily needs through her direct selling business of kitchen utensil products. 

Analyn wanted to request for an additional loan from the KIVA lenders amounting to Php 10,000. She will use the amount to purchase more kitchen utensils, and other products that she can offer to her customers. She believes that the more capital she will roll in her direct selling, the higher the income she could get.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell

loans.name: Nkechi

texts.en: Nkechi is 39 years old, married with five children. Her husband is a businessman and he also supports the household. Her children are excelling in school and they attend a government school. Nkechi sells melons at wholesale and retail prices to her customers.The machine besides her is used to break the melon. Melon is used in Nigerian cuisine in the preparation of 'egusi' soup. The demand for her melons is high and she hopes to meet the demand of her customers. She is requesting NGN100,000 as a loan to purchase more melons to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more melons to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of merchandise and livestock (electric appliances, hardware, cleaning supplies)

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es:
El Sr. Edwin  vive en la calle Caupolican zona Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz.

Vive en alquiler junto a su familia. El señor trabaja con movilidad propia en el Sindicato Eduardo Avaroa, linea de colectivos 2; mantiene a su familia con los ingresos que percibe de su movilidad.

El crédito lo destinará al arreglo y mantenimiento de su movilidad.

Este es su primer crédito con IMPRO; el análisis socio-económico le permite acceder a un préstamo.
texts.en:
Edwin lives on Caupolican street, which is in the Tembladerani area of La Paz. He and his family rent their home. He owns a bus which is associated with the Eduardo Avaroa transportation union, bus route #2. He supports his family with the income he earns from his bus. The funding will be used to service his unit. This is his first loan with IMPRO; the results of his socio-economic evaluation qualify him for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To service his bus.

loans.name: Agapita

texts.en: Agapita P. is a 55-year old married woman who lives in Purok Gilside, Barangay Nabulao, Sipalay City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating her general store and selling chainsaw parts. Agapita’s husband also helps in running the business. They have four children between 26 and 36 years old of whom two are already married, one is working, and one is a student. Agapita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon (NWTF-PD) in 1995 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in her general store. Now she earns an average monthly income of Php 6,000 from her business activities. Agapita is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of Php 29,500 was used to fund operations of her general store and chainsaw parts business and it had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing Php 29,000 as her 21st loan which she intends to use for her general store. Agapita is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her general store

loans.name: Hubertine Amélie

texts.fr: Née en 1982 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, K. Hubertine Amélie est mariée à SOSSOU Albert, un transitaire. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. La famille réside au quartier Agla à Cotonou, depuis environs 11 ans. Le couple assure ensemble les charges familiales. Hubertine Amélie n'a fréquenté que l'école primaire. Pour assurer les différentes charges qui lui incombent, Hubertine Amélie   vend des tissus et divers autres produits (riz, produits cosmétiques, etc.) à son domicile. Hubertine Amélie s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C'est depuis 15 ans que Hubertine Amélie exerce cette activité, et elle a déjà obtenu deux crédits qu'elle a bien remboursés auprès de ALIDé. Hubertine Amélie souhaite augmenter davantage le stock de ses produits et mieux répondre aux différents besoins de ses clients. Cependant, Hubertine Amélie ne réunit pas assez de fonds pour renforcer son activité. C’est pourquoi Hubertine Amélie sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un troisième crédit.
texts.en:
Née en 1982 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, K. Hubertine Amélie est mariée à SOSSOU Albert, un transitaire. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. La famille réside au quartier Agla à Cotonou, depuis environs 11 ans. Le couple assure ensemble les charges familiales. Hubertine Amélie n'a fréquenté que l'école primaire. Pour assurer les différentes charges qui lui incombent, Hubertine Amélie vend des tissus et divers autres produits (riz, produits cosmétiques, etc.) à son domicile. Hubertine Amélie s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C'est depuis 15 ans que Hubertine Amélie exerce cette activité, et elle a déjà obtenu deux crédits qu'elle a bien remboursés auprès de ALIDé. Hubertine Amélie souhaite augmenter davantage le stock de ses produits et mieux répondre aux différents besoins de ses clients. Cependant, Hubertine Amélie ne réunit pas assez de fonds pour renforcer son activité. C’est pourquoi Hubertine Amélie sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un troisième crédit.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Achat de tissus, de produits cosmétiques de riz etc.

loans.name: Xiomara Del Carmen

texts.es: La Sra. Xiomara R. es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, actualmente se desempeña como la encargada de la biblioteca de la Alcaldía de El Sauce donde tiene 11 años de laborar en dicho cargo. Ha obtenido seis créditos con Ceprodel los que le han beneficiado porque ha logrado mejorar su vivienda y brindar un mejor nivel de vida  a sus hijos. El crédito que solicita lo requiere para la compra de útiles escolares como libros, bolsos, accesorios y uniformes.
texts.en:
Xiomara R. is from El Sauce. She is in charge of the El Sauce Municipal Library; she has had this job for 11 years. She has had previous loans with Ceprodel and they have been useful to her because she was able to make home improvements and provide her children with a better standard of living. The funds requested now will be used to buy school supplies like: textbooks, bookbags, accessories and school uniforms.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy school supplies.

loans.name: Luis Armando

texts.es:
Luis Armando M. A.,  Labora como Vigilante en el Centro de Capacitación Profesional Nicaragüense Alemán Cecna de Managua, el tiene cuatros  hijos a su cargo,  y tres de ellos  se encuentran en edad escolar, es casado, ha trabajado dos créditos con CEPRODEL durante dos años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido un crédito en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL.  
El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: zinc, perlines, clavos y pintura, por lo que piensa cambiar  el techo de su casa ya  que este se encuentra en mal estado.
 Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.

Luis  dijo que los préstamos otorgados han sido para el mejoramiento de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Luis Armando M. A. works as a security guard at the Nicaraguan-German Training Center (CECNA) of Managua. He's married and has four children that he's responsible for, three of whom are school-aged. Over the past two years he has had two loans with CEPRODEL, and thanks to the financing he has received, he currently has a loan invested in the improvement of the house he lives in. He plans to use this loan to purchase construction materials including zinc, timbers, nails, and paint because he wants to replace his roof, which is in bad condition. He's doing all this so he can offer his children greater security and better living conditions. Luis says he has used the loans he has been granted to do home improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvement and expansion

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine F. is from the village of Artadi, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. She is 47 years old. Josephine is married and has 4 children. To make a living, Josephine owns & operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing transport services to local community members. Josephine has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Josephine joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josephine has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to renew the driver's license of her husband and to repair some parts of the transport vehicle used in the business. Josephine is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to modify some parts of her motorcycle unit and to expand the services provided. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Josephine from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to expand services provided

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan A. N. is 35 years old and married with six children. She lives in Lwanyange village, Nambale division, Busia District, Kenya. She sells fish in Nambale market. This business was started in the year 1997 as a source of income after her previous business in grocery sales failed.

Joan would like a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings which she will use to increase her fish stock to spearhead her an inch closer to economic empowerment at her family level. Her future plan is to expand and grow her business.

loans.use: To expand stock

loans.name: Mahussi Fohounvou

texts.fr: H. V. Mahussi Fohounvou  est née le 23 Mars 1974 et vit depuis vingt huit ans environs à Agata à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à KOTIN Pierre, un revendeur, Mahussi Fohounvou est mère de cinq enfants, tous scolarisés. Le couple a un autre enfant à charge, en plus de leurs enfants. Mahussi Fohounvou vient en aide à son mari et assure avec lui les différentes charges du foyer. Mahussi Fohounvou n’a jamais fréquenté l’école. Pour assurer ses besoins, Mahussi Fohounvou vend divers articles (savons de lessive et de toilette, sucre, lait, conserves de tomate et de sardine, couscous, riz, pâtes alimentaires, etc.) dans sa boutique située à Agata. Mahussi Fohounvou s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C’est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, qui rembourse bien ses crédits. Mahussi Fohounvou sollicite un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé, en vue d’élever le niveau de son activité et d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu.
texts.en:
Mahussi Fohounvou H. V. was born on the 23rd of March, 1974 and has lived in Agata, a part of Cotonou, Benin's administrative capital, for around 28 years. She is married to Pierre Kotin, a salesman, and is a mother of five school-aged children, and has another child in her care. Mahussi Fouhounvou assists her husband and helps him with the various household tasks. She never attended school, and now has a shop in Agata selling sells various products, including detergent soap, body soap, sugar, milk, tomato and sardine paste, couscous, rice, pasta etc. She sources her goods from Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. Mahussi has already received loans from ALIDé and has successfully repaid them all; she is now seeking a fifth in order to improve her living conditions and to boost her profits and revenues.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing various products (soap, sugar, rice, pasta, pastes etc)

loans.name: Romelie

texts.en: Romelie C. is from the village of Zamora. She is 29 years old, is married, and has four adult children. Romelie owns and operates a viand and snack-vending business, making and selling food in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month. In 2010, Romelie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 2nd from PMPC. Romelie plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en:
Epifania B., 60, is committed to making sure that her family has enough provisions to meet their daily needs and can live a better life. For the last several years, she has made a living by managing her own computer shop.

Epifania has been a member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year. She attends weekly fellowship meetings and pays   dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she has been able to take out several loans from CCT’s Cooperative. She is able to pay her bills on time because she has made good use of these loans to expand her business.     

To ensure continued growth of her small company, she has applied for a loan for PHP 20,000. She will use the money to buy new equipment and do needed repairs. She dreams that her business will continue to grow and be successful, and prays for good health so that she can enjoy many more years with her family.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy new equipment and make need repairs to a computer shop

loans.name: Gulziya's Group

texts.en: The lives of ordinary people seem to be as ordinary as the appearances of those people. However, we are not able to see the daily struggle of these people to earn their daily bread. Behind their usual expressions is hidden spiritual strength – determination to survive and achieve success in life. The heroes of our story are ordinary people but, given their mindsets and views, these people deserve special consideration. Gulziya U. is the leader of this group. She is 57 and has raised four children. Her husband works as a school teacher. Gulziya is also a school teacher but, besides that, she works in cattle breeding. Gulziya has long experience in raising cattle (12 years) and therefore does not have any difficulties in combining the two jobs. On the contrary, she is eager to work even harder as there are many things to be done. Gulziya always strives to improve her family’s living conditions. As soon as they obtained a piece of land from the state, she did not think twice and quickly started keeping cattle. After fattening the cattle, she is reselling them and buying more. Now her joint monthly income comes to around $211. Considering her initial investment of $45, she is doing pretty well! Gulziya hopes to obtain this loan to purchase fuel and sugar for making jam. Gulziya has many plans for the future. Very soon, she is going to make a grand repair of her house. Gulziya's partners: Saltanat A., 31, has two children. Her husband is occupied with farming and Saltanat sells vegetables and fruits. She needs a loan to pay for hay-cutting and tractor services. Munara J., 44, is the mother of three children. Her husband is a farmer. Munara works as a school teacher and is also engaged in farming. Munara needs this loan to purchase cattle for breeding. Mira B., 34, has two children. Together with her husband, she works at a gas station as an operator. Mira has applied for this loan to buy metal roofing for her house. ====================================== Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase fuel and sugar for making jam

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita A. is from the village of Upper Dicayas. She is 48 years old. Carmelita is married and has five adult children. Carmelita owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, & toothpaste in the local community. Carmelita has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 2,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2007, Carmelita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Carmelita is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & as working capital. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Carmelita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.
