loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & as working capital

loans.name: Aimable

texts.en:
Aimable is 26 years old and married, but does not yet have children. He has been selling used clothing in a market for the past seven years. He has been successful because he works hard and the clothes he sells are very different from those offered by his competitors. From the success of his business he has been able to buy health insurance for himself and his wife.
With this loan, Aimable hopes to increase his inventory of clothing. Eventually, he hopes to have a wholesale store and sell to local retailers.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Shahin

texts.en:
Shahin Q. is 33 years old and married. He has sold food products for the last three years and this is the only income for his family. The plans that he has for his family are to improve their living conditions. His monthly income is about 250-400 Azerbaijani New Manat (AZN). 

He wants to increase the sales of new products preferred by his clients. He applied for a 1,000 AZN loan to buy products such as bread, tinned goods, sweets and juices to grow his revenue.

loans.use: Purchase more food products

loans.name: Chineta

texts.en: Chineta V. is a married woman who lives in Prk. Lunas, Brgy. Kawit, Medellin, Cebu. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: buying and selling scrap (junk shop), a general store, and buying and selling firewood and charcoal. Her husband Merto V. Jr., who is 47 years old, works as a driver to earn his living. They have five children who are between 12 and 25 years old. Chineta joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2009 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past three loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Chineta has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her fourth loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000, which she intends to use to fund her business operations so that she could continue to save up for future business expansion. Chineta V. is a Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable") woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue in its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by visiting the NWTF lending team on Kiva to join our team.

loans.use: To funds business operations

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet P. is from the village of Commonwealth, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 30 years old, married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Juliet owns and operates a business venture in the services sector operating tricycle transport services. Juliet has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 12,400 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2008, Juliet joined Kiva partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juliet has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This loan was used to repair an existing vehicle in order to provide a better service. Juliet is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This loan will be her fourth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tires and other accessories

loans.name: Arkan

texts.ar: يبلغ اركان  من العمر 32 عاماً، متزوج، وهو يبيع المحروقات والزيوت للمنازل والأفران والمعامل في منطقة عالية. هذه هي المرة الأولى التي يطلب فيها اركان قرض من المجموعة وذلك بهدف شراء محروقات لتقوية المصلحة، بالإضافة إلى بيك أب (PICKUP) صغير للمصلحة. يعمل اركان لحسابه الخاص. من أهم المشاكل التي كانت تواجهه في البدء هي عدم معرفة الزبائن به، ولكن حبه لعمله وثقة الزبائن بخبرته، بعد تجربة نوعية بضاعته كانت نقطة قوته بحيث أن التعامل معه أكسبه رأس مال قوي، مكنه من شراء كم جيد من البضاعة. يحلم اركان بإمتلاك محطة محروقات كبيرة.
texts.en: Arkan is a 32-year-old married man. He sells fuel and oil products to households, bakeries, and laboratories in the Aley area of Lebanon. This is Arkan’s first loan request from Al Majmoua. The loan will help him purchase fuel and expand his activity. Arkan will also use this loan to purchase a small pick-up truck for his business, of which he is the sole proprietor. At the beginning, one of the most difficult challenges facing Arkan was building a clientele, but his love for his job and his customers’ faith in his experience, after having tried his products, was his strong point. Arkan managed to earn good capital, allowing him to purchase a sufficient amount of goods. In the future, he aspires to own a large fuel station.

loans.use: To purchase fuel products and expand his work, and to buy a small pickup truck for his business-

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos es un ganadero, tiene 46 años vive junto a su esposa y sus 6 hijos, reside en un lugar llamado las mercedes en el sauce. Él se dedica desde 20 años al trabajo de venta y compra de ganado por que su padre siempre se dedico a este oficio, pues lo desempeña muy bien, además cuando hay muchos gastos en su familia pues es un padre muy responsable. Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de ganando que es solicitado por sus clientes.
Él se proyecta a futuro con más oportunidades de crecer como ganadero y que sus hijos tengan acceso a la educación para que mejoren sus condiciones de vida en el futuro.
texts.en: Juan Carlos is a rancher. He is 46 years old and lives with his wife and their six children. He lives in an area called Las Mercedes in El Sauce. For 20 years, he has bought and sold livestock because his father was in this line of work, so he does it well. Also, there are a lot of expenses in his family, so he is a very responsible father. He is seeking a loan to purchase livestock for his customers. In the future, he hopes to have more opportunities to grow as a rancher and hopes that his children have access to education to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Rowenda

texts.en:
Rowenda L. is from the town of Banga. She is married and has two children aged 16 and 13. To make a living, Rowenda plants and harvests rice for sale. She wishes to see her children finish college and find decent jobs.

Rowenda joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen P. is from the village of Macabayao, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental.  She is 45 years old.  Helen is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Helen owns and operates a business raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting coconuts for sale.  Helen has been engaged in her business for over 19 years and earns approximately 700 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Helen joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Helen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC.  This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business.  Helen is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure.  This loan will be the third loan taken out by Helen from GDMPC.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure,

loans.name: Silvia Estela

texts.es: Silvia Estela A., es una mujer muy esforzada y responsable, la cual reside junto a su hijo en San Juan Opico, lugar en el cual posee su negocio gracias al cual cuenta con ingresos necesarios para poseer una vida digna. Ella trabaja en su tienda, en la cual comercializa productos alimenticios y de uso domésticos, su negocio tiene 3 años de estar establecido, tiempo en el cual Silvia a tratado de surtirlo con todo lo necesario y más esencial para percibir buenas ganancias. Silvia solicita un préstamo a Integral por medio del cual cuente con el dinero necesario para surtir la tienda y de esta forma brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes de forma que estos la prefieran en todo momento.
texts.en:
Silvia Estela A. is a very hard-working and responsible woman who lives together with her son in San Juan Opico where she has a business which provides her with the necessary income to lead a decent life.  She works in her store, in which she sells food and convenience store products.  She has had her business for 3 years, during which time she has tried to stock it with all the most essential and necessary products in order to make good profits.

Silvia is requesting a loan from Integral so that she can have the necessary money to stock her store and thereby provide a better service to her customers in order to gain their loyalty.

loans.use: To buy convenience store items

location.town: San Juan Opico, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Yan

texts.en:
Mr. Yan M. has spent his life cultivating crops in  Pnom Penh City. This is a skill he learned from his grandparents when he was young. Mr. Yan M. is now married and has six children; five are single and the other one is married. Three of them are employed as  workers in a factory and have a formal salary. His wife works in the farm fields frequently alongside him. 

Growing crops is an annual endeavor with which he has had great success. Mr. Yan M. is able to plant the crops at least twice a year, using both rainy and dry seasons. The coming rainfall will be good for his crop, however, Mr. Yan M. doesn’t have capital yet to use on his farm. So, Mr. Yan M. is looking for a loan to use towards purchasing fertilizer, a pump, and seeds for planting.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, a pump, and seeds for planting

loans.name: Heart Of Jesus Group

texts.es:
|Es  un comité conformada por 10 mujeres de  Ybycui, todas ellas se encuentran trabajando en distintas areas del negocio,  son un grupo que ya tienen experiencia en trabajo de  grupo.
La presidenta es la señora Amelia M., vienen preparando milanesa para la venta, el resto de los miembros vienen realizando actividades similares a esta, el grupo tienen la intencion de crecer y agradecen la oportunidad  brindada por la fundacion Paraguaya.
La señora Amelia quiere preparar gran cantidad de comestibles y salir a vender y salir a vender ya que hay mucha concuerrencia de gente por el centro de la ciudad.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de carne para la preparación de comestibles.
texts.en:
This group is made up of 10 women from the community of Ybycui. They all work in various business types. They have all worked in groups before. 

The leader of the group is Amelia M.. She makes hamburger patties for sale. The rest of the members carry out similar businesses to this one. The group's intention is to grow and expand the community that has come together thanks to Fundacion Paraguaya (Kiva Field Partner). 

Amelia wants to prepare a large quantity of prepared foods to sell in the downtown area of the city for the great number of visitors.

She requests a loan to purchase meat to prepare her foods.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients.

loans.name: Souk

texts.en: Mrs. Souk P., 48 years old, is a villager who lives in Khpob Veaeng village in Kandal province. She earns her living by two businesses which they are fish selling and vegetable selling in the local market. With her business, she stills earn less income to support her family.  In order to improve the family’s condition, she would like to ask for a loan to buy more vegetables, and more fish to enlarge her business activity. Her husband, Mr. Lor Oeun, 49 years old, works as construction worker. With their occupations, they are able to earn a little income to support the family. This couple has four children: two are seamstresses in the garment factory and the other two are attending school in the local village.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more vegetables, and more fish to enlarge her business activity.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 23 años,  convive con Cristian de 24 años. Ambos tienen dos  hijos Yanela y Dana, juntos viven en casa de sus padres. La actividad a la que Rosa es la venta de postres y aperitivos de acuerdo a la temporada en la que se encuentra, en invierno, leche asada y mazamorra, pero en actualmente que es verano, vende jugos, ya sea de naranjas o de otros frutos. Este negocio lo realiza en la puerta de su casa, y desde entonces le va muy, ya que muchos de sus vecinos gustan de estos alimentos que prepara, es más, la buscan los días que descansa. Está emprendedora mujer le gusta todo tipo de ventas, por ello en adelante,  piensa dedicarse también a la compra y venta de carros usados, para apoyar a esposo en los gastos del hogar, puesto  que él se fue a trabajar a una mina. Es el 11avo crédito con MFP, y como socia antigua de su banco comunal se siente agradecido por todo el apoyo que recibe, de la misma forma a sus a todas las personas que hicieron posible en brindarle el crédito. Rosa tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado, en la compra de bandeja de pirex y vasos, asimismo desea comprar repuestos y herramientas para reparar los autos e incursionar en este nuevo negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa, age 23, lives with 24 year old Cristian.  They have two children, Yanela and Dana.  They live in her parents’ house.  Rosa sells desserts and aperitifs according to the season.  In winter she sells “leche agria” (a dairy product similar to yogurt) and “mazamorra” (corn porridge).  Now that it is summer she sells juices made from oranges or other fruits.

She carries out her business in the doorway of her house, and it is going very well for her.  Many of her neighbors like the food she makes, and they seek out her food on their days off.  This enterprising woman likes all types of sales.  Later on she plans to also buy and sell used cars.  She will do this to support her husband with the household expenses because he has gone to work in a mine.

This is her 11th loan with MFP.  As a long-time member of her communal bank she is grateful for all of the support that she gets.  She is also grateful to all of the people who made the loan possible.  She plans to use the requested loan to buy a Pyrex tray and glasses.  She also wishes to buy replacement parts and tools to repair cars and venture into this new business.

loans.use: To buy a Pyrex tray and glasses.  She also wishes to buy replacement parts and tools to repair cars and venture into the trade of selling used cars.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Ms. Felicia is an old customer of our institution, who has been in the sewing business for 10 years and has established customers. Her main customers are public institutions, such as schools, for whom she makes uniforms. She will use this loan to buy fabric to meet an order from a company. To date Ms. Felicia has been given 15 loans. She says that this loan will improve her business providing her with a better standard of living. She owns her own house.

loans.use: to buy fabric, buttons, and sewing needles

loans.name: Badegna Group

texts.fr:
BADEGNA est un groupement de quatre femmes toutes mariées ayant en moyenne 40 ans, 5 enfants et vivant à dans des familles nucléaires avec leurs époux et enfants  à BOUGOUNI dans le quartier Massablacoura (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Les membres du groupe BADEGNA se sont connus à travers des liens de  parenté et de voisinage. 
Dans l’idée de trouver un fonds de commerce suffisante pour satisfaire leurs clientèles, elles ont décidé d’adhérer au programme de crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. 
Elles utilisent les prêts pour faire le commerce de céréales, d’articles divers et par Badibi S.  pour faire le commerce d’habillements.  Elles sont à leurs cinquièmes prêts dont tous les prêts précédents ont été remboursés correctement à l’échéance.
Avec ce nouveau prêt Badibi S.  la présidente du groupe, compte acheter,  20 complets (pantalons et chemises) pour garçon, 10 douzaines de complets pour enfants et  25 complets de filles.  
Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako chez les grossistes et effectue sa vente en détail à la maison et au marché, en espèce et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Avec ce prêt elle espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 15.000 FCFA  qui sera totalement réinvesti dans l’activité.
texts.en:
BADEGNA is a group of four married women who, on average are 40 years old, have 5 children, and live with their husbands and children in Bougouni in the Massablacoura (third largest administrative region in the republic of Mali). The members of the BADEGNA group met each other via families ties or living in the same neighborhoods. In order to find sufficient funds to satisfy their customers, these women decided to join the loan program at microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso.

The loan will be used to purchase large quantities of grains as well as other diverse products such as clothing for Badibi S.. This will be their fifth loan; the first four were reimbursed in a timely manner. WIth this new loan, Badibi S., the president of the group, plans to purchase 20 sets (shirts and pants) for children, 10 sets for children and 25 sets for girls. She stocks up in Bamako from wholesale vendors and sells the clothing from her home as well as in the market, both for cash as well as credit to customers composed of both men and women. She hopes this loan will enable her to gain monthly profits of 15,000 FCFA [approximately 32 USD] which will be fully reinvested her business.

loans.use: Purchase clothing

loans.name: Moeses

texts.es: Moeses, es natural del distrito de kimbiri, tiene 38 años de edad, es un joven muy alegre y trabajador, convive con Virginia de 31 de edad y tienen 03 hijos y juntos viven en su casa propia en la localidad de Vista Alegre Alta anexo del distrito de Kimbiri. Moeses, es un hombre de mucho lucro, se dedica con mucho esmero a la labor que realiza. Su trabajo consiste en labrar la tierra, es campesino y cuenta con 08 hectáreas de terreno; donde ha cultivado, plantas de café, hojas de coca y cacao; frutos nativos de la zona selvática del Valle Río Apurimac. Ha trabajado durante 10 años y en tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de los jornaleros; de esa manera extrae rápido los frutos y comercializa dichos productos a las empresas acopiadoras, quienes le remuneran muy bien por cada kilogramo de cada fruto que vende. Considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos desde la chacra hasta la ciudad de san francisco; lugar donde le ofrecen mejores precios por sus granos de cacao, café y hojas de coca. Con el crédito solicitado contratará jornaleros para que le apoyen en el desmonte de malezas que aquejan sus plantaciones. Pero ahora lo que más prioriza es comprar nuevas tierras para expandir sus sembríos y aumentar en su producción, para  así darle una buena estabilidad económica a  su  familia. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP esta dispuesto a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que desea acceder a otro crédito más adelante. En su banco comunal es un socio muy participe. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles solicitados, contratará jornaleros para que lo apoyen en el desmonte de malezas que aquejan sus plantaciones.
texts.en:
Moeses, a native of the Kimbiri district, is a happy and hardworking 38-year old young man who lives with his common-law wife, Virginia, 31.  They have 3 children and live in their own house in the Vista Alegre Alta area, part of the Kimbiri district.  Moeses is a man who does well.  He works his farm with great enthusiasm. He is a a farmer who has 8 hectares of land where he plants coffee, coca leaves, cacao, and native fruits of the tropical area of the Rio Apurimac Valley.  He has farmed for 10 years and during the harvest season, he uses day laborers.  This way he is able to pick the fruit quickly and sell these products to the wholesale businesses.  They pay him very well per kilo for each type of fruit that he sells.
What he considers the most difficult is transporting the products from the village to the city of San Francisco.  Here they offer the best prices for cocoa beans, coffee and coca leaves.  
With the loan that he is requesting, he will hire workers so that they can help him get out the weeds that infest his fields.  But now his priority is to buy new land to expand his crops and to increase his production to give his family stability.  This is the fourth loan with MFP and he is ready to make all the payments punctually, since he would like another loan in the future.  He is an active member of his communal bank. Moeses will use the 1000 new sols to contract day laborers to help him weed his fields.

loans.use: To hire day laborers to help him weed his fields.

loans.name: Yoni

texts.es: Yoni de 29 años, natural del distrito de Quimbiri; esta casado con Jenny de 25 años de edad y tienen 02 hijas Sharleni de 06 y Yasmin de 04 años, juntos viven en su propia casa situado en la comunidad de Nueva Esperanza caserío del distrito de Quimbiri. Desde muy niño sus padres le inculcaron a trabajar en la chacra es por ello que es conocedor del arduo trabajo en el campo, Yoni es campesino cuenta 05 hectáreas de terreno cultivados con plantas de cacao y café. Viene trabajando 07 años en sus propias tierras, en tiempos de cosecha cuenta  con el apoyo de los jornaleros quienes se encargan de cosechar y trasladar los frutos extraídos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar los frutos de las plantas; ya que así siente que los meses de arduo trabajo le brindan como recompensa la calidad de sus frutos. Considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos desde la chacra hasta los centro de acopio con animales de carga; el animal burro es su medio de trasporte haciendo un recorrido de 03 horas de caminata hasta llegar a los centros de acopio. Cuenta que la  estación de invierno no es de su agrado porque en estos meses abundan los insectos y las precipitaciones de las lluvias así impidiendo el rendimiento de su trabajo y perjudicando los frutos de sus plantaciones. Crédito solicitado es para la compra de abonos y fertilizantes para así mejorar sus productos; además en el futuro anhela ampliar sus plantaciones de cacao de manera tecnificada. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, y esta dispuesto a seguir cumpliendo con sus cronogramas de pago, ya que gracias a los préstamos que otorga la institución logrará adquirir muchos beneficios. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles solicitados, comprará abono, estiércol y fertilizantes, para mejorar la producción de sus plantas cacao y café.
texts.en:
Yoni, 29, is originally from the Quimbiri district. He is married to Jenny, 25, and they have two daughters, Sharleni, 6, and Yasmin, 4. They live in their own home, located in the Nueva Esperanza community, a village in the district of Quimbiri. 

From his childhood his parents taught him to work on the farm, so he knows the hard field work very well. Yoni is a farmer and owns 5 hectares of land with coffee and cocoa plants. He has worked in his land for 7 years. During harvest time he has the support of labourers who harvest the fruits and transport them. What he enjoys the most about his work is harvesting, as he feels that the quality of his produce is the reward for months of hard work. What he considers most  difficult  is transporting the produce on animals from the farm to the collection centres. He uses donkeys in the 3 hour walk to the collection centres.  

He says that he doesn't like winter, which brings insects and rain that hinder his work and damage his crops. The requested loan is to buy fertilisers to improve his produce. In future he would also like to expand his cocoa crops using machinery. This is his fifth loan with MFP and he is willing to fulfill the payment schedule, as the loans granted by the organisation will benefit him highly. With the 2.000 soles requested he will buy fertilizer and manure to improve the productivity of his cocoa  and coffee plants.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer and manure to improve his cocoa  and coffee crops.

loans.name: Francisco Jose

texts.es:
Francisco, tiene 28 años de edad, reside en Concepción Batres, departamento de Usulután, vive con su esposa y una hija de 3 años de edad, él se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, aprendió el oficio por su padre, y hoy en día este oficio es el que genera las ganancias para sostener a su familia.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para comprar ganado, el cual comercializara dentro de un tiempo, este negocio le permite obtener de cada venta su ganancia y el valor de los gastos incurridos en el cuido del ganado.
Espera mejorar el negocio, que las ventas sean provechosas y que su familia cuente con una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
28-year old Francisco lives in Concepción Batres in the department of Usulután with his wife and 3-year old daughter. He raises livestock for a living, work he learned how to do from his father. This is how he earns money to support his family.

Francisco is seeking a loan to buy more cattle which he will later sell. The profit from each sale will allow him to gain back the money he spent caring for the animals. Francisco wishes to improve his business and hopes that increased sales will allow him to provide his family with a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Clotilde Norma

texts.es:
Clotilde es socia del  Banco Comunal “Flor de Canela”, ubicado en el distrito y departamento de Puno, tiene 58 años de edad.  Es madre soltera y tiene 4 hijos.  Cuenta con estudios de primaria (incompleta). 
Viene trabajando   con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace ocho años,  su préstamo inicial fue de S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de prendas de vestir.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/ 1800.00 nuevo soles, comprará dos fardos de ropa americana de segunda mano como: casacas, chompas y  zapatos.  A veces la ayudan sus hijos.
Su sueño es tener un kiosco  para poder vender con comodidad (para no viajar).
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones, la puntualidad y la responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Clotilde  is a member of the community bank Flor de Canela [Cinnamon Flower] located in the district and department of Puno. She is 58 years old and a single mother with four children. She studied but did not complete primary school. 

She has been working with the Movement Manuela Ramos for eight years. Her initial loan was for 300 soles, which she invested in her business selling articles of clothing. With this new loan of 1800 soles she will buy two bundles of second hand American clothing like jackets, sweaters, and shoes. At times her sons help her. 

Her dream is to have a kiosk where she will be able to sell more conveniently, not having to travel. What she likes about the Community Bank include the meetings, the punctuality, and the responsibility.

loans.use: to buy two bundles of second hand American clothing such as jackets, sweaters, and shoes.

loans.name: Maria Antonieta

texts.es:
El Banco comunal se llama RENACER; Este Banco se encuentra situado en el Distrito de Huanchac, perteneciente a la Provincia y Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Maria, la socia tiene 29 años de edad, la socia es soltera y alterna sus actividades con el trabajo de personal de confianza en una joyería en un distinguido local en la plaza principal de la ciudad del Cusco, la socia desea el crédito para uso personal, ella prefiere no revelar el proyecto que tiene en mente por una cuestión de cábala. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en un gasto personal.

La socia se encuentra agradecida y desea expresar que cumplirá de manera  disciplinadamente con los pagos de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
The "Renacer" ("Rebirth") communal bank is located in the district of Huanchac, which is part of the province and department of Cusco. This borrower is Ms. Maria, who is 29 years old. She is single and divides her time between her daily activities and her work as a trusted employee at a jewelery store in a distinguished location in Cusco's main plaza. Maria would like a loan for personal use. For superstitious reasons, she prefers to not disclose the project that she has in mind. However, she is requesting the loan to invest in a personal expense.

Maria is grateful and wishes to convey that she will comply with her repayments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: with a personal expense

loans.name: 24 De Enero Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formó gracias a la Sra. Irma Elvira que vive en la ciudad D. Belen. El motivo por el cual la presidenta se esforzó en formar este grupo fue la D. querer ayudar a cada una D. ellas ya que todas tienen ganas D. salir adelante por todo el esfuerzo que están realizando en este pequeño lapso D. tiempo que llevan dentro del comité.
Encantadas aceptaron conformar el comité D. mujeres emprendedoras Nombrándolo Comité 24 D. Enero.
El comité cuenta con veinte (20) integrantes  en donD. todas tienen una pequeña actividad a la cual dedicarse por más pequeña que sea, las señoras se sienten muy emocionadas, la ayuda mutua entre ellas es constante y por sobre todo las inspira las ganas D. seguir luchando por sus familias, el trabajo en quipo y utilizando todos sus recursos disponibles hace D. sus luchas su mayor fortaleza.
Una D. las integrantes, Catalina, espera conseguir el crédito para poder comprar productos varios D. mercería y lencería al por mayor y destinarlos a la reventa a los negocios más pequeños como los almacenes, y así seguir con sus objetivos D. superarse cada día más.
texts.en:
This committee was formed thanks to Irma Elvira who lives in the city of B..  The reason why the group President put in such an effort to form this group was wanting to help each one of them because they all want to get ahead through all the effort they are putting into it in the short period of time they’ve been in the committee.  They gladly accepted to form a women’s committee that they called “Comité 24 D. Enero” (January 24 Committee.)

The committee has 20 members.  Each has a small business to dedicate herself to regardless of its size.  The women feel very excited; mutual help among them is constant and, above all, they are inspired by the desire to continue fighting for their families, working as a team and using all available resources makes their struggles their greatest strength.

One of the members, Catalina, hopes to get the loan to buy various notions and lingerie at wholesale to resell to smaller businesses, like stores, thus attaining her goal of improving more each day.

loans.use: to buy notions and lingerie.

loans.name: Adolfo Francisco

texts.es:
Este cliente reside en esta ciudad capital   de Managua, el señor Adolfo Francisco se ha caracterizado por ser un hombre honrado  trabajador con buenos valores morales como persona, debido a que ha sabido  ganarse el aprecio de sus  compañeros de labores. 
Hace unos días se presento ante las oficinas para solicitar un crédito para ser invertido en la compra de materiales de construcción como es   arena bloques cemento hierro, estribos, alambre de amarre  para ser utilizado para ampliación  de su vivienda.
texts.en:
This client lives in the capital city of Managua. Adolfo Francisco is an honorable and hard-working man with good morals and values. Because of this, he has earned appreciation from his coworkers. 
A few days ago, Adolfo came to the office in order to request a loan. He wants to invest in the purchase of construction materials like sand, cement blocks, iron, supports, and wire ties to expand his home.

loans.use: improve his home.

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en: Ligaya, a 55-year-old married mother of  two children, has a food shop in the Philippines that sells breads and rice cakes and serves coffee, chocolate drinks and milk. In business for five years and a new member of HSPFI, Ligaya is requesting a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more breads and coffee.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy breads and coffee.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace, 44 years old, is a widow and a mother of six children aged between 16 and 25 years old. She has been supplying rice wholesale for three years. The business earns her a monthly income of KES 50,000.

This is Grace's third loan term with KADET LTD and she has successfully managed to repay her previous loans. She will use the loan funds to buy ten bags of rice for resale. Grace hopes to educate her children and have a truck for supplying rice in the future.

loans.use: To buy 10 bags of rice

loans.name: Ablawa

texts.fr:
Ablawa est une femme âgé(e) de 24 ans. Elle est célibataire. 
Ablawa travaille comme revendeuse de produits de beauté (mèches, tissages) depuis 2009. Elle vend à toutes personnes. Elle achète les produits à Lomé 
Ablawa a requis son premier cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des mèches, des tissages.
texts.en: Ablawa is a 24-year-old woman who is unmarried. She has been working as a seller of beauty products (hair extensions, weaves) since 2009. She sells to anyone. She purchases her products in Lomé, the capital of Togo. Ablawa has requested her first loan cycle with WAGES in order to buy hair extensions and weaves.

loans.use: to buy beauty products and hair extensions

loans.name: Rani's Group

texts.en:
Rani has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. Her husband is involved in the construction supplies business. He has a good number of business contacts who come to buy construction supplies from him due to the good quality of the items he sells. With the loan, he will buy construction supplies in bulk to be able to meet the requirements of his customers and earns better profits. 

Rani is a housewife and takes care of her family by staying at home. She manages her household responsibilities and makes the utmost effort to provide comfort to her family by fulfilling their needs. 

She is hopeful that her husband’s business will be established further after making the loan investment into it.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies

loans.name: Chandy

texts.en:
Chandy, 51 years old, is a housewife. Her husband is a soldier with $3 per day as his income. She has four children; one is studying and the other three are working. Their income is $4 per day, each. Every month, she has to spend $100 on food, $10 on electricity, $15 on school fee, and $10 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $1200 to buy a motorbike for her husband to use to travel to work. Before, she used to sell groceries at home but she quit, and now she wants to start this business up again when she has enough money to open her shop. As for her children, she will support them to study at least to finish high school

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband to use to travel to work.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is a 54-year-old widow with six children. She owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. Since her husband died, she has been solely taking care of the family. She has been operating a hardware shop for 16 years. She got the initial capital from her late husband’s salary. Her hardship is the high revenue and her vision is to have a bigger wholesale shop and to educate her children. Rebecca needs the loan to buy different types of nails to sell.

loans.use: To buy different types of nails to sell.

loans.name: Elsa Mabel

texts.es:
Elsa Mabel de 48 años de edad, vive con su familia en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio de aua y luz, ubicada en la zona urbana del distrito de Guadalupe que pertenece al departamento de La Libertad.    Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, gandera y turismo.

Elsa Mabel la actividad que realiza es el alquiler de cabinas de internet, negocio que lo ha colocado en su mismo domicilio por seguridad de sus bienes, con una experiencia de 3 años, su mayor clientelas son  escolares que acuden en busca de información para realizar sus tareas como para jugar y con los ingresos que obtengan podrá solventar sus gastos familiares.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para la compra de tarjetas de videos para que jueguen los niños y brindar mantenimiento a sus máquinas, para seguir brindando un buen servicio como hasta el momento, con la intensión de atraer más clientes; lo que le permitirá pagar su crédito otorgado y mejorar su nivel de vida.  Elsa Mabel es una mujer trabajadora que con mucho esfuerzo a llegado a adquirir sus cosas para seguir sacando a su familia adelante.
texts.en:
Elsa Mabel, 48, lives with her family in their own house that has water and electricity.  It is located in the Guadalupe district, La Libertad department.  This is an agricultural, cattle-raising and tourism area.

Elsa Mabel has an internet cafe.  She has had experience in the business for 3 years and for the safety of the equipment, she has installed the business in her own house.  Her main customers are students who are doing their homework or for games, and she uses the earnings to cover family expenses.

She has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternative of 100 new sols to buy video cards so that the  children can play, and for equipment maintenance.  She wants to be able to continue offering good service as she does now, so that she attract more customers.  This will allow her to pay off the financing and improve their standard of living.

Elsa Mabel is a hard-working woman and with great effort has succeeded in getting her family ahead.

loans.use: to buy video cards and to cover maintenance of her computers

loans.name: Tu

texts.en:
Tu is a 34-year-old widowed woman. She lives with her children, one son and one daughter, in Ho Chi Minh City. For the last three years she has operated a food stall selling meals to people in her community.
Tu would like a loan to purchase new furniture, good quality food and rice in bulk. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 
She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase new furniture, food and rice for her stall.

loans.name: Medetkan

texts.ru: Медекану 58 лет, женат, имеет 4 детей. Медекан всю жизнь занимался фермерством  - животноводством и полеводством, и имеет богатый опыт в этой сфере.  С 2010 года, Медеткан занялся разведением и перепродажей скота, использовав при этом свой стартовый капитал в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день, его хозяйство, насчитывающее 10 коров, 7 лошадей,  10 коз, дает прибыль около 8,000 сом в месяц. Дополнительно, Медеткан предоставляет услуги тракториста местному населению в период полевых работ, что служит неплохим источником дохода для его семьи. Для дальнейшего развития всего бизнеса, Медекан обратился в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. С помощью доходов от кредита, он планирует завершить строительство дома, а в будущем – купить трактор.
texts.en: Medetkan is 58 years old, married and has four children.  He has been involved in farm work - animal husbandry and farming - all of his life and has a rich experience in this field.  Using a capital of 20,000 som (KGS), Medetkan became involved in breeding and reselling livestock in 2010.  Today, his farm, containing 10 cows, 7 horses and 10 goats, yield a profit of about 8,000 som per month.  In addition, Medetkan provides a tractor driving service to the local residents during the period of farm work, and this activity serves as a not-so-bad source of income for his family.  In order to further develop his business, Medetkan requested a loan in the sum of 70,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai Tushum and Partners" company to buy livestock.  He plans to complete the construction of his house with the help of this loan and buy a tractor in the future.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Apolinaria

texts.en:
Apolinaria is a hard-working entrepreneur who has an egg  selling business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase more boxes of eggs to sell in her stall.

Apolinaria has been in this business for nine years. Apolinaria earns more income from her general store.

Apolinaria has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She hopes to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more boxes of eggs to sell in her stall

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy wheat flour, sugar, milk and yeast.

loans.name: Nyash Group

texts.en:
Philomina is a hardworking woman aged 39. She is married with five children aged 19, 15, 10 and twins aged 7. They all attend school. She also takes responsibility for one further dependent.

Philomina makes peanut butter and has one peanut butter-making machine.  Currently, she has no employees. She has been in business for the past two years now. Philomina is requesting for a loan from Microking Finance  to purchase nuts from the communal farmers in Mvuma to make peanut butter for sale. The main challenge is that groundnuts are very expensive and seasonal. Also there is an increasing number of people who are making peanut butter. She sees herself with five peanut butter-making machines, employees and also having her own grinding mill for maize in the next five years.

This loan should enable her to pay fees for her children and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To buy groundnuts from communal farmers in Mvuma

loans.name: Tserendejid

texts.en: Tserendejid is 47 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her husband is an electrician and her daughter is a clerk. Tserendejid started her grocery retail business in 2008 by renting a counter in the market. Lately, her business is slowing down due to the market environment. Therefore, she decided to move her business to another market. Her new counter is big; therefore her old products are not quite enough to run a business. Tserendejid is a sharp and hardworking woman who is requesting 1,700,000 MNT to purchase products to sell.

loans.use: to purchase products to sell.

loans.name: Helena

texts.pt:
Nasceu Distrito de Boane, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, casada e mãe de 3  filhos 2 dos quais casados e 1 ainda frequenta a Escola. Fez a 10ª classe e parou por falta de condições financeiras pela parte dos seus pais. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta mais uma sobrinha que vive com ela. 

É agente de serviço na E.P.C Barragem dos Pequenos Libombos ha mais de 10 anos e tem um salario de 2.495.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Já teve emprestimo noutro banco(BIM) e conseguiu pagar sem dificuldades.Conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu terceiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para a obra da sua casa ( barrotes, pedra, cimento, areia, ferro e outros). Os primeiros emprestimos foram  de: 10.000.00mt, e 15.000.0mt, ambos para habitação.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende concluir a obra da sua casa mobliar e investir nos estudos da sua filha, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Helena was born in the district of Boane, in the province of Maputo in southern Mozambique. She is married and has three children, two of whom are married and one of whom is still in school. She went to school through the tenth grade but had to drop out because of her parents' financial difficulties. She lives in her own home with her family, and also supports a niece who lives with them.
She's worked at the Pequenos Libombos Dam for more than 10 years and earns a salary of 2,495 meticals a month. She uses her earnings for household expenses and is able to save some in her bank account (BIM). She had a loan from another bank (BIM), which she paid off without any problems. She learned about Hluvuku from a friend who is also a client of the institution. This is her third loan, in the amount of 15,000 meticals, which she will use to buy construction materials (beams, stone, cement, sand, iron, etc.) to build her house. Her first loans were in the amounts of 10,000 and 15,000 meticals, both of which she also used for her home. She is committed to paying off this loan without any problems and in the future intends to ask for further loans from Hluvuku to finish and furnish her house and pay for her daughter's studies.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (beams, stone, cement, sand, iron, etc.) to build her house.

loans.name: Seynabou

texts.fr:
Mme Seynabou  est une femme de 53 ans très brave et très active. Elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle fait du commerce depuis plus de 25 ans. Elle a démarré par la vente de poisson puis s’est lancé après une longue rupture à la vente de légumes.
Avec le crédit, elle veut  acheter en grande quantité du poisson séché pour le revendre dans le marché local. 
Elle réinvesti dans son petit commerce les bénéfices de son activité puisse qu’elle n’a pas de charges  familiales.
texts.en:
Seynabou is an active and reliable 53-year-old. She is married and the mother of 3 children. She has been active in commerce for over 25 years. She began by selling fish and then, much later, started selling vegetables.

Seynabou will use this loan to buy a large amount of dried fish for resale at the local market. Because she is not responsible for any household expenses, she is able to reinvest her profits into her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to resell

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.en:
Jenifer is a married woman having three children. Jenifer is 33 years old, residing at Taguitic, Kapatagan, Lanao del Norte: Philippines. 

Jenifer is starting a business venture, selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community to earn a living. She's been in this business for 3 years. Each month, she earns 6,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional fish to sell. Jenifer has been a member of GDMPC for a year. In the future, Jenifer wants to make improvements to her business venture.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 48 years old, married with four children.  To earn a living, she sells cereals.  She has been in the business for seven years.  She also sells milk to supplement her income.  Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to grow her business because she has been trained on business management skills.
Catherine has requested 30,000 Kenya shillings to add stock of maize, beans, rice and peas.

loans.use: To add stock of maize, beans, rice, and peas

loans.name: Pius

texts.en:
Pius is a 40-year-old married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a shop where he knits and sells clothes. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a populated area. 

Pius describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital for expansion. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase more needles and material. This is his 2nd application for a loan with SMEP DTM, the previous being a loan of Kes 10,000 that he repaid successfully.

loans.use: to purchase more needles and material.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce was born 43 years ago in Gathiga, Lower Kabete in Kiambu Kenya. She is married with five children. Her first born is in her final year in Kirigiris Nursing College. Her second born is schooling in Uganda at St Kizito High school while the third born is at St Austin University, Kenya. All others are in primary school. Joyce has been a youth matron for many years. She is a member of Catholic Women Association. (CWA)-Gathiga Catholic Church. Joyce started business by selling porridge in Marigiti in Nairobi; she later opened a retail shop in Mwimuto in Kiambu. The business grew and later they bought a cab which started operating in Nairobi Central Business District. Some years back, she was transporting potatoes from Kinangop Kenya to sell them in Nairobi. While doing her business, she would save by buying dairy cows; right now she has seven and sells milk to Nairobi Hotels. Last week she opened a milk bar on Kirinyaga Road Nairobi and it is doing well so far. Her desire is to satisfy her customers’ needs to make sure that there is milk all the time. She joined WEEC in 2002 and in 2004 she received a loan of USD 715 and paid it in time.

loans.use: Joyce wants to improve her business premises and buy more milk from other suppliers to meet the demand.

loans.name: Faatolu

texts.en: Faatolu, aged 43 years, is divorced with 5 children. She has a taro plantation business and aims to expand it. Her parents were doing the business but when they passed away years ago she continued growing taros to keep the business running. Faatolu’s husband went to New Zealand to seek employment to support his wife and children, but never returned to Samoa and abandoned her and her children. Faatolu had a difficult life trying to cope with what happened and bring up her children alone. The 5 children’s education was all financed by her taro plantation. Ever since Faatolu took over, the farm has expanded little by little and has now covered their 3 acres of land that was not being used. She is a serious woman and dedicated to her business to her parents. She will create employment opportunities within her business for her children when they can’t find a job.

loans.use: Buy organic fertilizers, pesticides, and knives

loans.name: Id

texts.en: Mr. Id P. works as a private driver in Phnom Penh, earning an average of $5/day.  His wife (pictured here) and their 4 children live together with him in Phnom Penh.  All members of the family work, and their combined household income is about $12/day.  This loan will be used to help buy a car so Id P. doesn't have to spend money renting one daily.  In the future, he plans on being a driver, as the ownership of the car will give him significantly more income.  He also hopes to build a house for rent, which will eventually be given to his children.

loans.use: To buy a car for his business

loans.name: Otilia

texts.es:
Otilia is a widow and has three daughters, one of which helps her sell her products in her workplace amongst her workmates. When Otilia widowed she found the need to obtain a better income to support her three daughters. Her husband's pension was not sufficient to cover her daughter's expenses, which started increasing as they got older. She heard a catalog sales add over the radio and decided to give it a try. Since then, she has created a solid client portfolio and people recommend her a lot since she has good products.

Otilia is requesting a US $275 loan to be able to purchase merchandise and fulfill her current orders. She also wants to keep some stock for future orders in order to shorten their delivery time. She offers to pay the loan back in three months and greatly appreciates your support - which hill help her continue with her business' growth and better her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Otilia es una mujer viuda, y tiene 3 hijas, de las cuales una de ellas la ayuda ofreciendo los productos de su mamá en su lugar de trabajo entre sus compañeras, al quedarse viuda Otiia se vio en la necesidad de obtener mejores ingresos para poder mantener a sus tres hijas, ya que la pensión que recibía de su esposo era insuficiente para poder cubrir con estos gastos que eran cada vez mayores según iban creciendo sus hijas. Escucho por radio los anuncios de las ventas por catálogo y fue así como se decidió a incursionar en el mismo, ahora ella ya tiene una cartera de clientes fijos y cada vez la recomiendan más por que sus productos son buenos.

Otilia está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 275 para poder comprar mercadería y surtir los pedidos que tiene actualmente, así como para tener stock para los futuros pedidos que tenga y proporcionar de productos en tiempos más cortos, ella ofrece pagar el préstamo en 3 meses y agradece mucho el apoyo que le des para poder continuar con el crecimiento de su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Alie

texts.en: Alie T. is twenty-five years old and married with a child.  He runs a small kiosk selling various essentials in Magburaka town.  Mr. T. plans to develop the kiosk into a shop on the outskirts of town.  His previous loan helped to build the small shelter for his business. He is requesting an additional  $175 to further expand the business.

loans.use: Expansion of kiosk selling essential items

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is 43 years old and a widow with 7 children. She is the sole breadwinner for her family. With her previous loan, Marie was able to expand her business so as to pay her children’s school expenses and feed them more easily. She always praises SMT for the loans. She said, “I do not know how I could feed my children if I did not get loans from SMT”.

Like many widows and other poor women who received loans from SMT, Marie can now serve her children with at least two meals a day. She will complete paying her last installment of the current loan next month and would like to take another loan to increase her stock of food items for sale.

loans.use: To purchase additional food items to sell in Kabala town

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase her current stock of tomatoes and cabbages.

loans.name: Thi Ngai

texts.vi:
Ms Ngãi is 24 years old. She is married and has 1 daughter. She and her husband run a coffee shop in the town of Chờ for the last 6 years. Most of their clientele comes in the evening, especially during the weekend evenings. Their revenue from the coffee shop is stable. Before they have contracted a loan from the bank to expand their coffee shop. This time Ngãi has applied to BinhMinh fund (SEDA) for a loan to buy coffee, sugar, milk & cream for their coffee shop. She is eager to receive the loan and she will pay it back according to the loan term.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Ngãi 24 tuổi, chị đã có 1 con gái. Hai vợ chồng chị bán cafe và nước giải khát ở Phố Chờ được 6 năm. Quán nhà chị chủ yếu bán hàng vào buổi tối vì khách hàng thường đông nhất vào buổi tối và đặc biệt vào các tối cuối tuần. Thu nhập của gia đình chị khá ổn định. Trước kia để mở rộng quán, gia đình chị cũng vay vốn của ngân hàng. Lần này, chị vay vốn của chương trình tài chính vi mô binhminh để phụ thêm vào mua cafe, đường, sữa cho công việc kinh doanh của chị. Chị rất mong sớm nhận được vốn vay và sẽ trả dần theo đúng thời hạn.

loans.use: To purchase stock for her coffee shop

loans.name: Akif

texts.en: Akif G. lives in Amirzeyidli village of Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. He is 52 years old, married and has three children. He has engaged in cattle-breeding.for the past 15 years.  He has  had three loans from Normicro Beylagan Branch and repaid them in a timely fashion. He is again applying to Normicro for a loan in the amount of $1000 to purchase 10 sheep and expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase 10 sheep

loans.name: Musa

texts.en: Musa T. is 29 years old and married with 2 children.  He sells drinks in Makeni town. Musa has been running the business for 3 years and his business has expanded as a result of the previous loans.  He is requesting more loans to expand the stock.

loans.use: Musa wants to use the loan to add additional variety of drinks to his drink shop to hopefully attract new customers.

loans.name: Chhe

texts.en: Mrs. Chhe S. is a 50-year-old widow and lives with her daughter in Muan Heur Village, Kampong Cham Province. She sells vegetables and other groceries, earning $1.25 per day. Her only child is married. S. asks for a $50 loan to purchase vegetables to sell. She hopes this investment will help improve her grocery business.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables to sell

loans.name: Khun

texts.en:
Khun S. P. is a 29 year-old mother of two from Kampong Cham province in Cambodia. She started a small business in 2007 selling groceries in Phnom Penh, and makes approximately $5 per day. Her husband works as a police officer and earns $2 per day. Together they support their family and pay for their older child to attend school.

Khun S. P. would like to borrow $1,100 to buy goods in bulk so that she can increase her profit margin and begin to expand her young business.

loans.use: To buy wholesale groceries in bulk for resale

loans.name: Zokirov

texts.ru:
K. Zokirov is 66 years old, he has a daughter who works in Khukumat in the town of Khujand. K. and his wife are retired, but K. is still able to work and at this time works as a security guard in a manufacturing plant in Layl. K. has three grandchildren, his oldest one has just recently married and K. wants to give the newlyweds a TV-set and an air conditioner. His small salary does not allow him to buy these kind of home appliances so he decided to apply for a loan with MicroInvest.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Зокиров Каюм мужчина в возросте 66 летимеет одну дочь , которая работает в Хукумате г.Худжанда.Сам Каюм и его жена пенсионеры , но Каюм еще в силах работать , и на сегодняшний день он работает охраником на заводе Лаъл. Каюм имеет 3 внуков, старшего внука недавно они женили , и поэтому Каюм для новобрачных хочет подарить телевизор и кондиционер, но за наличные он не может купить технику , т,к. его зарплата не велика.Поэтому он решил обратится за кредитом в Микроинвест.

loans.use: To buy home appliances

loans.name: Ann

texts.en: Ann S. O., 35, has owned a small stand since 2006, where she sells various kinds of stuff like shoes, light torches, ingredients, soft drinks, beer, and other household products for customers. On average, she makes $7.50 in revenue. Her husband, Hoeun Hon, has a big ice store in the village where he sells ice to the community, and earns about $6.50 each day. In Cambodia, most of the people buy ice from the ice store or ice vendor daily. They put ice into their clean water for their daily drink, and unlike the people in the city, they have their own refrigerator. Mrs. Ann S. O. would like to expand her inventory to meet her growing customer demand, as well as to generate more additional income.

loans.use: To expand her grocery inventory

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz is a humble mother who works selling sweets from a small store that she recently rented. She also lives there, as she still has not been able to buy a plot of land. Nonetheless, she has to travel to the city of Huancayo to help her uncle who is sick, and she would like to take advantage of the trip and buy sweets and merchandise that she can use to supply her business. For this reason she is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy more products. She asks that you trust in her work and honor.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Luz es una humilde madre de familia que se dedica a la venta de dulces en una pequeña tienda que acaba de alquilar, donde también vive, porque aún no consigue comprarse un terreno. Sin embargo, tiene que viajar a la ciudad de Huancayo para ayudar a su tío que se encuentra enfermo, ella desea aprovechar el viaje para la compra de dulces y mercadería que pueda implementar y surtir mejor su negocio. Por ello solicita el presente préstamo, con el que podrá adquirir sus productos, ella pide que puedan confiar en su trabajo y honradez.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for her business (selling sweets)

loans.name: Rahila's Tailoring And Clothing Shop Group

texts.en:
Rahila is 30-years-old, married with two children, ages 8 and 2, and has owned a tailoring and clothing sales business since 2002. She works from 5AM to 10PM and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Rahila has taken out one successful loan to expand her business. Rahila now requests a loan to buy more tailoring items and clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who also have businesses dealing with charcoal &firewood sales, bites sales,chicken sales, clothes and chips sales.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring items and clothes for resale.

loans.name: Palmira Lucas

texts.pt:
Palmira Lucas M. é natural de Manjacaze província de Gaza tem 51 anos de idade, viúva e mãe de 5 filhos com idades entre 37, 30, 27, 25 e 21 anos respectivamente, os dois últimos ainda são estudante ambos na 10ªclasse e os restantes já são trabalhadores. Para alem dos seus filhos também sustenta a sua mãe.

Palmira estudou ate 8ªclasse ainda jovem e parou por falta de condições onde foi a lar neste momento frequenta a 9ªclasse curso nocturno. Diz ela que muito cedo mudou se de cidade para Maputo no bairro suburbano Hulene na casa dos familiares. Neste momento vive numa casa própria. 

Palmira trabalha como secretaria e é funcionaria permanente a 31 anos, tem um horário de trabalha das 7:30 as 15:30, é formada em dactilografa, tem salário mensal de 2347,00mt e consegue poupar 1000,00mt por mes.

Este é o quarto empréstimo da Palmira na Hluvuku e primeiro no Kiva os dois primeiros destinou a compra de material de construção e o terceiro comprou congelador( 1º 6.000,00mt, 2º 10.000,00mt e 3º 10.000,00mt) este no valor de 12.000,00mt pretende continuar com a compra de material de construção. Tem como maior sonho concluir os seus estudos para melhorar o seu salário.
texts.en:
Palmira Lucas M. is a native of Manjacaze, in the Gaza province. She is 51 years old, a widow, and mother of five children, ages 21, 25, 27, 30, and 37. The youngest two are still students, both in 10th grade. The rest of the children work. In addition to her children, Palmira supports her mother.

Palmira went to school through 8th grade when she was young, then stopped because of financial constraints. Now she attends night school for 9th grade. She said that very early on she moved from the city to her relatives’ house in a suburban neighborhood of Maputo called Hulene. Currently she lives in her own house.

Palmira is a secretary and has been a regular employee for 31 years. She is certified in typing, and her work hours are from 7:30am to 3:30pm. She earns a monthly salary of 2,347 meticais (MTn) and is able to save 1,000MTn per month.

This is Palmira’s fourth loan with Hluvuku (Kiva’s Field Partner) and her first with Kiva. She used the first two loans (of 6,000MTn and 10,000MTn respectively) to purchase construction materials and the third loan (of 10,000MTn) to buy a freezer. She intends to use this loan in the amount of 12,000MTn to continue buying construction materials. Her greatest dream is to finish her studies to improve her salary.

Translated from Portuguese by April Newman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Djolévi

texts.fr: Madame A. Djolévi est née en 1967 à Gbavé (P/Lacs), mariée à un chauffeur, elle vit aujourd’hui à Amégnran avec ses 3 enfants. C’est une dame qui est très reconnue dans son entourage de par son activité. En effet, elle fait le commerce de céréales comme le maïs, haricot et mil. Cependant les charges du ménage ne lui permettent pas de jouir de ses profits. Son ambition est d’agrandir son commerce afin d’en profiter plus. Pour cela elle sollicite un financement.
texts.en:
Ms. Djolévi A. was born in 1967 in Gbavé (Lacs Prefecture). She is married to a driver and nowadays lives in Amégnran with her three children. This is a woman who is recognized among her friends and family for her work, which is in fact commerce in grains, such as corn, beans, and millet. Yet household expenses don't allow her to enjoy a profit. Her ambition is to grow her business to take better advantage of it. To do so, she is requesting financing.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock and sell grain

loans.name: Monica

texts.es: Mónica es una joven de 21 años, es soltera y vive en casa de sus padres. A su corta edad, realiza desde hace un año la venta de cosméticos por catálogo, negocio que le ha permitido lograr cierta independencia de sus padres y apoyar con algunos gastos de su hogar. El deseo de Mónica es seguir trabajando para  progresar y en el futuro poner un negocio más grande, es por eso que se toma muy enserio su trabajo dedicándole todo su tiempo libre, ya que también estudia, siendo lo más difícil alternar entre estas dos actividades. Es su primer préstamo en Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado adquirirá más cantidad de productos de belleza para comercializarlos y lograr mejores ingresos y así mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Monica is a 21 year old young woman. She is single and lives in her parents' house. At her young age, she has been selling cosmetics by catalog for a year. The business has allowed her to have a certain amount of independence from her parents and to help them with household expenses. Monica's desire is to continue working to progress and, in the future, to have a larger business. It is because of this that she takes her business very seriously, giving all of her free time to it. Since she also studies, the most difficult thing is to alternate between these two activities. It is her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. With the money she is requesting, she will acquire a larger quantity of beauty products to market and achieve higher income and therefore improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To acquire larger quantities of cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Nanga

texts.en:
M. is a very hard-working woman with five children. Since childhood, she has faced many obstacles in life because her parents were poor and could not send her to school after class six of primary school. Instead she had to go to work on the family farm and help to pay for the education of her younger sibling. She cannot read and write . Despite these limitations, she has set out to overcome poverty and provide her children with the education she did not have. She also hopes someday to go back to school herself.

With these goals in mind, M. joined GHAPE one year ago. So determined was she with her previous loan, which she used to buy land, that she has been able to build a house for herself and her children.

Given a loan, she plans to buy chicks, fowl feed, feeders, medication for fowls and seedlings for her farm. She is contributing 100,000frs CFA from her personal savings to the success of this her project. She plans to repay her loan in 12 months from the date of disbursement.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Purchase of chicks, fowl feed, feeders and seedlings

loans.name: Maria Alvina

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Bancomunal Niño Divino
Maria es del departamento de la Libertad provincia de Bolívar, su esposo murió hace cuatro años, ella tiene 38 años y tiene dos hijas de 17 y 4 años la mayor estudia en academia, sé esta preparando por que quiere ingresar a la universidad, Maria ha vendido fruta por doce años pero decidió cambiar de negocio por que la fruta mucho se malograba, hace dos años  ella alquilo un puesto en el mercado  empezó a dar desayunos, lonches y a vender ropa usada con la ayuda de su hija, Maria trabaja de 7 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche  todos los días.

Maria solicita un préstamo de Finca de 600 para invertir en compra de Cuetes, ropa usada, y alimentos para vender por fiestas navideñas, tiene dos años en Finca le gusta el compañerismo, también nos cuenta que aprendió a ahorrar. 
Uno de los sueños de Maria es tener un puesto propio en el mercado y darle una vida mejor a sus hijas y viajar a otro país
texts.en:
Maria is a partner of the Bancomunal Niño Divino. She is from the la Libertad district in the Bolivar province. Her husband died four years ago. She is 38 years old and has two daughters, ages 17 and 4. The oldest daughter is a student and would like to continue her studies at a university.

Maria sold fruit for 12 years, but decided to switch businesses because fruit rots easily. Two years ago, she rented a space in the market to serve breakfasts and snacks and sell secondhand clothing with the help of her daughter. Maria works from 7 in the morning until 8 at night everyday.

Maria is requesting a loan with FINCA of 600 soles to invest in the purchase of fireworks, secondhand clothing and food to sell during the Christmas celebrations. She has been with FINCA for two years and enjoys the feeling of camaraderie. She also says that FINCA taught her how to save money.

A few of Maria's dreams are to own her own stand in the market, provide a better life for her daughters and travel to another country.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy secondhand clothing and food

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson O. is 46 years old, married, and has two children. Currently both his children are in school. He lives with his family in Bawjiase, near Accra, the capital city of Ghana. Samson is a blacksmith and manufactures hoes, cutlasses, and sickles which he sells in nearby market squares to local farmers. He is not able to meet his customers' demand due to inadequate working capital.

The cost of his work tools and materials has also risen considerably. Samson is requesting a loan to purchase raw materials such as metal plates, an anvil, a blower, a Bedford frame, hummer, etc. to scale up production to meet demand. He hopes to raise more income and use the proceeds to expand his business and also support his family. He is a member of the community group called "Special Trust Group". In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loans and provide assistance to one another to handle repayment.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials such as metal plates, an anvil, a blower, a Bedford frame, hummer, etc.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Tous mariés, les membres du groupe Danaya de l’association Lafia  ont en moyenne 31 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des familles conjugales traditionnelles élargies à Tinimbougou, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro  république du Mali. 
A travers les relations de mariage, ces femmes se sont connues et font essentiellement l’achat vente des fruits et légumes.
Dans l’intention de développer leurs activités afin de satisfaire plus de clients elles ont décidé d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elles sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire. Les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Ces femmes comptent acheter avec ce prêt, 250kg de papayes, 130 kg d’orange et 50 kg de carottes. Elles achètent ces fruits dans les jardins de Tinimbougou et ses villages environnants pour ensuite les revendre sur le marché de Dioïla en détail, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Ces femmes espèrent avoir avec ce prêt, 10 000 FCFA de bénéfice chacune, qui leurs permettra d’améliorer les conditions alimentaires des enfants.
texts.en:
All married, the women of the Danaya group of the Lafia association average 31 years of age and 4 children. They live in extended traditional families in Tinimbougou, prefecture of Dioïla, Koulikoro region, Republic of Mali. They got acquainted through marital bonds, and their businesses mainly consist in buying and reselling fruits and vegetables. In order to bolster their businesses to satisfy a larger number of clients, they decided to join Kiva's partner, the microfinance organisation Soro Yiriwaso, from which they are seeking their third solidarity loan (group loan). Previous loans were repaid without problems.

These women intend to use the loan to buy 250 kilograms of papayas, 130 kilograms of oranges, and 50 kilograms of carrots. They buy these fruits and vegetables in the gardens in Tinimbougou and in the surrounding villages, to retail them at the Dioïla market, for cash or on credit, to a clientele comprising men and women. They hope to turn a profit of XOF 10'000 (ca US$ 20) each, to be used to improve the living conditions of their children, especially on the food front.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and retail fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Maria Maricela

texts.es:
La Sra. Maria M. se dedica al servicio de cortar pelo, aplicar tintes, secados de pelo, manicure, pedicure, maquillaje, peinados. ella tiene un salon de belleza, actividad la realiza hace mas de 5 años, ella es madre y tiene dos hijos, con los ingresos que le genera este negocio le permite manter a sus hijos que son lo mas importante en su vida, segun ella nos comento que sus hijos son lo mas preciado que tiene en la vida y que ella quiere darles todo para que ellos sean personas de bien.
su meta a corto plazo es poner otro salon de belleza en danli, esto le va a generar unoso gastos y contratar personal pero con eso va a lograr tener mejores ganancias y asi va a poder salir adelante.
texts.en:
Maria M. has a beauty salon: she cuts, dyes and dries hair, as well as offering manicures, pedicures, make-up and styling. She has had her salon for over five years.

She has two children. The business enables her to maintain her children, who are the most important thing in her life, and she wants to bring them up well.

Her short-term goal is to open another beauty salon in Danli, which will involve expenditure and hiring staff, but it should provide her with greater profits and enable her to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by John Rynne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy shampoo, dye, treatments, depilation wax, rinses, peroxide, scissors, oil and talcum.

loans.name: Bose

texts.en: Bose S. is 40 years old and married with 4 children. She sells sarongs. She travels to Cotonou to purchase sarongs to sell in Ogbomosho, Oyo State. She is requesting the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Abiba

texts.en:
Abiba I., 46, is the married mother of five children. Abiba is resourceful and enterprising: she has supported one child to graduation from high school through her business, and two more are presently in the junior high school. The rest are grown up, married, and living with their husbands.

Abiba and her husband, a farmer, live in a mining community. She operates a local restaurant and sells traditional local foods like "banku," which is prepared from milled maize grains, generally taken with hot pepper or soup. She has 20 years of experience in food production. She sells some of her food at a nearby pub in the community where she lives, and some of it is sold in the community's mining area.

Abiba reports that prices of raw materials have gone up significantly, and she is no longer able to meet her production expenditures. She needs the loan to enable her to inject additional capital into the business in order to scale up production and to maintain quality as well. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like maize, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood. She belongs to a village bank called "Hannah Mma," which means "Hannah’s children."

loans.use: To buy raw materials like maize, bags of rice, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

loans.name: Denise

texts.es:
La señora Denise, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Trabajadoras”, vive en el Jr. Mariscal Castilla  Cuadra 1, Distrito de Juanjui, Departamento de San Martín. Es conviviente, tiene 40 años y es madre de 03 hijos, dos de cuales estudian en un colegio secundario. Motivada por su experiencia en la crianza de gallinas se amino a convertir esto en un negocio, se inició en muy pequeña escala, invirtió los  S/. 300.00 del crédito que recibió, obteniendo muy buenos resultados por lo que continúa con este negocio hasta la actualidad, en su propia casa.
Con este préstamo de S/. 1500.00 que cancelará a un  plazo de 06 meses, comprará  80 gallinas ponedoras de huevos, vitaminas, alimento balanceados en sacos para mantener las aves sanas y gordas y puedan producir mejor. Hoy se siente muy feliz de la labor y servicio que brinda y agradece a Manuela Ramos por apoyar a personas como ella que quieren trabajar y salir adelante, espera que sigan así por mucho tiempo y ayuden a muchas familias y mujeres emprendedoras.
texts.en:
