Denise belongs to the “Las Trabajadoras” community bank. She lives at Jr. Mariscal Castilla Cuadra 1, Juanjui district, San Martín department. She is 40, in a common law marriage, and has three children. Two of her children are in secondary school. Motivated by her experience raising chickens, she turned it into a business. She started on a very small scale. She invested 300 PEN from a loan she received. She got very good results, and the business is still doing well. The business is located at her house. She will repay this loan for 1,500 PEN in six months. She will buy eighty egg laying hens, vitamins, and balanced food in sacks to keep the birds healthy, fat, and able to produce more. She feels happy about the work and service offered by Manuela Ramos. She is grateful that they support people like her who want to work and get ahead. She hopes Manuela Ramos continues to do so for a very long time and that they help many families and enterprising women.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chickens, vitamins, food for the birds

loans.name: Teodocia

texts.es:
Teodocia  es socia del Bancomunal Inmaculada Concepción.
Teodocia   es conviviente tiene 57 años, tres hijos, de 35, 34 y 27 ya están casados. 
Teodocia  no sabe leer, ni escribir, solo sabe sumar y restar, su papá no la dejo porque tenía que trabajar en la chacra, y cuando llega a Lima trabajo como empleada en casas, pero le pagaban poco.  Empezó como vendedora ambulante por dos años,  en un mercado, con los años  se compro un puesto en el mercado.
Teodocia necesita  un préstamo 2000 soles, para la compra de bolsos, medias, regalos, ropa interior para su bazar.
Desde que está en Finca Teodocia ha podido comprar su puesto propio, aprendió  a invertir  el préstamo que recibe aprendió a pagar puntual.
El sueño de Teodocia es tener su capital propio para no pedir prestado y construir su puesto de negocio.
texts.en:
Teodocia is a member of the Inmaculada Concepción (Immaculate Conception) Village Bank. She is 57 and lives with her partner. She has three married children, 35, 34, and 27. Teodocia does not know how to read or write, but only to add and subtract. Her father didn't let her learn because she had to work on the farm. When she came to Lima she worked in houses as a domestic, but got paid very little. For two years she started out as a street vendor in a market, and after some years bought a stand at the market. Teodocia is seeking a loan of 2000 soles to buy handbags, stockings, gifts, and undergarments for her stand. Since she's been with FINCA, Teodocia has been able to buy her own stand, and has learned how to invest her loans, and how to repay promptly. Her dream is have her own capital so she won't have to borrow, and to build her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy handbags, stockings, gits, and undergarments for her stand.

loans.name: François

texts.fr: Ce monsieur est un jeune célibataire très dynamique qui exerce comme activité la vente de pièces détachées, c’est avec le revenu de cette activité qu’il subvient  à ses besoins, il a commencé ce commerce depuis 2007, il s’approvisionne au marché local du port autonome de lomé. Son stock de pièces détachées est épuisé, il veut rehausser son stock et sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour se réapprovisionner en pièces détachées.
texts.en:
This gentleman is a young, single man, very energetic, who sells spare parts. The income from this business is what he uses to support himself. He began this business in 2007 and buys his stock at the local market of the autonomous pot of Lomé. His stock of spare parts is presently expended, so he needs to replenish it and has asked WAGES for his first loan to stock up on spare parts.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of spare parts for re-sale

loans.name: Sandra Yaneth

texts.es: Sandra Yaneth B. C. reside en San Luis La Herradura ubicado en el departamento de La Paz. Sandra tiene 28 años de edad, curso hasta  básica en la escuela; ella vive con sus padres  Don José de 64 años  quien se dedica a  la pesca y Doña Julia de 65 años de edad. Sandra se dedica a su negocio que consta de la venta de comida y bebidas en el muelle de La Herradura, el crédito lo solicita para surtir su negocio con variedad en bebidas y comprar materia prima para la elaboración de la comida. Sandra ya ha obtenido otros créditos de los cuales se encuentran cancelados en su totalidad y se ha mostrado como un cliente responsable en sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Sandra Yaneth B. C. resides in San Luis La Herradura, located in the state of La Paz. Sandra is 28 years old and went to elementary school. She lives with her parents Mr. Jose a fisherman and Mrs. Julia, who are 64 and 65 years old.

Sandra is dedicated to her business which is the sale of meals and drinks at the pier “La Herradura”. She is asking for a loan to replenish her business with a variety of beverages and ingredients to prepare the meals. Sandra has already obtained credits which are paid in full; she has been a responsible client with the payments.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria sells dried fish and other foodstuffs. She is 52 years old and married with 6 children. She hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more dried fish and foodstuffs to sell. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more dried fish and other foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Kory Tawaco Group

texts.es:
“Kory Tawaco” traducido al castellano significa jóvenes de oro, esta  denominación adopta un grupo de quince personas, que trabajan hace seis años junto a la familia de Pro-Mujer. 
Diferentes son los negocios de este grupo, como ser; venta de cosméticos, elaboración y venta de comida, confección de ropa deportiva, artesanía en tejidos, venta de artículos varios de forma ambulante y otros. La asociación Kory Tawaco desea ampliar sus ventas, para esto necesita de capital para comprar materia prima o insumos (Variedad de cosméticos, papa y verduras, telas y otros dependiendo el caso).
texts.en:
“Kory Tawaco,” which means golden youngsters, is the name of a group of fifteen people, who have worked with the Pro Mujer family for six years. The members of this group pursue different businesses, including selling cosmetics, making and selling food, making athletic clothing, producing weaving handicrafts, selling various products by traveling, and other businesses. The Kory Tawaco group wants to increase its sales, and for this, they need capital to buy raw materials and supplies, including a variety of cosmetics, potatoes and vegetables, fabric, and other items, depending on the business.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raw materials and supplies

loans.name: Ann

texts.en: Ann, a 38-year-old married mother of one child, lives in Warri, Delta State, Nigeria with her family. She sells drinks, and  hopes for the loan amount of N50 000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She thanks Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Lê's Group

texts.en:
Huệ Lê Thị is a 31-year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Huệ is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Cụm Đoài 2 (5).

Huệ is married and has 2 infants.  To making a living, she provides specialty tailoring services to members of the community.  Huệ has been in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3.500.000 VND a month.

Huệ joined SEDA in 2008 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Huệ has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3.808.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional fabrics and materials.  She is now requesting a 3rd SEDA loan for the same puporse, this time in the amount of 6.048.000 VND.


About the Other Borrowers in Cụm Đoài 2 (5) Group:

1.  Nguyễn Thị T. is a 58 year-old female requesting a 3.808.000 VND loan to support her specialized retail store.

2.  Nguyễn Thị B. is a 43 year-old female requesting a 6.048.000 VND loan to support her business making and selling food.

3.  Dương Thị B. is a 34 year-old female requesting a 6.048.000 VND loan to support her specialized retail store.

4.  Nguyễn Thị T. is a 35 year-old female requesting a 6.048.000 VND loan to support her specialized retail store.


About SEDA:
The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

loans.use: To purchase additional fabrics and materials.

loans.name: Hernarldo Jose

texts.es: Hernaldo José R. B. tiene 24 años, es un joven muy responsable y le gusta mucho su trabajo. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de productos lácteos. Hace más de 15 años que se dedica a esta actividad. Por lo que sus inicios nacen por su familia su Papa era el responsable del negocio, por lo que desde muy joven a prendió este oficio, muy responsablemente se hizo cargo que su hijo aprendiera este oficio que sería beneficioso en futuro, Por lo que aprendió a manejarlo arduamente. A pesar de las dificultades que enfrento como fue la competencia con otros comerciantes. El financiamiento que está solicitando es para capital de trabajo para la compra de leche, que será utilizada para la elaboración queso, cuajada, crema y leche agria. Su deseo es poder exportar sus productos para el exterior.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Las Canelitas Group

texts.es: El banco comunal “Las Canelitas” esta representado por la señora Zoila y conformado por 12 miembros muy unidos y activos, realizando confraternizaciones como celebrar cumpleaños D. alguna D. las socias para así  conocerse mas, también indicar que son muy ordenadas en sus reuniones que realizan. La señora Zoila  tiene como actividad la venta D. cosméticos, heladitos y hielo en su domicilio, El resto D. las socias se dedican a actividades como a la venta D. comida y a al realización D. empanada, costura y comercialización D. bolsones hechos a mano, zapatos, tostado y pastillas. La competencia hoy en día se ve más que en otros años pero lo importante es que ellas tienen clientes fijos y ellas siempre cumplen al pedido D. sus clientes, además tratan D. vender su producto a un menor precio minimizando sus costos y  generando una ganancia razonable para el sustento D. sus familias. El destino del crédito es para la compra D. cosméticos en baratas, harina para hacer empanadas y al compra D. materiales e insumos para sus negocios D. comida, zapatos y ropa. En cuanto a la experiencia crediticia los socios ya tienen experiencia en grupos comunales gracias a créditos similares en otras instituciones por lo que conocen la modalidad D. trabajo y saben como administrar bien los fondos otorgados.

loans.use: Capital de Operaciones

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn S. is from the village of Mialem. She is 25 years old and married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Jocelyn owns and operates a business fattening hogs to sell. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $70 a month for these activities. In 2008, Jocelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid previous loans from PMPC.

Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be her third loan from PMPC. She plans to use any additional revenue generated to improve her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Hog raising is the main source of income for Marilou's family. She is married to Edwin, who is a carpenter within their village. The couple is blessed with five children, namely: Ednalyn-16 years old, high school student; Analyn-14 years, high school student; Arlene-8 years old, second grade pupil; Jerwin-7 years old, first grade pupil; and John Jeric-2 years old. The couple wants their children to finish their schooling, that’s why they are striving hard for them to provide for their needs. 

Marilou needs funds for her hog raising business. In this regard, she is requesting a loan amounting to Php5,000 for the feed and maintenance of her pigs and some will be used for the repair of the pigs' pen. She is really praying that lenders will grant her request.

loans.use: additional capital for hog raising business

loans.name: Leonisa

texts.en:
Leonisa D. is from the village of Comon, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 50 years old, married and has six adult-aged children. She owns and operates a specialized retail business selling candy, beverages, junk food and more in the local community.  Leonisa has been in business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In June 2008, Leonisa joined HSPFI to access financial services, improve her living situation and engage in business. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI.  Leonisa is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP to purchase new items to expand her product offerings.  This loan will be her fourth from HSPFI.  She plans to use the additional revenue to supplement her family income. 
------------------------------------------
About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: Purchase more items to expand her business.

loans.name: Sawsan

texts.en:
Sawsan is a 23 year old woman who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon. Sawsan has owned a clothing shop for over a year. She sells scarves and clothes for veiled women. She has requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her shop. This is the first time that Sawsan has requested a loan. 
Sawsan does her best to suit her client’s needs. Her clients are women from her region. Sawsan decided on doing her business because of her experience in sales since she used to work as a saleswoman before she opened her shop.When she first started her business, she didn’t have enough cash to diversify her merchandise. In the future, she plans to keep improving her business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her shop.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is 42 years old, married and mother to seven children who are in school.  She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana.  Ama trades maize and supplies vendors in her community.  Ama also treks to nearby towns to supply customers.  Ama buys maize from nearby farmers. She has been in business for over twenty years and wants a loan to buy more bags of maize in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: Buy bags of maize.

loans.name: Licialan

texts.es:
La Sra. Licialan, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Lameñas”, Distrito de Lamas, Provincia de Lamas, Departamento de San Martín. Conviviente, tiene 49 años y es madre de 04 hijos, todos ya independientes.   

Licialan, como le dicen de cariño se dedica a la venta de chorizo y cecina, lleva 15 años realizando este tipo de actividad,  su trabajo diario lo realiza por las mañanas en el Mercado Central de su Ciudad y con su carisma y la buena atención que le caracteriza, sus clientes vuelven contentos y satisfechos.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, comprará insumos, para la preparación de sus cecinas, chorizos y rellenos. Parte del dinero, también lo invertira, para comprar materiales que utiliza en su negocio (cuchillos y balanza, etc), además para tener bien conservados la carne tendrá que comprar un congelador.

Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por apoyar a mujeres como ella que quieren trabajar y salir adelante, espera que sigan así por mucho tiempo y ayuden a muchas mujeres emprendedoras.
texts.en:
Licialan belongs to the communal bank "Las Lameñas." which is located in the Lamas province in the San Martín department. She is 49 years old, lives with a partner, and is the mother of 4 children who are all independent. Licialan, as they call her fondly, has been selling sausage and smoked meat for 15 years. She carries out this work daily in the mornings in the central market in her city, and with her characteristic charm and good service her customers come back content and satisfied. With this loan of 1,000 Peruvian soles, she will buy supplies used in the preparation of her dried smoked meats, sausages and meat fillings. She will use part of the money to buy materials that she needs for her business (knives and a scale), and part to buy a freezer to store her meat. She is very grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos organization for supporting women like her who want to work and get ahead; she hopes that they will continue to help enterprising women for a long time.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy supplies for the preparation of her smoked dried meats, sausages and other meat products

loans.name: Bolormaa

texts.en:
Bolormaa is a 39-year-old single mother who lives with her two daughters in an apartment in Darhan-Uul province, Mongolia. Her oldest daughter is unemployed and her youngest is in secondary school.

Bolormaa operates a shoe-repairing business which provides the only family income for her. She began her business in 1994 and since then has found much success with her business. As a result of her hard work and good customer service, her business is progressing day by day.

In 2009 Bolormaa began to partner with her sister in managing her business. Bolormaa is working hard in order to one day own her own workshop and buy new work equipment. She says, “I am working hard in order to save some money for my children.”

Bolormaa is requesting a 700,000 tugrug loan in order to purchase some necessary tools and supplies for her shoe-repair business.

loans.use: To purchase some necessary tools and supplies for her shoe-repair business

loans.name: Rosa Ines

texts.es:
Rosa Inés, es una mujer muy amorosa, vive en el Distrito de Calleria, región Ucayali, tiene 64 años, es madre de tres hijos que ya son independientes, ella se dedica a administrar su bodega, esta actividad la realiza en su casa, actualmente se encuentra separada de su pareja. Rosa Inés forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las activas”, desde hace dos ciclos, el primer préstamo que recibió fue de 300 soles, que fue invertido en la compra de mercaderías para abastecer su bodega.
Ahora ella necesita un crédito de 500 soles, que será invertido en la compra de diversos productos como arroz, azúcar, fideos, etc., para surtir su negocio. La meta de Rosa Inés es ampliar su bodega y seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Rosa Inés is a loving woman who lives in the District of Calleria, Ucayali Region. She is 64 years old, the mother of three adult children, and currently separated from her partner. Rosa Inés manages a store located in her home. She has been a member of the Communal Bank “Las Activas” (The Active Ones) for the past two loan cycles. Her first loan was in the amount of 300 soles and used to buy merchandise to restock her store.

She is now requesting a loan of 500 soles to purchase different products such as rice, sugar, noodles, and other items to increase her business. Her goals are to expand her store and continue working.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Flor De Mayo 2 Group

texts.es:
Este grupo esta integrado por 12 personas las cuales son : Jovita, Clarita, Alberta , Inocencia , Eloisa, Oralia, Julia, Faustina, Eliz, Elizabeth , Soledad y Julieta todas ellas viven en un poblado alejado D. la cabecera municipal en el estado D. guerrero, cada una D. ellas tienen sus pequeños negocios , Jacoba se dedica a la compra y venta D. pescado y verduras, Clarita y Alberta venden pescado, Inocencia venD. frutas, Eloisa y Julia son costureras, Oralia venD. dulces , Faustina, polL.; Eliz venD. en una cooperativa, Elizabeth venD. pan , Soledad, productos nutricionales y Julieta venD. accesorios para dama.

La señora Jacoba es casada tiene 5 hijos D. 18,17,14,11,y 10 años. Sabe leer y escribir aunque no termino la escuela, lo que  ella quiere es comprar diferentes frutas y verduras asi como ditistos pescados. Ya que no se surte mucho por sus gastos para  sus hijos  y lo poco que venD. lo termina  rapido, y ella quiere  comprar variedad para que venda mucho y tenga mas ganancia.

Es por eso que necesita el prestamo para invertirlo  en comprar  diferentes frutas y verduras asi como distintos pescados ya que asi tendrias mas ganancias y asi se  ayudaria mejor con L. gastos D. sus hijos.

Hasta ahorita esta tranquila con el grupo ya que todas se conocen bien , y esta muy contenta con el credito que se le otorgara ya que a trabajado con otras compañias y esta viendo la  gran diferencia del porcentaje que cobran.
texts.en:
This Group is maD. up of 12 persons who are: Jovita, Clarita, Alberta , Inocencia , Eloisa, Oralia, Julia, Faustina, Eliz, Elizabeth , Soledad and Julieta. They all live in a settlement that is far from the municipal center in the state of Guerrero. Each has a small business: Jacoba is a fish and vegetable merchant. Clarita and Alberta sell fish. Inocencia sells fruit, Eloisa and Julia are seamstresses. Oralia sells candy and Faustina sells chickens. Eliz sells in a co-op and Elizabeth sells bread. Soledad sells nutritional products and Julieta sells women’s accessories. Jacoba is married and has 5 children, who are 18, 17, 14, 11 and 10 years of age. She can read and write even though she did not finish school. She wants to buy a variety of different fruits, vegetables and fish. Because of her children’s expenses, she can’t afford to stock large quantities so, what little she sells, goes quickly. She wants to buy a variety of product so that she can sell more and earn more profits. This is why she needs the loan: to invest in the purchase of various fruits, vegetables and fish. This way she will have more profits and that will help her with her children’s expenses. To date, she is at peace with the group since they all know each other very well. She is happy with the loan that she will have granted because she has worked with other companies and she is seeing the big difference in interest percentage that they charge.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetables and fish.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita S. is from the village of Malinao in Gingoog City. She is 50 years old. Anita is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Anita makes and sells snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Anita has been engaged in her business for over 1 years and earn approximately 1,400 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Anita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anita is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be Anita's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Lenita

texts.en:
Lenita D. T. is from the village of Damayuhan, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. She is 37 years old. Lenita is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Lenita owns & operates a business venture in the food sector operating a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling ocean-caught fish from her husband in the local community. Lenita has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Lenita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lenita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase a small fishing boat. Lenita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase more fish to sell. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Lenita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Godelina

texts.en:
Godelina N. M. is 30 years old, married and blessed with 5 children. She lives in Nambale, Busia district. She runs a fish business in one of the market stalls. Her main fish sales are in fish fingerlings, a staple food for the surrounding community. Godelina buys her stock from Nambale wholesalers twice a week.

She would like a loan of Kshs. 10,000 to expand her business by increasing her stock. Her main future plan is to expand her business and ensure her economic stability in life.

loans.use: expand business by increasing fish in stock

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Danaya de l’association Kankeletigui est composé de 5 femmes mariées de la ville de San, région de Ségou (quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali). Les membres du groupe Danaya vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles. Elles se sont connues à travers le voisinage et exercent les activités de petit commerce depuis plusieurs années avec la vente de diverses marchandises : tissus, fruits et légumes etc.  Elles sont toutes mariées et ont en moyenne 36 ans et au moins 4 enfants. 
Elles sont à leur première expérience avec Soro Yiriwaso c'est-à-dire le premier  prêt solidaire. 
La présidente du groupe en la personne de Djeneba Koné est beaucoup sollicitée par ses clients pour la qualité  de ses fruits et légumes. 
Elle s’approvisionne chaque semaine à la foire de Sikasso et compte acheter avec son prêt ci, 10 sacs de pomme de terre, 2 sacs d’orange, un panier de tomate, un panier de carottes  et un panier de  concombres. 
Elle revend au marché de San et les foires environnants  en détail  et en gros, en espèce et à crédit. 
Tandis que Djeneba Koné espère  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 13 000 FCFA, les autres membres du groupe envisagent obtenir 11 000FCFA. Ce bénéfice sera utilisé pour subvenir aux dépenses et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
The Danaya group of the Kankeletigui association is composed of five married women from the town of San in Ségou region (the fourth administrative region of Mali). The group members live in large traditional families. They are well known in their neighborhood, and have been active in the business of selling a variety of merchandise for several years: they sell yard goods, fruits, vegetables and so on. On average, they are 36 years old, and each of them has at least four children. They are currently repaying their first cooperative loan from Soro Yiriwaso. . Djeneba Koné, the group's president, is valued by her customers for the quality of her fruits and vegetables. Every week she buys her provisions at the fair in Sikasso. With this loan she plans to buy 10 bags of potatoes, 2 bags of oranges, a basket of tomatoes, a basket of carrots and a basket of cucumbers. She will sell them at the market in San and at fairs in the surrounding area, retail and wholesale, for cash and credit. While Djeneba Koné hopes for a monthly income of 13,000 FCFA, the other members of the group are counting on getting 11,000 FCFA. They will use the income to pay expenses and to plow money back into their businesses.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Mes

texts.en:
Mes S., 25, is married and lives with her husband and young child in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. She is a garment factory worker who earns an income of about USD 2 per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of USD 3 per day to help cover the family's expenses. 

Mes S. is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase cows to help plow the field for farming. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy cows to plow the field for farming

loans.name: Fet For Shameness Group

texts.en:
Meet members of the “Fet For Shameness” group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of SLL 800,000 for each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Manty K. (who is pictured in the middle) is the leader of this group. The 29-year-old is married to a businessman and they have two children. For many years now, Manty  has been selling women’s dresses, shoes, and soap. With her share of this loan, she will buy the above-mentioned items wholesale to add to her current ones. 

(In the photo are members of the 'Fet for Shameness' group and loan officer Daniel Banya on the right, handing over the loan.)

loans.use: Buy women’s dresses, shoes, and soap for resale

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia B. is a 39-year-old married woman. Her husband is a policeman. She and her husband have four children, all of whom are in school. To earn a living, Julia is in the business of selling green vegetables at the market. She is now requesting a loan in the amount of $350 to stock fish to sell at the market to generate additional income. With the expected extra profits as a result of the loan, she hopes to be able to build a shop of her own.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services. All of these services are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 female members.

loans.use: To expand her business operations by purchasing fish

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta G. is from the village of Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 43 years old. Loreta is widowed and has 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Loreta owns & operates a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Loreta has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Loreta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Loreta is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Loreta from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell.

location.town: Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Ori

loans.name: Lubov

texts.en: Lubov is married with one child. For the past nine years, she has owned a small store selling food, cosmetics and related products. Lubov is an open and sincere person, and these character traits have helped her in her business. Her customers like buying from her and come back again. Her business is quite competitive. Lubov would like to borrow 10,000 UAH to increase the assortment of products she offers. She hopes to increase her sales and make additional income.

loans.use: To increase her assortment of products

loans.name: Khanlar

texts.en: Khanlar H. is 50 years old. He is married and has two children. Khanlar is the sole breadwinner for his family, and his only income comes from farming crops. Every year, he buys new sorts of seeds for seasonal fruits and vegetables. He is not alone in his business; his wife helps him. With his first loan from AqroInvest Khanlar was able to expand his business. Today, Khanlar is thinking about further expanding his business, since the income from his present crops isn't enough to provide for his family. He wishes to buy more seeds for this season. To do this, he needs to invest an additional 1,000 AZN in his business.

loans.use: To purchase more seed to increase his crops

loans.name: Maria Flor

texts.en:
Maria Flor T. is a 39-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures:  a general store and raising hogs. She lives in Hda. San Ramon, Brgy. Poblacion, Bayawan City, Negros Oriental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2005 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts by working hard in her general store and hog raising businesses.  She is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 5,000 PHP. Maria Flor is now borrowing 19,500 PHP to purchase more stock to sell. This will be her 13th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 19,500 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Maria Flor aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at Kiva.org.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Feliza

texts.en:
Feliza D. is from the village of Kanitoan, Initao, Misamis Oriental. She is 38 years old. Feliza is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Feliza owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community, with her husband as her business partner. Feliza has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Feliza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services in order to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Feliza is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Feliza from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en: This is 40 year-old Hassan. He is married, and has 6 children aged 15,12,10,7,5 and 3. He has 5 additional dependents, who live with him because they are his relatives. In 1991, Hassan established his cosmetics business. He began his business because he felt he should be self-reliant. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about SLL 2,190,200 every month from this business. He needs a loan of SLL4,000,000. Hassan requires a loan to buy various cosmetics for his shop. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately SLL 438,040. In the future, Hassan plans to open another cosmetics shop and to educate his children to university level. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: The loan is used to buy additional cosmetics.

loans.name: Maria Margarita

texts.es:
María Margarita es una madre de familia de 26 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a sus tres hijos en el caserío Pomape del distrito de Monsefú. Una zona ubicada a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace seis años a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores, específicamente de ovejas y aves de corral. Ella cría a sus animales en algunos ambientes situados en su domicilio, cuando ya ha desarrollado lo suficiente los ofrece en venta a los negociantes de la zona. Esta actividad le permite ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

María desea adquirir más ovejas para ampliar su negocio de crianza y venta. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles con los cuales piensa lograr su objetivo.

Ella es una mujer trabajadora y entregada a su familia. Actualmente está embarazada de su cuarto hijo y desea seguir trabajando para poder brindarle lo mejor.
texts.en:
María Margarita is a 26-year-old mother who lives with her husband and three children in the Pomape housing project in the Monsefú district, an area located twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

For six years she has raised and sold small animals, specifically, sheep and poultry.  She raises her animals in rooms in her house.  When the animals are sufficiently developed, she offers them for sale to dealers in the area.  This enables her to help her husband support the family.

María would like to buy more sheep to expand this business, and thus has found it advantageous to make this first request to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 500 new soles, in order to achieve her objective.

She is a hard-working woman devoted to her family.  She is currently pregnant with her fourth child, and wants to continue to work, in order to offer the child the best she can.

loans.use: Adquirir más ovejas

loans.name: Ly

texts.en: Mrs. Ly L., age 53, makes a living by selling fish. Mrs. Ly L. sells the fish that she buys from other fisherman at a low price. She currently earns an average of US$7 a day, and she has been running her business for over eight years. Her husband is 58 years old and he is a grocery seller around his community and other villages. Mrs. Ly L. is the mother of six teenage children; three are single, and the two remaining are married. In order to make more profit, Mrs. Ly L. raises some cow in her stall. Mrs. Ly L. is a hard-working woman who never wastes time while engaging in her business activities. As a result of the increasing needs of her business, she is applying for a loan so she can purchase more cows to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more cows to sell.

loans.name: Joyce Naa Awoshi

texts.en: Joyce Naa Awoshi N. is divorced and has two children. She processes palm oil and soap for sale at Abura. Joyce uses her income to see to the well-being of the family. Joyce will use the loan to purchase more palm fruits to prepare oil and soap for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Joyce plans to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: purchase more palm fruits to prepare oil and soap for sale

loans.name: Ana Gloria

texts.es: Ana Gloria R. de 50 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo, dos hijos y una pequeña nieta de 9 años de edad, junto a quienes reside en el departamento de Sonsonate. Ana es una persona que se dedica a diferentes actividades para poder contar con una fuente de ingresos que le permita vivir de forma estable. Ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras de forma ambulante, así mismo compra y vende oro, dicha actividad a la cual se dedica desde hace 6 años. Ana es una persona muy trabajadora quien solicita un préstamo a Integral con el enorme deseo de contar con el monto de dinero necesario para invertir en la compra de mayor cantidad y variedad de frutas y verduras, ya que es dicho negocio el cual le permite contar con más ganancias debido a que es una venta más estable la cual realiza todos los días de la semana.
texts.en:
Ana Gloria R. is 50 years old.  She lives together with her husband, two children and 9 year-old granddaughter, in Sonsonate department.  Ana is a person who works in a number of activities in order to have a source of income which allows her to live a stable life.  She sells fruit and vegetables as a street trader.  She also buys and sells gold, an activity which she has been engaged in for 6 years.

Ana is a very hard-working person who is requesting a loan from Integral as she really wants to have the necessary money to invest in buying a greater quantity and variety of fruit and vegetables since this is the business which makes her most profits owing to the fact that it makes more stable sales.  She carries out this business every day of the week.

loans.use: To buy fruit and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Abdumajid

texts.en:
M. Abdumajid is 33 years old. He is married with two children. From the time he was young, Abdumajid was learning to work in the small business of cattle breeding. After he married, he continued working in the same business, watching the business grow as a result of his sacrifice, and seeing his family progressing more and more. His hope is to continue growing and improving his business to offer a better future for his children, and see them as professional, ethical and hardworking. For this reason Abdumajid is asking for a loan of $1000 USD. He wants this loan to buy additional livestock and is sincerely thankful for your support. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cattle to expand the business

loans.name: Kuña Mbarete Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre Kuña Mbarete, se conformó en fecha 27 de julio del 2.010, mediante  una promoción realizada en la zona, a la Sra. Mirian F., quien quedo muy interesada y logro juntar a sus vecinas y amigas, luego contacto con la asesora para la formación del  grupo y  logró juntar a 16 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto en el 2º ciclo.
Participan activamente en las reuniones semanales, y están muy agradecidas con la Fundación Paraguaya.
Una de las integrantes es Maria Luisa, ella es una mujer joven estudiante, quien se dedica a la realización de trabajaos por computadoras desde su casa. Cuenta con un cartel que ofrece los servicios que ella realiza y constantemente recibe pedidos de trabajos prácticos para colegios y universidades y otros.
Comenta que su ingreso es bastante bueno y le ayuda mucho con sus gastos.
Solicita el préstamo para el pago por mantenimiento de su  computadora ya que su herramienta de trabajo principal.
texts.en:
The Kuña Mbarete Women's Committee was founded on July 27th 2010 as a result of promotional activities that were carried out in their area.  Mirian F. was very interested and managed to get together some neighbors and friends.  She contacted the Fundación Paraguaya advisor about setting up a group and managed to join together 16 women who are now working happily on their second loan cycle.

All of the women take an active part in their weekly meetings and are very grateful to Fundación Parguaya.  One of the members of the group is Maria Luisa who is a young student.  She does computer work from her home.  She has a sign which offers her services and she is constantly receiving orders for practical work from schools, universities, etc.  She comments that her income is quite good and helps her a lot with her expenses.  She is requesting this loan so that she can pay to have her computer serviced since it is her main work tool.

loans.use: To have her computer serviced

loans.name: Yusunbaatar

texts.en: Yusunbaatar is 28 years old, married and father of two daughters. They all live together in a small wooden house in his parents-in-law’s plot of land in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. His wife Bolortsetseg 33 works along with him. His eldest daughter Khongorzul, aged 9, attends a local secondary school and his youngest daughter stays at home.  Yusunbaatar is currently operating a bakery shop. He was a taxi driver for many years by using his own car. Yusunbaatar is very hardworking person with strong will and providing his children to give good education and morals. He is requesting 2.200.000 MNT loan to purchase a cake oven for his business.

loans.use: He is requesting 2.200.000 MNT loan to purchase a cake oven for his business.

loans.name: Benso Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe BENSO  (4 femmes mariées) ont une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles à N’TENTOU, un des quartiers de la ville de OUELESSEBOUGOU (2ème région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur neuvième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers : encens, pagnes, cosmétiques  et la petite restauration (avec les friandises, les fritures de pâtes de céréales).  MARIAM B., la présidente du groupe fait l’achat et la vente de pagnes wax et teintés.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 40 pièces de pagnes wax. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché  de BAMAKO auprès des grossistes.
Les pagnes sont vendus au  marché de OUELESSEBOUGOU et à domicile, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, en détail, au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 50.000FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée  pour l’appui de son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the BENSO group (four married women) are, on average, 35 years old and have four children. They live in traditional families in N’tentou, a district of the city of Ouelessebougou (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They are on their ninth joint loan with the microfinance institution Yiriwaso because they want to be able to meet the demands of their clientele. This group of women deals in various articles: incense, pagnes (brightly colored cloth used for clothing) cosmetics, and light food service (sweets, fried foods). Mariam B., the leader of the group, buys and sells Wax and tinted pagnes. 

With her loan, she plans to buy 40 Wax pagnes. She gets her supplies at the main market in Bamako from wholesalers. The pagnes are sold at the market at Ouelessebougou and door to door, to a clientele of men and women, at retail for cash and on credit.

She foresees making an average monthly profit of 50,000 CFA, a part of which will be used to help her husband with daily expenses and the rest will be invested in her business.

loans.use: to buy pagnes

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua K. sells doughnuts’ at Abbrem Agona near Abura. Ekua has received a junior high education. She is married and has 4 children. Her husband is a farmer. Ekua has been selling doughnuts for 2 years. Her income helps to pay their children’s school fees. Her loan will be used to buy additional flour and other ingredients to produce larger quantities of doughnuts for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a snack bar.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy additional flour and other ingredients to produce larger quantities of doughnuts for sale.

loans.name: Pauline Akuvi

texts.fr: Madame Akuvi  est  mariée et  a  3  enfants.  Agée  de  45  ans, elle  participe  au   foyer  et   fait  le  commerce  de pagnes, bijoux et produits de beauté .   Elle s’approvisionne  au  grand  marché  de  Lomé et  revend  dans une boutique à  côté du bar  Madiba sur la route La pampa.  Elle  a  commencé  son activité  en  2001. Pour satisfaire  plus  de  clients, elle sollicite un prêt.
texts.en: Akuvi is married and she has 3 children. She is 45 years old and she contributes to the household by selling shawls, jewelry, and beauty products. She makes her purchases at the large market in Lome and resells from her boutique located beside the Madiba bar on La Pampa road. She has had her business since 2001. In order to satisfy a larger clientele, she requests a loan.

loans.use: To purchas shawls, jewelry, and beauty products.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana tiene 57 años, es una mujer bondadosa. Vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo Luis, de 61 años y sus 2 hijos mayores e independientes, por quienes trabajó mucho cuando eran pequeños. Juana desde hace 14 años se dedica a la venta de productos nutricionales; ofreciendo a sus amistades y familiares. Este negocio lo realiza de manera independiente y cuando tiene horas libres; y los viernes por la noche se dedica en la preparación de tamales quedándose hasta muy tarde, para tenerlos listos y los sábados venderlos en la puerta de su casa. De esta manera, sus dos actividades siempre le han sido beneficioso, cuyos ingresos pudo ayudar a su esposo a cubrir la educación de sus hijos. Sin embargo dentro de la venta de productos nutricionales no ascendió de cargo, ya que no logró incorporar más vendedoras a pesar de sus buenas ventas. En adelante desea trasladarse a provincias y de ese modo espera ampliar sus ventas y cuente con un stock más diverso. Por lo tanto, le urge comprar más estos productos nutricionales. Es el 17avo crédito que tiene con MFP, y promete pagar todas sus cuotas como hasta ahora. Pertenece a un grupo solidario, y en todo este tiempo ambas se han apoyado. De obtener el crédito, comprará más productos nutricionales, para iniciar sus ventas a diversas provincias del país.
texts.en:
Juana, age 57, is a kind woman. She lives in her own home with her husband Luis, age 61. Her two children are grown and independent, but she worked a great deal when they were little. Juana began selling nutritional products fourteen years ago. She offers her merchandise to friends and relatives. This business allows her to work independently whenever she has free time. On Friday evenings, she stays up late preparing tamales so that she can have them ready to sell on Saturdays from the doorstep of her house. Having two businesses has always been a benefit since the income enables her to help her husband with paying for their children’s education. Juana has not been able to achieve leadership status with her nutritional products business because she failed to recruit more salespeople, even though she generates good sales herself. In the future, she hopes to have a more diverse stock and travel to other provinces in hopes of increasing her sales. Therefore, she urges everyone to buy more of her nutritional products.

This is her seventeenth loan with MFP. Juana promises to complete all of her payments as she has done before. She belongs to a solidarity group and feels she has been supported all the time. With the loan she obtained, Juana will buy more nutritional products so that she can start selling to different provinces within the country.

loans.use: To purchase nutritional products to sell.

loans.name: Viviana

texts.es:
Viviana forma parte del Banco comunal “Compartiendo Esfuerzo”, perteneciente a la ciudad de La Cisterna. Ella se dedica a la venta de lencería por catálogo, desde hace 4 años aproximadamente. Durante este tiempo su clientela ha ido en aumento, por lo que ahora cuenta con 40 clientes frecuentes.
Su mercadería la compra en la ciudad de Santiago en una tienda mayorista, donde los precios son a bajo costo.
Viviana además estudia en un instituto la carrera de Trabajo Social, por lo que acomoda los horarios de su negocio, de acuerdo a sus estudios.
Con el préstamo comprará lencería para la temporada de otoño.
Ella vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos de 13 y 4 años de edad.
Su sueño es terminar de estudiar su carrera y expandir su negocio, con el que podrá optar a una vida más confortable.
Viviana postuló a un subsidio para la vivienda, la cual se la entregan en los próximos meses. 
Su motivación de continuar con éste negocio es poder concretar todos sus proyectos, generados por las ganancias de éste. 
Viviana está muy agradecida de Fondo Esperanza, ya que el crédito le ayudará a invertir en su negocio. Y las reuniones le han servido para aprender a como distribuir mejor sus ingresos. Además está contenta porque su grupo es muy organizado y unido. 
La Cisterna es una comuna ubicada en el sector centro-sur de la región Metropolitana. Es una comuna esencialmente residencial y comercial. En sus inicios era un sector rural, de grandes parcelas, sin embargo debido al crecimiento de su población y la llegada de servicios pasó a ser un sector 100% urbano.
texts.en:
Viviana is part of the communal bank “Compartiendo Esfuerzo” (Sharing Effort) which is in the city of La Cisterna.  She works selling lingerie from catalogs and has done this for approximately the last four years. During this time, her clientele has grown so that now she has 40 frequent customers.
She buys her merchandise in the city of Santiago in a wholesale store where the prices are low.
Viviana also studies social work in an educational institution, thus she adjusts the hours she works in her business according to her studies.
With the loan she will buy lingerie for the fall season.
She lives with her husband and their two children who are 13 and 4-years-old.
Her dream is to get her degree and expand her business so that she can have a more comfortable life.  
Viviana applied for a subsidy for her house which she will receive in a few months.  
Her motivation for continuing with this business is to be able to complete her projects with the income generated by the business.
Viviana is very thankful to Fondo Esperanza as the loan will help her to invest in her business.  Also, the meetings have helped her to learn how to better distribute her income.  Additionally she is happy because her group is very organized and united.
La Cisterna is a community located in the central-south sector of the Metropolitan area.  It is a primarily residential and commercial community.  In the beginning it was a rural area with large land parcels, but due to the population growth and the arrival of services it became a 100% urban area.

loans.use: to buy lingerie to sell.

loans.name: Hernán Rafael

texts.es: Hernán Rafael G. de cuarenta y tres años de edad vive con su compañera de vida y sus tres hijos en el departamento de la Unión, El tiene un puesto en el mercado municipal del lugar donde se dedica a vender carne y al destazo, Hernán es un líder de venta de carne en el mercado pues él es muy dedicado a en su negocio, tiene las mejores carnes, en un lugar muy higiénico además de que se caracteriza por ser muy servicial con su clientela. Su negocio está floreciendo y es por eso que Hernán se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita abastecerse de mas producto, todo tipo de carnes de res, de cerdo y de pollo. Para así siempre estar un paso adelante de su competencia y lograr llevar el sustento a su hogar cada día, porque como todo hombre emprendedor sueña con darle una mejor vida a su familia.
texts.en: Hernán Rafael G. is 43 years old and lives with his spouse and their 3 children in the department of La Union.  He runs a stand in the municipal market where he sells meats.  Hernan is one of the top meat sellers in the market and is very dedicated to his work.  He has the best meats and keeps his shop very clean and he is known for offering great customer service.  His business is flourishing which is why he decided to request a loan from INTEGRAL to increase his stock of all types of meat: beef, pork and chicken.  He'd like to always be one step ahead of his competition to support his family because every enterprising man dreams of providing a better life for his family.

loans.use: to purchase beef, pork, and chicken

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina es socia del  Banco Comunal “Flor de Canela”, ubicado en el distrito y departamento Puno, tiene 41 años de edad.  Está separada y tiene 2 hijos (uno ya es independiente).  Cuenta con estudios secundarios.
Ella se dedica al servicio de transporte urbano, trabaja como cobradora.
Es socia del Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace ocho meses, el primer monto solicitado fue de S/ 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en el mantenimiento de su carro.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/ 1000.00 nuevo soles, comprará cuatro unidades de llantas para su carro.  Nos cuenta que a veces viaja a Desaguadero para traer mercaderías  como abarrotes para luego distribuirlos a sus clientes. Esta actividad la realiza en paralelo para poder ayudarse con los gastos familiares.
Su sueño es crecer en el servicio de transporte y mejorar su calidad de vida.
Lo que le gusta  es la   responsabilidad y las charlas que brindan del Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
Cristina is a member of the 'Flor de Canela' community bank which is located in Puno district and department.  Cristina is 41 years old, separated, and has two children (one of whom lives independently).  She has a high school level of education.

Cristina works in urban transport services.  She works as a bus conductor.

Cristina has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for eight months.  The first loan she applied for was for 500 Peruvian soles.  She invested that money in having maintenance work done on her car.

Cristina will use this new loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles to buy four tires for her car.  She tells us that she sometimes travels to Desaguadero to bring back merchandise such as groceries which she then delivers to her customers.  She does this work in parallel with her job so that she can cover her family's expenses.

Cristina's dream is to grow in her transport service and improve her quality of life.

What Cristina likes about her community bank are the responsibility and the talks that they give.

loans.use: to buy four tires for her car

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es:
Juan Francisco nació en la ciudad de Quillabamba del departamento del Cusco, él tiene 55 años edad y tiene tres hijos, actualmente él vive en la comunidad de Vilcabamba provincia de Paucartambo departamento del Cusco.

Juan Francisco se dedica a varias actividades como por ejemplo carpintería, gasfitería, agricultura, ganadería, panadería, comerciante y otras cosas más. Juan Francisco tiene un pequeño taller de carpintería en su domicilio donde elaborar muebles de madera como por ejemplo sillas, mesas, carpetas, roperos, etc. 

Juan Francisco desde muy niño aprendió el oficio de la carpintería pues su abuelo le enseño a fabricar muebles, él nos cuenta con mucha nostalgia que en el taller de su abuelo pintaba, lijaba, remozaba la madera. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que le pone en su trabajo. Con su próximo préstamo, Juan Francisco requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales como por ejemplo madera. 

Juan Francisco pertenece al banco comunal “Mamacha del Carmen” de la Asociación Arariwa. El banco comunal esta en el tercer año de funcionamiento y les va muy bien.
texts.en:
Juan Francisco was born in the city of Quillabamba, in Cusco department.  He is 55 years old and has three children.  He currently lives in Vilcabamba community, in Paucartambo province, in Cusco department.

Juan Francisco engages in a number of business activities such as carpentry, plumbing, farming, livestock raising, bakery, sales and other things besides.  He has a small carpentry workshop in his home where he makes wooden furniture such as chairs, tables, desks, wardrobes, etc.

Juan Francisco learned the carpentry trade at a very young age as his grandfather taught him how to make furniture.  He tells us, with a lot of nostalgia, that he used to paint, file and renovate the wood in his grandfather's workshop.  He has been working in this business for several years and it is going very well thanks to the commitment that he puts into his work.  Juan Francisco would like this loan to buy materials such as wood.

Juan Francisco is a member of Asociación Arariwa's "Mamacha del Carmen" community bank.  The bank is in its third year and doing very well.

loans.use: to buy materials such as wood

loans.name: Polad

texts.en:
Polad is a 43-year-old married man who owns a small farm where he raises seasonal vegetables and breeds cattle. He is a hardworking man who has fought to provide for his family and children, who today are working adults thanks to his example. 

Polad has been running his business of raising and selling cattle since 2006, when he was without a job. Since cattle raising and selling is a profitable business, Polad has become a very successful businessman in a very short period. He works very hard and spends all his time with his animals, cleaning them, feeding and pasturing. 

Now Polad wants to expand his business and buy more cattle, so he applied for a loan of 1,300 AZN. Polad thanks all lenders for their support.

loans.use: to purchase three cattle

loans.name: Juana Rosa

texts.es:
Este cliente  tiene su domicilio  en  ciudad de Managua capital, la  señora Juana Rosa se ha caracterizado por ser una persona honrada  trabajadora con buenos principios  morales como persona, debido a que ha sabido  ganarse el aprecio de todos sus  compañeros de trabajo. 
Se presento ante esta oficina  de  Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para ser invertido en mejoramiento  su vivienda como es la compra de materiales de construcción,  bloques piedra cantera, cemento  arena piedrín hierro  y  pago de  mano obra, y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, que es por la quien trabaja y se esfuerza diariamente.
texts.en:
This client has her address in the capital city of Managua.  Juana Rosa has stood out as an honest, hard working person with good personal values and moral principles having won over the esteem of her customers.

She came by this Ceprodel office to request a loan that will be used for home improvements.  She will buy building materials and supplies like concrete blocks, paving stones, cement, sand, gravel, iron rods and will pay labor costs to provide a better quality of life for her family which is who she works and strives for daily.

loans.use: to do some home improvements.

loans.name: Dania Lissette

texts.es:
Dania tiene la edad de 35 años, casada, de oficio jefa de producción en una panadería de la capital. Su esposo es propietario de un camión el cual lo trabaja en viajes.
Como meta ha sido la construcción de su casa, el cual han venido mejorando con financiamiento que la institución de Afodenic ah otorgado en tres ciclos. Levantando toda de concreto.
Lo que quiere hacer con este nuevo préstamo es para repellar paredes, y levantar un pequeño muro. El cual está contenta por lograr cada día la terminación de su casa. Para esto comprara: trescientos bloques, arena, cemento, hierro, piedrín, estribos para comenzar la obra.
texts.en:
Dania, 35, is married.  She is head of production at a bakery in the capital.  Her husband owns his own truck and operates a trucking business.  
Dania wants to finish building her house, a project that she's been working on and for which Afodenic has provided three past loans.  She is using cement for all of the construction.
Dania will use this new loan to plaster the inside walls of her house and build a low outside wall.  Dania is pleased to see the progress on her house.  For the new work, she will buy: three-hundred concrete blocks, cement, rebar, plaster, beams, etc.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for repairs to her house.

loans.name: Gansuh

texts.en: Gansuh is 40 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in a ger or Mongolian yurt in Mongolia's province of Uvs. His daughter is 14 years old and  attends a local secondary school while his wife owns ice-cream producing business. Gansuh manages a transportation business which serves people in his area. After working for a time for a private company, he went into business for himself and is applying for a loan to pay for repairs to his truck. These repairs will allow him to work more efficiently and safely. He is a polite man who plans to have his own house in the future. He says, "I want to have everything I can work for in life." He is requesting a 1,800,000 MNT loan to buy parts for his business.

loans.use: to buy auto parts for his transportation business.

loans.name: María Cristina

texts.es:
La Señora Maria Cristina está casada, tiene 29 años de edad, tiene un hijo menor. Posee casa propia en la ciudad de Encarnación, donde reside con su hijo.
La clienta es comerciante, es decir, se dedica a la venta de ropas usadas, posee un local comercial al costado de la termal de ómnibus. Cuenta con 3 años de antigüedad lo que le permite contar con muy buena clientela e ingresos.
Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora, comenta que todo su esfuerzo esta encaminada ofrecerle un futuro mejor y una educación mejor de la que tuvo ella, a su hijo.
La Sra Maria solicita el credito para la compra de ropas de invierno, con lo que podrá abastecerse para poder ofrecer mas variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Cristina is 29 years old, married, and has a young child. She owns a home in the city of Encarnación where she lives with her son.

Maria Cristina is a merchant who sells used clothes. She has a shop next to the bus terminal. Maria Cristina has been in business for three years and has a good customer base and income. She is a very hardworking and determined woman. Maria Cristina says that all of her efforts are aimed toward offering her son a better future and a good education that she did not have.

She is requesting a loan to buy winter clothing so that she can stock up and offer greater variety to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase winter clothing to sell.

loans.name: Marianita

texts.en:
Marianita is 58 years old and is a married woman with seven children. She and her husband are both farmers. They own and till a plot of land in Banga, South Cotabato where they also live. Rice is the main crop that they grow at their farm.

Marianita applied for a loan because as she said, they need additional farm inputs but they don’t have the capability to buy what they need. She plans to use her loan to buy fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs.

In the future, Marianita hopes to build a better house for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en: At the age of 33, Marcelina is still single. She is the breadwinner of the family because her mother is too old and has been ill. To sustain the needs of the family members and the medication of her mother, Marcelina went to Manila and worked as a sewer. She went back to the province to take care of her mother and made a decision to put up a business for a source of income. Nowadays, Marcelina has been managing her business raising hogs for over eight years. She desires to increase her income by buying additional piglets to raise. Marcelina is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy additional piglets to raise. She hopes that this loan will help her expand her business and increase her income to sustain her mother’s medication.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Irma

texts.es: Irma, un ama de casa de 25 años de edad, vive en la zona rural de Yanapuquio, franja montañosa del Perú. Está casada con Alcides, de 30 años con quien tiene una hija: Sayuri a la que cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en la zona rural de Yanapuquio. Irma y su esposo se apoyan mutuamente, ambos tiene 10 años de experiencia en la agricultura; tiempo suficiente para poder dar fe de su éxito; ya que con las ganancias que obtienen sostienen sus principales gastos (ropa, alimentos y educación para su única hija). Pero lo más importante para ellos es poder progresar y salir adelante. Con la ayuda de su banco comunal, pudieron incrementar sus sembríos de papa, y ahora comercializan al por mayor, en el mercado central de la capital del país, donde cada nueva cosecha obtienen mejores ganancias, fruto de las constantes charlas y capacitaciones que reciben. Pero este año, según menciona, el precio de la papa en el mercado bajó producto de la sobreproducción, por ello Irma está pensando, con los ahorros que tiene, comprar su propio terreno de cultivo; donde espera adquirir mayores ganancias, ya que no tendrá que pagar por su alquiler. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Zona semillero de Yanapuquio” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde está contenta de poder pertenecer a la entidad más respetada de su localidad; donde aprendió a progresar. Además agradece el apoyo de su banco comunal. Irma de recibir el pequeño préstamo; invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para esparcirlos en sus cultivos de papa de la variedad “primeriza” que muy pronto cosechará.
texts.en:
Irma is a 25-year-old homemaker who lives in the rural district of Yanapuquio, which is situated in a mountain range in Peru.  She is married to Alcides, age 30, and they have a daughter named Sayuri who she cares for at home.  Irma and her husband mutually support each other.  They both have 10 years of experience in farming, which is sufficient time to have faith in their success.  The income they have earned is enough to maintain their primary expenses such as clothes, food, and the education of their only daughter.  What matters most to them is being able to make progress and move forward.  With the help of her Communal Bank, Irma and her husband have been able to increase their planting of potatoes.  Now they want to sell in bulk at the central market in Lima.  With each new harvest, they are able to obtain more income.  This is a result of the constant advice and training they have received.  This year the price of potatoes at the market is lower because of overproduction.  Because of this, Irma is planning to use her savings to buy her own farmland in hopes of earning more income since she currently rents her land.  

Irma is a member of the Communal Bank “Zona Semillero de Yanapuquio” (Planting District of Yanapuquio) and this is her second loan with MFP.  She is pleased to be a part of this well-respected group in her community which has taught her how to make progress.  In addition, she appreciates the support of her Communal Bank.  Irma will be receiving a small loan and plans to use the funds to buy natural fertilizers to apply on her crop of potatoes of the “Primeriza” variety, which will be harvested soon.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORIMANCACHA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Elizabeth; ella tiene 43 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene  2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo de fisoterapia, ella es propietaria de un consultorio, ella trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,la socia también trabaja en dar información de seguros de vida, por medio de estos trabajos saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere implementar el trabajo de fisioterapia. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar una maquinaria para hacer masajes.
 
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Elizabeth belongs to the “QORIMANCACHA” communal bank, which is located in the Cusco district, within the province and department of the same name.

Elizabeth is 43 years old, lives with her partner, and has 2 children. She splits her daily activities with her physiotherapy work. She is the owner of an office and works from 8:00 a.m until 7:00 p.m. Elizabeth also works providing information about life insurance. Through these jobs, she is able to help her children get ahead. She would like to expand her physiotherapy work. 

Elizabeth will use the loan to buy massage equipment. She is happy to have this loan and has committed to making all of her payments.

loans.use: to buy massage equipment.

loans.name: Shireen

texts.en:
Shireen is a 27-year-old young woman. She is married and has two sons and four daughters. Her husband is a worker with a modest salary. 
Shireen has a project raising sheep and selling their products, which helps her to share in meeting the family's expenses. Shireen wants to purchase fodder to feed her sheep, but the amount of money she has isn't enough so she wants to take a loan of $1,500 from Kiva partner, FATEN. When Shireen takes the loan, which is to be repaid on a monthly basis, she will able to purchase the needed fodder to feed the sheep she is raising and sell more of its products. In this way she will be able to increase the family income and have better living conditions. Shireen is photographed in a FATEN branch.

loans.use: to purchase fodder for the sheep she is raising.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine, who lives in Kampala, Uganda, is married with four children, all of whom go to school. She lives in her own house, but the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

For the last 10 years, Catherine has been selling charcoal at the market seven days a week. Her major challenges include transportation and seasonality. Now requesting a loan of 1000000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal, her goals are to expand her charcoal business so that she can sell on a wholesale basis and also to educate her children up to university level.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly is 29 years old and married with two children.

Beverly works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

Beverly has borrowed and paid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 15 years and earns additional income from fish vending.

Beverly aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries etc. to sell

loans.name: Monique

texts.en:
Monique is 34 years old and is married with two children who are 6 and 9 years old. She is commonly known for selling body lotion, rice, sugar, etc.  Her business hours are from 7 am until 6 pm every day, and she has four years of experience in this business.
