Monique has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business by purchasing more body lotion, sacks of rice, sacks of sugar and cooking oil. Monique will hopefully earn more profits, which in turn will allow her to keep reinvesting for better financial stability, and she will keep providing all the basic needs for her family.

loans.use: To purchase more body lotion, sacks of rice, sacks of sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Embako Group

texts.en:
Caro is the facilitator of Embako group. Caro and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Caro takes care of six children at home. She joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for her family and later educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Caro had a good maize yield harvesting 12  bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Caro was only able to harvest 3  bags of maize on ½  acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Caro and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Caro will educate her children, build a house and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Embako group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Tatevik

texts.en:
Tatevik is a young beekeeper from Kapan, Armenia. She has been engaged in beekeeping for three years. Tatevik needs some financial investments to expand her business. With the requested loan she plans to purchase beehives. 

With the help of this loan, Tatevik will be able to sell more honey and get additional income. This will allow Tatevik to renovate and expand her house, which means improved living conditions for her children in the future. Tatevik lives with her husband and mother-in-law.

loans.use: to pay for beehives

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr:
Mme Awa est  vendeuse de balaie, d’huile de palme et d’autres produits provenant  du sud du pays : de la Casamance. Awa est mariée et fait du commerce depuis 1998 
Avec le crédit elle veut acheter 20 litres d’huile de palme et des balaies.
Dans l’avenir elle compte vendre en même temps des chaussures, des bracelets…
texts.en:
Awa is married and has been active in commerce since 1998. She sells brooms, palm oil and other products from the Casamance region in the south of the country.

Awa will use the loan to buy 20 litres of palm oil and some brooms. Eventually, she would like to expand her range of goods and start selling products like shoes and bracelets.

loans.use: to restock on palm oil and brooms.

loans.name: Ramon

texts.en: Ramon is married with 3 children. Ramon is 52 years old and lives in Poblacion, Titay, Zamboanga Sibugay. Ramon owns a rice wholesale store to earn a living and has had this business for 15 years. Each month, he earns PHP 200,000.00 doing this type of work/business. He has requested a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase more sacks of rice for his rice wholesale business. Ramon has been a member of PMPC this year 2011. In the future, Ramon hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice for his rice wholesale business.

loans.name: Cansilde

texts.en:
Cansilde is 51 years old and is married with four children aged between 13 and 24 years old.  She owns a restaurant from where she sells items such as beans, bananas, meat, rice, juice, soda, and water.  Her business is well organized, and she works on weekdays from 6 a.m. until 6 p.m.  She has had her restaurant for three years and she currently employs five people.

Cansilde has requested a loan from Kiva field partner Vision Finance Company in order to buy more inventory for her restaurant, including beans, bananas, meat, rice, juice, soda, and water.  Cansilde plans to reinvest any extra profit she realizes as a result of the loan back into her business, and hopes that some day she will be able to buy a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy beans, bananas, meat, rice, juice, soda, and water for a restaurant

loans.name: Veneranda

texts.en:
Veneranda is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Veneranda has a shop that sells green and yellow bananas . She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy bananas to sell.

Veneranda has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Veneranda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy bananas to sell.

loans.name: Mano Amiga 1, 2, 3 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Juliana is the coordinator of her group Mano Amiga (Friendly Hand) 1, 2, 3 & 4, group comprised of 20 entrepreneurs from Samana peninsula, a lush, rugged area with a nascent tourism industry, where they all run their businesses. Juliana makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their two children.

Juliana is excited to be taking her 10th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling clothing and Avon beauty products. She will purchase pants, shirts, skirts, creams, perfumes, and makeup in the capital and then bring her merchandise back to her community to sell. Some of her purchases are orders from clients, others she buys to sell.  She is saving to finish building her house and this is how she will use the profits. 

She is still dreaming of buying a scooter to make moving around with her merchandise easier and in order to travel to other communities. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase clothing and cosmetic products to sell.

loans.name: Ilie

texts.en: Ilie is a farmer in rural Moldova, where irrigation is traditionally unreliable (rainfall) or expensive. He is specialized in watermelon and cabbage production on his hillside land plot. An innovative idea - use of a hilltop spring to pressurize a drip irrigation system without any need for energy usage - is currently being employed by other farmers in his town. Ilie wants to do likewise to ensure permanent and virtually cost free irrigation for his land, but first needs a loan to install the piping.

loans.use: Irrigation System

loans.name: Matila

texts.en: Matila is a mother of seven children, three girls and four boys, five of them now married and working in Apia. Matila was employed at Sinalei Reef Resort ten years ago, and she resigned in the 1999 to take care of the grandchildren. From there she started growing vegetables beside the house, and this has now turned into a ½ acre vegetable garden, which  has developed into Matila’s everyday hobby. Now her grandchildren are all grown up, attending primary schools, but Matila has decided not to work for Sinalei but to work in her vegetable garden because she was one of their suppliers. She believes she’s earning more from selling her vegetables than by working for them.

loans.use: Buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Tine

texts.en: Tine is good at gardening and planting. This is one of her hobbies in life. Tine’s backyard is filled up with different vegetables, but cabbages are the main crop. About one-quarter of her area is covered with cabbages. These cabbages only need two to three weeks to grow and re-grow. The place where she lives is mostly occupied with Europeans, and they really like vegetables. These are Tine’s main customers. When Tine has a surplus of vegetables, she prefers to take them to the market. Tine would like to use the loan to buy seeds, tools, and fertilizers from the agriculture store.

loans.use: To purchase vegetable seeds, gardening tools, and fertilizers

loans.name: Ivan

texts.en: Before opening his own toy sales and pet supplies kiosk, Ivan often had to travel to Moscow to find part-time work. Since opening his own business ten years ago, Ivan has been able to support his wife and two children without having to travel. His business is the sole source of income for the family of four. Ivan is a determined and pioneering entrepreneur. His toy and pet supplies kiosk is the only one of its kind in Ganoosivka, Ukraine. Over the years he has been in business, Ivan has received ten loans from Nadiya Ukraine; he has repaid each in full and on schedule. Currently, Ivan is seeking a loan for $1200 to increase his variety of toys. With the increased profits, Ivan plans to purchase his own vending facility. By owning rather than simply renting his place of business, Ivan will be better able to support his family.

loans.use: Purchase toy inventory

loans.name: Dinora  Lizeth

texts.es:
Hello. My name is Dinora Lizeth and for three years I have made a living selling home items and novelties on the street and door to door. Some of the items I sell are cosmetics, sandals, tennis shoes and plasticware. The work suits me because it lets me tend to my family and the money I make helps with the expenses. Right now I am looking for ways to boost sales and I need to raise some capital to be able to carry a greater variety of goods.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es Dinora Lizeth, soy comerciante cuento con un pequeño negocio de venta de Achineria (Cosmeticos, sandalias, tenis y productos plasticos), los que distribuyo de manera ambulante, en las diferentes comunidades de mi ciudad, cuento con 3 años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos para contribuir con los gastos familiares y lo mas importante es que este negocio me permite atender a mi familia. Actualmente se acerca el tiempo de mayor venta y necesito de una mayor inversión, para ofrecer a mis cliente variedad de productos.

loans.use: To buy body lotion, sandals, womens' tennis shoes and plastic basins and underwear.

loans.name: Ramatah

texts.en:
Ramatah is married and has 5 children. Although her husband is also engaged in petty trade, Ramatah needs to earn additional income to sufficiently meet the needs of her children. She sells foodstuffs such as onions, peanut butter, tomato paste, etc. She is very pleased that she has managed to get loans from SMT to expand her business.

Ramatah proudly says that with her profits, she has managed to purchase land for her future house.

Ramatah would like to diversify her business further for more profit so as to be able to support her children well and build a house for them. She is therefore requesting a loan of US$ 275.

loans.use: Expand and diversify her food items for sale

loans.name: Sem

texts.en: Mrs. Sem V., 52, is a widow who lives with her two children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. To help meet the financial needs of her family, she runs a stand at home selling various kinds of grocery products to the people in her area, making on average about $3/day in revenue. Moreover, two of her children are currently employed at a nearby garment factory, earning collectively around $160/month. Mrs. Sem V. hopes this loan will help her expand her inventory by adding more products to satisfy the growing demands of her customers.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products to fulfill her clients' demands.

loans.name: Firdaus

texts.en: “Hello, I am Firdaus B. and have lived in Vehari all my life with my husband and one child. Our town is located about 350 km from Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan. I want to expand my business of buying and selling bedding. My husband and I purchase bedding items from the city for US$ 6 and sell them for US$ 10 each in near-by villages. We have been doing this business for several years now and in order to expand we want to purchase bedding in bulk. Hence, we need a loan.  Moreover, the wedding season, during which we will sell more bedding, is right around the corner .”

loans.use: Purchase bed sheets to sell in near-by villages

loans.name: Nicolasa Jesus

texts.es:
Mrs. Nicolasa Jesus is 42 years old and has finished secondary school but for personal reasons was not able to work in her field. She has two children that depend on her and she works very hard to get them ahead.

Currently Mrs. Nicolasa sells beauty products. She places orders with each sales campaign and also buys products to have in stock and be able to sell on credit. She has always been involved in a business. Previously she traveled to Lima to bring clothing to fill customer orders and additional ones to sell as a street vendor in the Victoria Market of the La Esperanza district. She had many problems because she did not have a permanent location and therefore stopped this kind of work.

With her first loan of 300 Soles (about USD $100) that she obtained from her community bank “Women in Action” she purchased clothing to fill her orders. With this loan of 2,300 Soles (USD $800) which she will repay in four months, she will purchase beauty products to replenish her inventory and some clothing for she still has some orders.

Mrs. Nicolasa dreams of having a place in the center of the town of Trujillo to establish a boutique.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Nicolasa Jesús tiene 42 años de edad, estudió superior completa, pero no pudo ejercer su carrera por motivos personales. Tiene dos hijos que aún dependen de ella y por los cuales trabaja mucho para sacarlos adelante.

Actualmente la señora Nicolasa se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza. Hace pedidos en cada campaña y también compra productos en oferta para tenerlos en stock y así también poder vender al crédito. Ella siempre se ha dedicado al negocio, antes viajaba a la ciudad de Lima para traer ropa de acuerdo a los pedidos que le hacían sus clientes y también parte de estos productos los vendía como ambulante en el Mercado Victoria” del distrito de La Esperanza, pero tenía muchos problemas debido a que no tenía un puesto fijo, así es que dejó de trabajar de esa manera.

Con su primer préstamo de S/. 300 que recibió en su banco comunal “Mujeres en Acción” compró ropa que en ese entonces le habían pedido. Con el préstamo de S/. 2,300, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará productos de belleza para reponer su stock y también algo de ropa ya que tiene algunos pedidos.

El sueño de la señora Nicolasa es tener un local en el centro de Trujillo para poner una boutique.

loans.use: Purchase of beauty products

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Elegantes , Group 5

texts.en:
Adinord is a beautiful young 22 year old single mom with a one year old boy. Adinord’s parents died when she was a child and she grew up as an orphan in her native country of Haiti. She has never had anyone to take care of her and it has been very hard.

She currently sells dishes and other household items from her house and in the nearby market. Her two main goals are to expand her business and buy her own house either in the Dominican Republic or Haiti. She plans on using this loan to buy more merchandise for her small business so that she can raise her son and give him a good life.

On behalf of Adinord, and everyone here at Esperanza International, we sincerely thank you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase dishes and other household items

loans.name: Anna's Utulivu 2 Group

texts.en:
Anna is 30 years old and is a single woman with one child, age 11. Anna owns a small food vendor store, which she started in 2007. She works every day from 8 am to 6 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in food vending.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Yoeuk

texts.en:
Yoeuk H. is a 45 year-old farmer in the Kampong Cham province of Cambodia. She has been farming since 1979 and earns approximately $1 per day. Her husband is a head construction worker in another village and earns $5 a day. Together they help to support their family of eight, including one grandfather, two nephews, and three children.

Two of their children work as garment workers making $80 per month each, and one son is a construction worker earning $2 a day.

Yoeuk H. would like to take out a loan of $600 to buy a motorbike. The motorbike would allow her to commute to work more easily as well as reduce the family’s overall expenses and increase their mobility.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Um

texts.en:
Um R., a 37-year-old, has four children and lives with her husband in Kampong Chnang, Cambodia. She is a true entrepreneur purchasing and wholesaling in a large quantity of chickens to the market vendors, making on average $23 per day in revenue. Her husband, Mr. Heng Sophon, age 39, is a motor-taxi driver and earns approximately $3 a day of profit.

To meet her customer’s demand and to earn more profits to support the family, now she is requesting for a loan from Kiva to purchase more chicken to make her end meet.

loans.use: To purchase more chicken and repair house.

loans.name: Tem

texts.en: Tem S., age 36, is married and lives with her husband in an outskirt area. She has business selling vegetables in a local market. On average, she earns around $2 each day. Her husband, Eal Kun, makes around $3 from his motor-taxi business. They have seven children, two of whom are employed by a garment factory. Mrs. Tem S. would like a loan of $700 to purchase a cow for reselling and to increase the number she's selling to meet her customer demand. (Tem and her husband are pictured with the children)

loans.use: To purchase cows and increase the number sold.

loans.name: Sixto

texts.es:
Sixto is a farmer who works growing a diverse variety of potatos, products that up to today have helped him cover his home’s necessities, above all, his daughter’s medicines. She is the only child that still lives at home and she suffers from epilepsy, and she takes medicine to control her sudden seizures. Sixto needs to give her pills which are very expensive. For these reasons, the longing to provide economic stability is a priority for this father. He presents his case for soliciting a loan, and the loan will be invested in his farm, with the purchase of manure and fertilizers needed for crop production.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Sixto es un agricultor que trabaja sembrando papas de diversas variedades, productos que hasta hoy le han ayudado a cubrir las necesidades de su hogar, sobre todo con las medicinas de su hija, quien es la única que vive aún en su hogar y sufre de epilepsia, para controlar sus repentinas convulsiones, Sixto debe suministrarle unas pastillas que son muy costosas.Por estas razones, las ansias de creer económicamente es una necesidad prioritaria para este padre. Presenta su caso en este medio para solicitar este préstamo, monto que será netamente invertido en sus chacras, con la compra de abono y fertilizantes necesarios para su producción.

loans.use: Buy fertilizers for his crops, thereby increasing his earnings and enable him to take care of his daughter who suffers from epilepsy

loans.name: Yusra

texts.en:
Yusra is 20 years old. She is married. She has been selling shoes and clothes since March 2008. Every day, she works from 8 AM to 6 PM at her business and she can earn a monthly profit of about $30 from her sales.

Yusra now hopes for a loan to buy more shoes and clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more shoes and clothes for her business.

loans.name: Shanti

texts.en: Shanti M. is 34 years old and lives in the village of Kritipur, Kathmandu.  She lives with her husband, Jetindra M., and their 14-year-old son, who is currently a high school student.  Shanti works with her husband every day in the grocery store they opened together five years old.  Because demand for their grocery products has increased, Shanti is requesting a loan of $350, which will be used to purchase key grocery items in bulk for resale.  Shanti and her husband hope to use their business' earnings to provide a solid education for their children.

loans.use: To buy grocery items for her shop

loans.name: Eya

texts.fr:
Mme D. Eya est née en 1972 à Bégbé dans la Préfecture du Zio au Togo. Elle mariée à un chauffeur avec lequel ils ont eu trois (03) enfants. Pour aider son mari à faire face aux charges de la famille, elle s’est lancée dans l’agriculture, notamment dans la culture du mais, un secteur très prometteur dans la région.
Pour augmenter son rendement agricole et ses revenus, elle sollicite un financement pour acheter des fertilisants et augmenter sa surface cultivable.
texts.en:
Ms. Eya D. was born in 1972 in Bégbé in Zio Prefecture, Togo. She is married to a chauffeur, and together they have three children. To assist her husband in addressing family expenses, she got started in agriculture, notably in growing corn, a very promising sector in the region. To increase her harvest and her income, she is requesting financing to buy fertilizer and to increase her arable terrain.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to enrich the soil

loans.name: Martine

texts.fr: Originaire d'Abomey dans le Zou, dame Z. Martine est née en 1971 à Cotonou. Mariée à HEMAHO François , cuisinier, elle est mère de 05 enfants dont 03 sont à sa charge. Après son échec au Certificat d'Etude Primaire (CEP), elle a aidé sa mère dans la distribution vente de savons. Puis, elle alla en apprentissage de couture pendant 04 ans, mais malheureusement elle n'a pas obtenu le diplôme de fin d'apprentissage pour des raisons personnelles. Néanmoins elle exerçe le métier à la maison sur les commandes qu'elle reçoit et vend également de la glace, du jus de bissape, du yaourt et autres. Depuis 04 ans, elle s'est lancée dans la vente des habits pour enfants, les lingeries de femmes et les chaussures pour enfants. Elle sollicite ce troisième prêt pour renforcer son activité.
texts.en:
Mrs. Martine Z. was born in 1971 in Cotonou and grew up in Abomey in the district of Zou. She is married to Mr. François Hemaho, a cook, and is the mother of five children, three of whom are in her care. After failing her 8th grade school certificate, she helped her mother sell and distribute soap. She then became an apprentice seamstress for four years, but unfortunately did not pass the final exam for personal reasons. Nevertheless, she works as a seamstress at home on a per-order basis and also sells ice cream, hibiscus juice, yoghurt and other products. For the last four years she has been involved in selling children’s clothing, women’s lingerie and children’s shoes. She is requesting this third loan to strengthen her business.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy six dozen outfits and six dozen pairs of shoes

loans.name: Shale

texts.es: Shale tiene 39 años, es casada, tiene tres hijos, viven con su madre que les ayuda en sus labores. Desde pequeña le ha prestado una profunda dedicación al cultivo de la tierra, además cría ganado y vacunos, se levanta a las 4.00am, prepara los desayunos y almuerzos, después de dar de comer a sus animales o de lo contrario los lleva al campo para pastear, regresa a preparar el almuerzo y lo lleva a la chacra donde su esposo con los peones trabajan. Cuando no es tiempo de cultivo o de cosecha sólo sale a pastar a sus animales. A ella le agrada la agricultura y ganadería, pero nos dice que la chacra es muy rentable cuando produce bien, y se recupera el doble de lo invertido, solo que la dificultad es el alto costo de los fertilizantes, ellos tenían previsto comprar 10 sacos, pero sólo podrán comprar 5. Este es su 7mo préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, y es puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero solicitado comprará fertilizantes y pesticidas para sus chacras de papa, y está muy agradecida por el dinero que le facilitarán, de ese modo podrá abonar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Shale is 39 years old, married, has 3 children, and they live with her mother who helps them with their work. Since she was little she has farmed, as well as raised cattle and sheep. She gets up at 4:00 AM, prepares breakfast and lunches, then feeds her animals or takes them to the field to graze. Then she returns to prepare lunch and takes it to the farm where her husband and laborers work. When it is not the season to farm or harvest she only goes out to graze her animals. She enjoys farming and raising livestock. She tells us that farming is very profitable when the harvest is good, and she then doubles her investment. What is difficult is the high cost of fertilizers, and they needed to buy 10 sacks but only could buy 5. This is her 7th loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and she is punctual with her payments. With the money she will buy fertilizers and pesticides for her potato plants, and she is very grateful for the money that will be provided and in this way be able to fertilize her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and pesticide for her crops

loans.name: Cynthia Elena

texts.es:
T. es socia del Bancomunal Niño Divino
T. es conviviente tiene un hijo de dos años 
Empezó hace dos años en el mercado modelo, alquilando un puesto para venta de comida 
Desde que esta en Finca ve que las cosas han mejorado para ella, tiene mas capital.

Ella necesita un préstamo de 600 soles, para comprar productos al por mayor para su restaurante 
Sueña con implementar su negocio con vitrinas, exhibidores y  tener un terreno
texts.en:
T. is a member of the Divine Child Bancomunal. T. lives with her 2-year old child. About 2-years ago, she started the Modelo market, renting a place to sell meals.

Since she has been a member of FINCA things have greatly improved for her and she has more capital. She requests a loan of 600 soles to purchase wholesale products for her restaurant. She dreams of owning her own business to implement showcases, exhibits and to have her own spot.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Wholesale products for her restaurant.

loans.name: Maria Marcelina

texts.es: La señora María Marcelina R. B., de 31 años de edad, madre soltera,  vive en el Paraje Chuorton, Cantón Chuixchimal del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala; ella se dedica al Comercio  (compra y venta de ropa típica) debido a la demanda de sus clientes acudió a la asociación ASDIR a solicitar un préstamo con el cual ella aumentará su capital y así cubrir la demanda de sus clientes; y de esa manera aprovechar la oportunidad que se le está presentando para poder cubrir sus necesidades y darle una mejor condición de vida a su hijo.
texts.en:
Señora Maria Marcelina R. B. is 31 years old and a single mother. She lives in Paraje Chuorton in the town of Chuixchimal in the state of Totonicapan in Guatemala. She buys and sells native clothes. Due to high demand, she decided to apply for a loan through the association ASDIR. She will use this loan to increase capital and inventory. This way she hopes to take advantage of this opportunity and to make a profit so that she can take care of her neccessities and provide a better way of life for her son.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase capital

loans.name: Ominajon

texts.en:
Ominajon B. is 54 years old. She is married with four children. Since she has lived with her husband, she has worked in the business of buying and selling cattle. She walks through the farms and several settlements to buy cattle at the lowest price to be able to increase her profits. She currently has two cows and four calves. Now Ominajon wants to expand her business. Since her children are grown up, she thinks that she will be able to look after more cattle with their help.  She asks for a loan of $800 USD for the term of 9 months in order to purchase cattle. Ominajon expresses her gratitude to everyone supporting her and promises to repay the loan on time. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key place along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cattle in order to expand her business.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda D. is already 33 years old and married to Fernando D., an agent of the Beverages Company. They are blessed with five children: Angelo, 12 years old; Rosemarie, 11 years old; Alvin Jay, 8 years old; Sunsheie Mae, 5 years old; and the youngest, Alexis, 2 years old. Her first three children are all elementary students. They live in Barangay Research Minante 1, an urban area located a kilometer away from the city proper of Cauayan.  

She is a vegetable vendor at the public market in Cauayan City and she is requesting PHP7,000 from the lenders to serve as her additional capital. She wants to improve her business so that she is able to send all her children to school to lead them to a better future.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Morenike

texts.en: Morenike has a shop where she sells and rents video CDs and sells rechargeable phone cards. Her husband is a civil servant and they both have 3 children. Morenike is 42 years old. She is requesting the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more video CDs and rechargeable phone cards to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more rechargeable phone cards and video CDs  to sell

loans.name: Eva

texts.es: Eva tiene 37 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 4 hijos en edad escolar y que la apoyan en su negocio, juntos habitan en su casa propia. Es propietaria y administradora de dos motocarros que compró hace un año para hacerlos trabajar en el transporte de pasajeros. Adicionalmente, vende productos de panadería como; piononos, panes, queques, etc., los cuales adquiere de una empresa muy conocida en su región, y lleva a vender por los diferentes lugares de su zona, dejándolos al crédito o al contado a sus clientes. Esta actividad la realiza hace 6 años y lo que más le gusta es que se mantiene activa y segura de sí misma para salir adelante. Con MFP, ya tiene 14 préstamos, son casi 7 años trabajando con su banco comunal, y le gusta mucho porque se apoyan mutuamente y existe mucha confianza entre todos. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de más productos para el incremento de sus ventas.
texts.en:
Eva is 37 years-old, single, and has 4 school-aged children who help her run her businesses. She owns and operates two motorcyle taxis that she purchased one year ago for the purpose of transporting passengers. She also sells baked goods (breads, cakes, etc.). She purchases these baked goods from a well-known company in the region, and then sells them in different areas of town. She's run this business for 6 years, and she enjoys the fact that it keeps her active and confident in her ability to move forward. She has received 14 loans from MFP (her community bank) over the last 7 years, and she appreciates the mutual support and trust between the bank and herself. She will use this loan to purchase more goods so she can increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Jim Muir, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase her merchandise

loans.name: Ysolina Jackeline

texts.es:
La señora Ysolina Jackeline A. G. tiene 35 años, vive en el distrito de Florencia de Mora, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella tiene estudios Superiores Completo (Enfermería Técnica), tiene 1 hija que depende económicamente de ella.
Ysolina se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, así como la elaboración de bocaditos; éste último lo realiza para eventos particulares; su negocio lo desarrolla en su propia casa.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco Comunal Unidas para un Futuro Mejor II, lo invirtió en la compra de productos de belleza.
Con el crédito de S/. 1000 soles que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de una vitrina para exhibir sus productos.
Ysolina tiene como sueño crecer como empresaria y tener su propia tienda de perfumería.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ysolina Jackeline A. G. is 35 years old and lives in the Florencia de Mora district, in the province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad, Peru. She has a college degree (technical nursing), and has a daughter that is financially dependent on her. Ysolina works selling beauty products and making snacks. She makes snacks in her own home for particular events. With her first loan of 300 soles that she received from the United for a Better Future II Communal Bank, she invested in the purchase of beauty products. With this loan of 1,000 soles, which she will repay over 4 months, she will invest in the purchase of a glass cabinet to display her products. Ysolina dreams of growing as a businesswoman and of having her own perfume shop.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a glass display case

loans.name: Basilia

texts.es:
Basilia es socia del Bancomunal Mujeres del Dos Mil.
Basilia  es conviviente tiene  51 años seis hijos  los menores tienen 15 y 9 años, ellos están estudiando en la escuela estatal.
Basilia  trabajaba en un taller de zapatos era maquinista, el taller cerro quedandose sin trabajo por un tiempo, pero ella creció viendo hacer tamales a su mamá, su mama tiene un negocio de tamales una  cartera de clientas amplia y cuando su mamá estaba de edad, ella se hizo cargo del negocio de tamales, ella reparte a cafeterías, universidades. Semanal reparte más de cuatrocientos tamales. 
Basilia necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para la compra de  maíz, aceite, hoja de plátano, pollo y chancho. 
Desde que Basilia esta en Finca su negocio ha crecido, aprendió ahorrar y ser puntual en los pagos y en todo. 
El sueño de Basilia es  tener cada día más clientela.
texts.en:
Basilia is a member of the Mujeres del Dos Mil Community Bank. Basilia, 51, is in a common law marriage and has six children. They younger ones are fifteen and nine; they go to the state school. Basilia worked in a shoe shop as a machine operator. The shop closed, and she was left without work for a while. But, she grew up watching her mother make tamales. Her mother had a tamale business and a large client base. When her mother got older, Basilia took over the tamale business. She delivers to cafeterias and universities. She delivers over four hundred tamales weekly. Basilia needs a loan of 1,000 PEN to buy corn, oil, banana leaves, chicken, and pork. Since Basilia has been in Finca her business has grown, she has learned how to save, and how to be punctual in her payments and in everything. Basilia’s dream is to have more customers every day.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn, oil, banana leaves, chicken, and pork

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase stock in bulk for her store

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 52 years old, married, and is the mother of six children: one is currently in school and the others are independent.

Elizabeth is a trader. She trades in lace materials, textiles and clothing materials. She buys stock from the central market of Kumasi and sells through hawking (going door-to-door). Lace materials are very useful for room and office decorations.

However, for lack of adequate working capital, Elizabeth buys only a small stock of lace materials. With the loan, she wants to purchase lace materials and textiles in bulk. She believes the loan will enable her to grow her business to the expected level. She hopes to use part of her profit to provide her children with a quality education.

loans.use: To purchase lace materials and textiles in bulk

loans.name: Badal

texts.ru: Мунаварова Бадал проживает в районе Шахритуз. Возраст 58 лет. Замужем, имеет 5 детей. Бадал имеет магазин, где торгует запчастями от велосипеда. Муж вместе с сыном работают продавцами. Этим видом бизнеса занимается более 10 лет. Кредит просит для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Badal M. lives in the Shahrituz district. She is 58 years old, married and has five children. Badal has a store where she sells spare parts for bicycles. Her husband and son work together as salesclerks. She has been engaged in this type of business for more than 10 years. She is requesting a loan to increase her inventory.

Translated from Russian by JD Bergeron, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expanding her inventory

loans.name: Alexander Jose

texts.es: El joven Alexander José López, tiene la edad de 24 años, habita en el barrio, Santiago, ubicado en la concepción, junto a su esposa la cual trabaja y le apoya con los gastos del hogar, ellos tiene a su cargo un niño de un año de edad ; los planes hacia su familia es poder construir su vivienda, ya que donde habitan actualmente es en un cuarto que le dio su mamá, la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento ya que su salario no le ajusta para construir. Con el préstamo va a comprar materiales de construcción y comenzar hacer su casa. Da las gracias Afodenic por darle la oportunidad y lograr su meta en poder tener una casa digna para su familia.
texts.en:
Alexander José López is 24. He lives in the Santiago neighborhood, which is located in Concepción. He lives with his wife. She works and helps with the household expenses. They have a one year old child. The family plan is to be able to build their house. They are currently living in a room that his mother gave him. The greatest difficulty he has is the lack of financing. His salary is not enough for the construction. He will use the loan to buy construction material and start building his house. He is grateful to Afodenic for giving him the opportunity to achieve his goal of being able to have a decent house for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction material to start building his house

loans.name: Loveth

texts.en:
Loveth is 33 years old and married with four children. She lives in Warri with her family.

Loveth sells tailoring materials to take care of her family. She is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more tailoring materials to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: Pov

texts.en: Mrs. Pov K. and her husband have been growing rice and vegetables since they were married. In addition, she produces palm leaves used for roofing. She sells them in her village. Pov, 52, and her husband, Mr. Koet Choun, 54, were married in 1979 and have five children: three sons and two daughters. Three of the children are married and live in separate homes, and two unmarried children live with their parents. They live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Pov is requesting a loan of $350 to purchase a motorbike for her unmarried son to drive as a motor taxi. She is pictured with her son.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her son to drive as a motor taxi

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the We are Leaders village bank. She is married, 46 years-old and has three children who are 27, 20, and 18. They work and study at an institute. Carmen is a geriatric nurse who worked at a hospital from 7 p.m. to 7a.m. for many years. She raised her children by herself when her husband stopped working and neglected his family. Twelve years ago, with the help of a friend, she started to sell clothes and shoes and her clients have increased. She has obtained new places to sell clothes and she travels all the way to Trujillo, Northern Peru, to bring back shoes and clothes to sell.

Carmen has received a lot of support and training for her business and how to obtain more clients from Kiva partner FINCA Peru. Carmen is asking for a loan of 800 soles to buy more shoes from Trujillo. Her dream is to have her own store to sell clothes and shoes.

loans.use: To buy shoes.

loans.name: Independencia Group

texts.es:
INDEPENDENCIA
     La señora Maria del Carmen L. L. ( blusa blanca sentada en el sillón )que cuenta con 60 años de edad estudio hasta segundo de secundaria, ella se entero  de este crédito por medio de un conocido y decidió formar su grupo con amistades que tiene desde hace tiempo y así juntas formar su grupo que llamaron Independencia.
     Ella se dedica a la venta de antojitos en una escuela primaria cercana a su comunidad tiene 34 años en su actividad ya que su mama la crió vendiendo y ahora ella con su actividad se sostiene y mantiene a su familia, ella cuenta hasta el momento con dos carros ambulantes y piensa agrandar su negocio un poco mas. Para ella es importante su negocio ya que con el a podido sacar a adelante a sus hijos, ella cuenta con dos carros ambulantes para su venta, uno lo atiende ella y el otro su hermana, su negocio es conocido y querido por todos los niños de la escuela ya que doña Carmen dice que es por su buen carácter y aparte por sus precios económicos. Ella tiene planeado comprar otro carrito para así poder hacer crecer su negocio, doña Carmen tiene la confianza de poder lograrlo. La mayoría del grupo se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos, comida. La comunidad donde ella vive es Rió Blanco VeraC., es una comunidad llena de muchos locales comerciales y aparte se caracteriza porque cerca esta el palacio y el parque municipal.

Ella se siente feliz por contar con el apoyo de Fundación Realidad

La UDE esta integrada por:

Reynalda R. Pérez
Concepción R. G.
Domitila MonterR. Méndez
Leonor M. Pérez
Magdalena C. C.
Carolina S. López
Laura E. L.
Nayeli C. L.
Maria Guadalupe Monica C. L.
texts.en:
Maria del Carmen (in the blue blouse seated in the big chair), who is 60 years old, studied up to the 2nd year of secondary school. She found out about this loan source from someone she knew and decided to form a group of longtime friends. And, thus, together they formed the Independence Group. She sells snacks at a primary school near her community. Maria has been doing this for 34 years, just as her mother did when she was born. And now Maria continues the business and supports her family. At present, she has two vending carts and wants to enlarge her business a bit more. For her, the business is important since it has enabled her to help her children advance. She tends one cart while her sister tends the other. Her business is well known and loved by all the children at the school. She thinks this is due to her good personality and the economic prices she charges. Maria plans to buy another cart to see if she can make her business grow. Maria is confident that she can do this. The majority of the group sells clothes, shoes, and prepared food. The community where they live is Rio Blanco. There are many commercial stands and nearby is the municipal palace and park. She is happy that she can count on the help of the Realidad La UDE Foundation. Her Group is made up of Reynalda, Concepcion, Domitila, Leonor, Magdalena, Carolina, Laura, L., Maria Guadalupe, and Monica.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a cart to be able to sell in more places

loans.name: Celestina

texts.en:
Celestina M. is from the village of Sta Cruz. She is 49 years old. Celestina is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Celestina owns & operates a bakery, selling bread in the local community. Celestina has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 15000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Celestina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Celestina has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Celestina is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional ingredients. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Celestina from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita B. is 45 years old and living in Cagayan Province on the island of Luzon; her home is in Barangay Baculud in Iguig Municipality. She is happily married and has four children. They are Jayson, 21 years old and of college age; Karen Joy, sixteen years old and a college student studying information technology; Jhon-Jhon, twelve years old and a grade VI pupil; and Jerico, seven years old and a grade I pupil.

Estelita manages her store while her husband is a farmer in their village. Since her husband does not have regular work, she started her own business to provide another source of income. Together they are helping one another meet the needs of their family.

Estelita wants her business to improve, and this is the reason why she is asking to borrow 5,000 PHP from KIVA lenders through Alalay sa Kaunlaran, Inc. (ASKI). She plans to buy more commodities to offer to her customers. She is hoping that her business will continue to improve for the sake of the future of her children.

loans.use: To buy additional commodities to sell in her village store

loans.name: Dennis

texts.en:
Dennis D. is from the village of North Poblacion, Guinsiliban Camiguin Province. He is 42 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Dennis makes and sells food, snacks and beverages in the local community. Dennis has been in business for over nine years and earns approximately 3,200 PHP a month.

In 2009, Dennis joined HSPFI to access financial services to improve his living situation and to engage in business. Dennis has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI.  He is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products to sale.  This loan will be his second from HSPFI.  He plans to use the additional profit from the business to improve and expand his business. 
-----------------------------
About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: Purchase raw ingredients to make products to sale.

loans.name: Sunday

texts.en: Sunday is a LAPO client. He is single, without children. He is 36 years old. He is a focused, hard worker. He sells printing materials and stationery, wholesale and retail, to his customers. He has been in this business for a long time. He needs a loan amount of NGN 150,000 to purchase more printing materials and stationery to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more printing materials and stationery to sell

loans.name: Jill

texts.en:
Jill C., 57 years old, is a mother of five adult children. She is also a farmer, and she grows corn and rice in Banga, South Cotabato in Mindanao. Currently, she tills a 1-hectare corn and rice field. Her farm is doing well and she wishes to make it more productive to augment her income.

She needs additional capitalization in her business. She wants to avail a loan of Php 12, 000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies. She will also pay the laborers, who helped her prepare the soil for planting.

loans.use: Farm supplies and payment to laborers

loans.name: Juana Dominga

texts.es:
Juana pertenece al banco comunal “PALCCARAQUI” de la Asociación Arariwa, tiene 45 años, es casada y tiene un hijo llamado Jhon William, tiene 23 años y es docente. Juana vive en la provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco. La ciudad de Urubamba esta a una hora y media de la ciudad del Cusco.
  
Juana se dedica a la venta de verduras, ella nos cuenta que manda verduras ínter diario a la ciudad de Puerto Maldonado a su clienta Olimpia. Ya son cuatro años que vende verduras y le esta yendo muy bien gracias a su empeño que pone en su negocio. 
La socia requiere el préstamo para hacer trabajar la chacra donde siembra las semillas de las verduras de lechuga, asnapa, flor amarilla, choclo y muchas verduras más. Juana es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que quiere sacar adelante a su familia y el préstamo de 2500 soles es una buena ayuda para seguir haciendo trabajar la chacra. 
 
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the Communal Bank “Palccaraqui”, which is part of Asociación Arariwa. She is 45 years old, married, and has a son named Jhon William. He is 23 years old and works as a teacher. Juana lives in the Province of Urubamba, Department of Cusco. The city of Urubamba is 1½ hours away from the city of Cusco.

Juana sells vegetables. Her vegetables are shipped daily to the city of Puerto Maldonado by Olimpia, one of her customers. Juana has been selling vegetables for four years and has done very well as a result of her hard work.

She needs a loan so that she can begin planting crops on her farm. Juana will acquire seeds for growing lettuce, snap peas, sunflowers, corn, and other vegetables. She is a hardworking mother and entrepreneur who wants her family to get ahead. This loan of 2500 soles will allow the work on her farm to continue.

Juan is grateful for this opportunity and promises to complete her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds

loans.name: Allahyar

texts.en:
Allahyar N. is 59 years old. He is married and has 3 children. Allahyar and his family live in the Fuzuli region.

He has been in this business for 10 years. Now Allahyar needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy 4 calves.

loans.use: To buy 4 calves

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es:
LA SEÑORA  RUTH ES CLIENTA DE EMPRENDER, ESTA CASADA Y TIENE HIJOS QUE SE ENCUENTRAN EN EDAD ESCOLAR,ELLA EMPEZO EL TRABAJO DE VENTA DE DULCES EN EL COLEGIO PABLO CANO, ELLA SOLO VENDIA EN LAS AFUERAS DEL COLEGIO EN UN PEQUEÑISIMO CANASTITO DE DULCES, BASTANTE HUMILDE CON LO POCO DE CAPITAL QUE TENIA, AHORA QUE LA SEÑORA YA VENDE MAS DE 10 AÑOS EN LAS AFUERAS DEL COLEGIO, LA DIRECTORA DEL ESTABLECIMIENTO DECIDIO DARLE UN TRABAJO COMO PORTERA DEL COLEGIO YA QUE ELLA MOSTRO UNA GRAN  RESPONSABILIDAD Y DEDICACION AL CUIDADO Y MANTENIMIENTO Y BUEN TRATO A LOS ALUMNOS, ES POR ESA RAZON QUE LA SEÑORA ACCEDIO AL CREDITO CON FONDOS KIVA. SE OBSERVA EN LA FOTO SU KIOSCO CERRADO POR QUE TODAVIA NO EMPEZO LAS CLASES EDUCATIVAS. EL DESTINO DEL CREDITO SERA PARA COMPRAR MAS PRODUCTOS Y PODER LLENAR SU KIOSKO YA QUE YA PRONTO SE INICIARAN LAS CLASES.

LA SRA. RUTH ESTA AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Ruth is a client of Emprender. She is married and has school-age children. She started the work of selling sweets in the Pablo Cano School. She sold outside the school from a very small basket of sweets. It was quite humble considering the small amount of money that she had. Now she has been selling outside of the school for over ten years. The school principal decided to give her a job as a janitor because Ruth showed great responsibility and dedication to care and maintenance. She also treated the students well. That is why she got a loan with Kiva. In the photo you can see that her kiosk is closed because classes have not started yet. The loan is to buy more products to be able to fill her kiosk because classes will start soon. Ruth is grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence given by granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase work capital

loans.name: Antonia Del Rosario

texts.es: La clienta Antonia Del Rosario E. Gonzales  tiene 3 años de estar laborando Con CEPRODEL-El sauce, este es el segundo crédito otorgado con vuestra oficina, habita en la comarca san Nicolás municipio Achuapa, se dedica a la actividad de compra de novillo para bueyes  el crédito solicitado  es para la compro de 2 novillo de desarrollo el cual el cliente lo ase bueyes y lo vende a un mejor precio, tiene su propia finca la inversión la realiza en su propiedad para así sacarle aprovecho y obtener un mayor ingreso y abastecer la necesidades de su familia.
texts.en:
Antonia Del Rosario E. G.has been a member of the CEPRODEL - El Sauce bank for three years and this is the second loan she gets through Kiva. Antonia lives in the region of San Nicolás, in the municipality of Achuapa. She buys calves, then sells them once they are grown. She will use this loan to buy two calves, which she will grow and then sell at a better price. Antonia owns her own farm; the profit her business makes, she invests in the farm, increasing her income and fulfilling the needs of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying calves

loans.name: Vicente

texts.en:
Vicente P. is from the town of Poblacion East, Sta. Ignacia, Tarlac. He is 36 years old. Vicente is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Vicente owns & operates a business selling seasonal fruits in the market. Vicente has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Vicente joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vicente is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Vicente from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Ndiouthie

texts.fr: Ndiouthie S. est une femme de 32 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 7 enfants et responsable de 2 autres qu'on lui a confiés. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 8ans et a été 16 fois de suite bénéficiaire de crédit. Son nouveau prêt lui permet de développer un élevage de moutons et de volailles, parallèlement elle fait un petit commerce d'huile de palme. Elle soutien son mari pour la prise en charge familiale.
texts.en:
Ndiouthie S. is a 32-year-old woman who is married with 7 of her own children plus another 2 whom have been entrusted to her care. She has been a member of the Village Bank for 8 years and has had 16 consecutive loans. Her new loan will allow her to develop her sheep and poultry rearing business. Alongside this, she runs a small palm oil business. She supports her husband with household expenses.

Translated from French by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To support her businesses

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
At least 75% of Cambodian people have been involved in farming businesses. Mrs. Chea K. is the one of these people. She has been farming since she was single. At 64 years of age, she is blessed with six children. Five of them are now married and live independently, while another one is single and a fisherman. She is married to Chhum Sot, age 68, who works fishing around the river. 

Chea K. will be using this loan to purchase raw materials and turn them into fishing tools for her husband to use to fish. (Mrs. Chea K.'s husband is in the photo here.)

loans.use: To purchase raw materials and turn them into fishing tools

loans.name: Diciples Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Comfort A. is  a mother of 4 and married to a junior high school teacher. Comfort sells smoked fish, grass cutters and antelope meat at the bush meat market near Sunyani and has been in this business for the past 7 years. Until last year she singlehandedly paid the bills of the home including children's school fees when her husband decided to further his education. 

Comfort is required to  pre-finance hunters who supply her with the bush meat in the form of bullets so they do not give their catch to other traders. Raising enough money for this has always been her worry, hence her desire for this loan.

Comfort is the leader of 'Disciples trust bank' which has been in existence for 3 years. The group which has a membership of 6 ply their trade in the same market and as result know and trust each other. Comfort was elected leader due to her soft-heartedness and has been able to bind the group together over the years. The group hopes to use this loan to pay for goods that they would have bought on credit  at a higher price.

loans.use: Purchase bush meat (antelope) and smoked fish

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: Michael G. is from the city of Divisoria, Santiago. He is 34 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Michael owns and operates a business manufacturing and selling vinegar. He has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Michael joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. Michael is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. This loan will be his third from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products

loans.name: Azizboy

texts.en: K. Azizboy is 39 years old. Azizboy has been raising cattle for the last five years. Over the years of his activities, two of his children became adults and now help him as well as his wife. Currently, Azizboy has three heads of the cattle in the household. This type of business is rather time-consuming and labor-consuming. At the same time, it generates stable profits. Now Azizboy is planning to purchase more cows and fodder for them. For this purpose, he requests 4,000 Somoni. This is the first loan for Azizboy and he is grateful to everyone for trusting him and supporting him and promises not to let them down. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road, and for the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing three cows and fodder

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian C. is currently in the business of selling bread and tomatoes and is requesting a loan to stock cooking oil to sell.  Lilian is 19 years old and is single. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.  BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Sheloh

texts.en:
Sheloh D. S. is from the village of Tagaloan, Misamis Oriental. She is 25 and married with two small children. Sheloh sells seafood including fish and shrimp in the local community, which she has done for over 4 years earning approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Sheloh joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Sheloh is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the second loan taken out by Sheloh from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: William

texts.es:
William es un padre de familia de 35 años de edad, tiene un hijo dependiente, vive junto a su familia en el caserío Maravillas, una zona agrícola del distrito de Mochumí, zona perteneciente a la provincia de Lambayeque, situada a cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte en una mototaxi (motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina utilizada en el transporte de carga y pasajeros). El lleva nueve años trabajando en esta actividad, usualmente brinda su servicio uniendo la ruta de Mochumí con su caserío y otros caseríos aledaños. Adicionalmente percibe ingresos vendiendo algunos animales que el mismo cría. Con estas actividades el sostiene la economía de su familia.

William desea realizar algunas labores de reparación y mantenimiento de su unidad móvil ya que, debido al continuo uso y al estado accidentado de los caminos del lugar, ha sufrido algunas fallas que requieren de urgente reparación para garantizar su correcto funcionamiento, para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

William es un joven tranquilo y bastante entregado a su familia, en la zona donde vive el es bastante conocido y estimado por sus vecinos, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como transportista y llegar a tener una mototaxi mas.
texts.en:
William is a 35-year old father who has one dependent child. He lives with his family in the town of Maravillas, an agricultural area in the district of Mochumí, Lambayeque, about 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. He dedicates himself to providing transportation services with his mototaxi (a motorcycle outfitted with passenger seating and storage areas). He has been carrying out this activity for nine years, usually providing service along routes in Mochumí and other neighboring areas. He also generates income by selling livestock that he raises himself. He provides for his family financially through these activities. William would like to do some repairs to his vehicle. Because of continuous use and the bad state of the local roads, he has experienced some breakdowns and is in urgent need of some mechanical work so that his mototaxi will continue to run properly. In order to meet his goal, he has found himself having to turn to Edpyme Alternativa for the first time for a loan of 1500 Peruvian soles. William is a calm young man, and very dedicated to his family. He is well-known and liked by his neighbors, and his greatest wish is to continue growing his business and buying another mototaxi.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for repairs and maintenance for his mototaxi.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca has been practicing mixed farming for the last 20 years in Kisii, Western Kenya. Her farm produces sugarcane, bananas, maize, beans, and milk, which she sells to the local market. She is happy with her farming activities since she has been able to provide for the basic needs of her family with the income.

Rebecca recently completed her second loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 50,000 Kenyan Shillings and has requested this loan of 50,000 Kenyan Shillings to purchase a dairy cow. She says that if the returns from this loan are good, then she will be able to educate her children and build rental houses.

Rebecca is 51 years old and married, with six children between the ages of 17 and 25. Two of her children attend school.

Rebecca would like to increase the scale of her sugarcane farming. She however faces the challenge of lack of capital for expansion and poor prices.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Janechit Rosell's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Janechit R., 33 years old and married, is a resident of Catadman, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. Janechit is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Janechit R.’s Group.

Janechit is blessed with 2 school-aged children. She is involved in operating a sari-sari (variety) store and selling longganisa (sausages). Janechit receives support from her husband, Marcelino, who is an automotive painter. After 3 years of operating the store and selling longganisa, Janechit is able to maintain the business and the couple now earns an average monthly net income of at least PHP 6,000, which is very helpful to their family income.

Janechit joined the cooperative in 2009 upon hearing the good news of PAGLAUM MPC being one of the most outstanding cooperatives in Northern Mindanao. As an active member of the PDP-LP Program of PAGLAUM MPC, a microfinance program that reaches out to the rural poor, she has successfully repaid a loan of PHP 7,500. She is now requesting an amount of PHP 10,000 as her 3rd cycle loan to be used for additional capital for her existing businesses. The future income from this loan will be used to improve her family's living conditions, to meet their basic needs, to repay loans to PMPC and for savings, the children’s education and possible business expansions. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her businesses

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita G. is 54 years old, married and has two adult-aged children. She is from the village of Barcolan, a part of Bamban municipality in the central Luzon islands. Rosita has a general store from which she sells a variety of different products to the local community. Rosita has been in business for over two years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2008 Rosita joined ASKI to gain access to its financial services. Rosita successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from ASKI which she used to purchase new items to expand her line of products. Rosita is requesting a new loan, her third from ASKI, of 8000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional inventory to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business.

About ASKI:

Alalay sa Kaunlaran, Inc., or ASKI, is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and -women, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy additional products to sell

loans.name: Haguruka Group

texts.fr:
Aline M. est une femme commerçante âgée de 32 ans qui habite au Quartier Musaga en Mairie de Bujumbura. Elle fait le commerce des produits alimentaires de boutique a Musaga, un métier qu’elle exerce depuis 18 mois. Elle a fréquenté l’école jusqu’en 9e année de l’école secondaire. Son maria fait ses études jusqu’en 10e année,
C’est un chauffeur. Elle arrive au 3e cycle dans le crédit Communautaire avec Turame. 

Elle est mère de 3enfants qui sont à l’école primaire.
  
Elle demande le crédit Kiva pour  changer le type de business en tenant un restaurant mais aussi continuer en achetant de grandes quantités de produits alimentaires de boutique à revendre aux clients et ainsi pouvoir accroitre ses économies. Elle a préféré demander le crédit à Turame car elle a beaucoup de facilites a rembourser. Son rêve est de  mener une meilleure vie ensemble avec ma famille au travers du commerce qu’elle a commencé.
 
Elle  est une des membres du groupe  Communautaire« Haguruka».
texts.en:
Aline M. is a woman merchant, aged 32, who lives in the Musaga districts of Bujumbura, the capital of Burundi.  There in Musaga, she runs a grocery store.  This is a trade that she has been working at for eighteen months.  She has attended the 9th grade.  Her husband has attended the 10th grade.  He is a chauffeur.  

Aline is the mother of three children who are in primary school.  She is asking for a Kiva loan in order to make a change to running a restaurant business but also to continue with her shop by buying large amounts of food products to resell to customers.  Thus, she will be able to increase her savings.  She has preferred to ask Turame for a loan because it would be easy for her repay.   

Through the business she started, she has a dream to lead a better life together with her family.  

She is a member of the community group "Haguruka".

loans.use: changer le type de business en tenant un restaurant mais aussi continuer en achetant de grandes quantités de produits alimentaires de boutique à revendre aux clients

loans.name: Maria Ilda

texts.es:
María Ilda es una madre de familia de 63 años de edad, es viuda y reside en el caserío La Hollería, una zona rural del distrito de Mórrope, se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores. Ella cría ovejas, cerdos y aves de corral en un ambiente acondicionado cerca a su domicilio y cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes de la zona. Con estos ingresos ella sostiene sus gastos y aporta a la economía de su familia.

María desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo mas ovejas y alimento balanceado de modo que sus animales se puedan desarrollar de mejor manera y pueda adquirir mayores ingresos al momento de realizar sus pagos. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Ella es una mujer tranquila y bastante trabajadora. Las personas de la zona le tienen bastante estima y le consideran una persona honrada y confiable.
texts.en:
Maria Ilda is a mother, a 63 year old widow, and she lives in La Holleria settlement; a rural area in the district of Morrope located in the Lambayeque province.  It is more than 1 hour from the city of Chiclayo.

She raises and sells small animals.  She raises sheep, pigs, and poultry in an air-conditioned environment near her home and when they have developed sufficiently she sells them to local merchants in the area.  With the income she covers her expenses and contributes to the household.

Maria wishes to expand her business by acquiring more sheep and balanced feed so her animals can develop better and she could then receive greater payouts upon sale.  That is why she has solicited a loan for 1000  ($375) nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternative.

She is a very tranquil person and very hard working.  People in the area have great appreciation for her and consider her an honorable and reliable person.

loans.use: Puchase more sheep and balanced feed so her sheep can grow better.

loans.name: Estella

texts.en:
Estella manages a general store in her village. The loan she borrows from lenders helps her maintain the growth of her business. Estella hopes that someday, she can expand her general store. She is very thankful to all the lenders for all their support and she will do her best for her business to become profitable.

Estella works hard, not only for herself to have a better life, but also to help others in need. She is hoping to have a long life so that she can continue her mission in life. ASHI is her second family; she found it through staff and her co-members. She enjoys the people that she meets while selling her goods. That’s why Estella is very happy and motivated all day.
 
Her previous loan from KIVA provided working capital to expand her business and purchase more inventory for her store. Positive growth from her business has helped Estella finance her needs. Since joining ASHI, Estella has experienced positive changes in her life, using the additional income to support her nephew who has enrolled in a doctorate degree in university. Estella hopes her business will continue to flourish so she can provide long-term financial stability for her family. Therefore, she is now requesting another KIVA loan, this time for 45,000 PHP, to purchase more inventory of food for her store. This will allow her to grow her business further so that her nephew can fulfill her dreams of completing a doctorate degree and experiencing a life that’s full of contentment.

Estella’s one hope in life is to have savings in the future for her retirement because she’s now getting older. Thanks in advance to all supporters for funding this loan. Again, this is a great opportunity for making her dreams come true.

loans.use: To buy more inventory of food for her store

loans.name: Kahaso

texts.en:
Kahaso is a married woman with eight children, seven of whom attend school while one is still too young. She lives in a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, clothing and school fees. 

She has operated a food stall business selling cooked rice, beans and fried potatoes. She sells from home, selling to her neighbours and passersby.  In addition she also sells charcoal, contributing to her other source of income.  Kahaso faces a major challenge of seasonality and competition in her business.  She hopes to  build her own house in the future.
