With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase 10 trays of eggs for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans and improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase 10 trays of eggs for resale.

loans.name: Tusitukire Wamu Women's Group, Mpigi

texts.en:
54-year-old Margaret K.'s affiliation is with Tusitukire Wamu Group, Mpigi. Margaret, who is a widow and a mother of eight, says she runs a rental and farming business. This diligent lady has been selling poultry for the last decade in Mpigi.

Margaret was previously a housewife. She was also doing some cattle keeping, though it was not her real business. She later came to the realization that to better her circumstances, she needed go hammer and tongs at the idea of setting up her own enterprise. It was about that time that she decided to get into that “walk the walk” stride as she took root.

With this loan she says she is going to procure more chicken mash for her poultry. This she envisions will insure the healthier growth of her chickens.

loans.use: To buy more chicken mash

loans.name: Shaiq

texts.en:
Shaiq A. is a 46-year-old family man. He is father to one son and two daughters who attend school. Shaiq lives with his family in the Marzali village, Imishli region. He is a hard-working man who makes a living breeding cattle and selling meat and dairy. He has been involved in this business since 2005 and his father helps him in it. 

This is Shaiq’s second loan from Aqroinvest. He successfully repaid his first loan. Shaiq used the loan of 1000 AZN to buy one cow. Now he has two cows but after repaying this loan he would like to take out another loan to buy four more cows. Shaiq is very thankful to Aqroinvest and KIVA for the opportunity to expand his business so his family can make a better living.

loans.use: to buy one cow

loans.name: Yeremakono Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Yeremakono, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 47 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Klacouma, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font le commerce de condiments alimentaires et de vans.                                                                                     
Les femmes du groupe Yeremakono sont à leur dixième prêt solidaire  et SATOU K., un membre du groupe, compte utiliser le sien pour acheter, des condiments alimentaires.                                                                          
SATOU K. s’approvisionne dans différents marchés, par exemple Massigui pour les condiments frais. Elle effectue ses ventes sur place au village, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de essentiellement de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 10 000FCFA  qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, les dépenses de la famille et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Yeremakono group are all married, are on average 47 years old with 4 children, and all live in traditional, extended families in the village of Klacouma, Dioïla prefecture, in the Koulikoro region (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). 

They met each other through family connections and sell condiments and baskets. The women are on their second group loan and Satou K., one member of the group, plans to use her loan to buy condiments. Satou gets her supplies from various markets, for example, Massigui for fresh condiments. She sells her products locally in the village, for cash and on credit, to customers who are mostly women. Satou expects to make an average monthly profit of 10,000 CFA francs which she will use to pay the loan installments and for her family's expenses, and the rest will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: To buy condiments

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn, a married mother of three children between the ages of 19 and 22, lives in San Remegio, Cebu, where she has two businesses: a general store and a load retailer venture. Her husband Renato F., 47, works as a driver to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities.

Evelyn joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past six loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, she has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 20,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 9,600, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her seventh loan, she is borrowing PHP 20,000 to buy more groceries for the general store to resell so that she can continue to save up for future house repairs and the children's education. Evelyn is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF:In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase stocks of groceries for the general store

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos, de 52 años, es un hombre jovial y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa y sus 4 hijas de los 6 que son en total. A lo largo de toda su vida, Carlos ha trabajado en diferentes oficios, pero lo que más le gusta y tiene domino es la albañilería. Desde entonces construye casas así como también realiza los acabados correspondientes, por lo que sus clientes quedan satisfechos por su trabajo. las personas que saben de su trabajo; le recomienda a otros interesados, siendo así que Carlos, es muy solicitado por sus obras realizadas: E la actualidad trabaja a lado de su hijo, quien la apoya, contratando a los obreros que terminarán de hacer el vaciado del techo o realicen cimientos. Lleva trabajando 35 años en esta labor y espera en el futuro, conformar una empresa constructora en sociedad con su hijo, de ese modo podrá mejorar su calida de vida. Es el 12avo crédito con MFP, por lo que espera no retrazarse en sus cuotas, asimismo es muy respetuosa con las socias de su banco comunal. De obtener el crédito solicitado, comprará madera, material que necesita para la construcción de viviendas.
texts.en:
Carlos, aged 52, is a jovial and hard-working man who lives in his own house with his wife and 4 of their 6 children. Throughout his life, Carlos has worked in different trades, but what he likes most and has mastered is cement masonry. Since he took that up he has built houses and done the finish work on them. His customers have been very satisfied with his work. Those who know his work recommend him to other interested persons. As a result, Carlos is much in demand, based on his past efforts.

Currently, he works alongside his son who helps out, contracting workers to build the roof structure or do the cementing. Carlos has been working for 35 years in this trade and he hopes that in the future, he and his son can start a construction enterprise together, thus improving their standard of living.

This is his 12th loan with MFP and he so he knows he won't fall behind in his payments. Moreover, he is very respectful towards his fellow communal bank members. With this loan, Carlos will buy wood, materials that are necessary in house construction.

loans.use: TO BUY WOOD FOR HIS HOME CONSTRUCTION BUSINESS

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama A. is married and has seven dependants. Ama cooks banku (a staple in Ghana made of a mix of fermented corn and cassava dough, usually served with fried fish) at Abbrem Agona near Abura, Cape Coast, which she has been doing for four years. Her husband is a storekeeper. Ama uses her income to pay for their children’s school fees and utility bills. Ama will use the loan to purchase extra bags of maize and other ingredients to prepare banku for sale. Her business objective is to reinvest her additional capital.

loans.use: To purchase extra bags of maize and other ingredients to prepare banku for sale.

loans.name: Chhourn

texts.en:
Chhourn S., 64, resides with her family in Siem Reap province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkorean temples. S. sells Cambodian noodles, earning an income of about $15 per day. Each month, the family has to spend $50 on food and $10 on the other necessary expenses. 

S. is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for the family's use. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for the family's use

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.es:
Asuncion tiene 72 años de edad y es viuda. Vive en casa propia con tres hijos mayores.  Vive en Morropon, una ciudad ubicada en el departamento de Piura, a más de 4 horas de Chiclayo, el capital de la región de Lambayeque. 

Desde más de 14 años se dedica al cultivo y mantenimiento de arroz que siembra en un pequeño terreno cerca de su domicilio. Vende sus productos en el mercado local el cual conoce muy bien y se estima un buen precio para su arroz. Asuncion es muy conocida en la zona y cuenta con una clientela muy establecida. Posee buenas referencias personales y laborales de su comunidad urbana.

Desea invertir su préstamo en la compra de fertilizante e insecticida. Espera ampliar su producción de arroz para poder vender más y obtener mejores ganancias. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles. Ha tenido otros préstamos y siempre cumple con sus obligaciones de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Asuncion is 72 years old and a widow.  She lives in her own home with three grown-up children.  She lives in Morropon, a town in Piura department, more than 4 hours from Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

For more than 14 years, Asunción has been growing and looking after the rice that she sows on a small plot of land near her home.  She sells her produce in the local market which she knows very well and where she gets a good price for her rice.  Asunción is very well known in her area and she has a very well-established customer base.  She has good personal and work references from her community.

Asunción would like to invest her loan in buying fertilizers and insecticides.  She hopes to expand her rice production so that she can sell more and make better profits.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  She has had previous loans and has always made her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es: Marcelino, es natural del distrito de Santa Rosa, tiene 34 años de edad, es un hombre muy alegre y trabajador, convive con Marisol Navarro de 25 años y fruto de esa relación hoy tienen 03 hijos y juntos viven en una casa alquilada en la jurisdicción de Santa Rosa, pero a su vez cuentan con vivienda  propia situado en la comunidad de Anteccasa anexo del distrito de Santa Rosa. Marcelino, empezó su aventura como agricultor desde muy niño en las tierras de sus padres. Su pasión  por el agro lo llevó a adquirir sus propias tierras donde viene trabajando 17 años de manera independiente; en el cual viene cultivando  plantas de café, hojas de coca y plantaciones de café; en total posee 05 hectáreas y media de terreno. En tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de los jornaleros quienes se encargan de extraer con mayor rapidez los frutos de cada producto y de esa manera logra avanzar con mayor celeridad en cuanto a su trabajo. Se siente muy comprometido con su labor; porque  gracias a su esfuerzo cotidiano hoy disfruta al ver que los frutos de sus plantas le resultan, así obteniendo buenas ganancias por cada kilogramo de producto vendido. Asimismo nos menciona que la  estación de invierno no es de su agrado porque en estos meses abundan los insectos y las precipitaciones de las lluvias, impidiendo el rendimiento de su trabajo y perjudicando sus plantaciones. El crédito solicitado es para la compra de un vehiculo moto carguero, que le servirá como utilidad de transporte para así trasladar sus productos desde la chacra hasta los centros de acopio. Pero ahora lo que más prioriza es repoblar sus cultivos que quedaron dañados con las lluvias intermitentes propias de la naturaleza. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, esta dispuesto a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que desea acceder a otro crédito más adelante. A la vez se siente muy contento con la institución por  proporcionarle el crédito. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles solicitados, comprará un moto carguero lo cual le servirá como medio de transporte para trasladar sus productos desde la chacra hasta los centros de acopio.
texts.en: Marcelino, 34,  is a native of the Santa Rosa district.  He is a cheerful and hardworking man who lives with Marisol Navarro, 25, and their 3 children.  They all live together in a rented home in the jurisdiction of Santa Rosa, but they also own a home in the community of Anteccasa, an annex of the Santa Rosa district.  Marcelino started his business as a farmer when he was very young, working his parent's land.  His passion for agriculture led him to acquire his own land that he has been working independently for 17 years, cultivating coffee and coca leaves.  In all, he has 5 and a half hectares of land.  At harvest time he hires workers who help him to harvest the products more quickly, so that he can achieve faster progress with his work.  He is very dedicated to his job, because thanks to his daily efforts he is able to see his plants bear fruit and obtain good profits from every kilogram of product that he sells.  He asserts that he does not like the winter because during these months the insects are abundant and this negatively affects his crop yields.  The loan that he is applying for will be used to buy a cargo motorcycle to quickly deliver his products to the collection centers. But now, his priority is to replant his cultivations that were damaged with the intermittent rains.  This is his first loan with MFP, and he is ready to make all of his payments on time, since he wants to be able to access credit in the future.  He also feels very pleased that the institution is providing him with this loan.  With the 3,000 Peruvian soles requested, he will buy a cargo motorcycle that will he will use to transport his products from the farm to the collection centers.

loans.use: to buy a cargo motorcycle to transport his products.

loans.name: Vitelio

texts.es:
Don Vitelio, tiene 62 años de edad, reside en San Rafael Oriente, departamento de San Miguel, es agricultor y vive con su esposa y una hija de 28 años de edad, todos trabajan en su hogar, y el realiza sus labores como agricultor desde muy joven, cuando su padre lo llevaba de compañía al campo, no tiene un horario fijo y actualmente necesita un préstamo para la inversión en la siembra que se aproxima.
Con los fondos del préstamo piensa comprar fertilizantes y preparar la tierra, con esta ayuda le dará continuidad al trabajo que por años ha realizado con mucha dedicación y aprecio.
Las aspiraciones de don Vitelio es tener un amplio terreno cultivado, recibir una buena cosecha y compartir con su familia.
texts.en:
Vitelio is 62 years old and lives in San Rafael Oriente, in San Miguel department.  He is a farmer and lives with his wife and 28 year-old daughter.  Everybody in his household works.  Vitelio has worked as a farmer since he was very young, when his father would take him along to the fields with him.  Vitelio doesn't work fixed hours.  He currently needs a loan to invest in his upcoming sowing season.

Vitelio plans to spend his loan money on buying fertilizers and preparing his land.  This help will give him continuity in his work which he has carried out for years with a lot of dedication and appreciation.

Vitelio's aspirations are to own a large plot of cultivated farmland, to have a good harvest and to share with his family.

loans.use: to buy manure for his crops

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Cleopatra Domitila

texts.es:
Cleopatra de 65 años, es una mujer inspiradora en su trabaja que después de jubilarse abrió una pequeña tienda en su domicilio.

Ella labora diariamente en todo el día. En su negocio le dificulta la competencia  por que alrededor de ella hay mas tienda que más productos. Con el préstamo quiere comprar más productos como arroz azúcar. En un futuro ella desea tener otra tienda en otro lugar de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Cleopatra, 65, is an inspiring women because after retiring, she opened a small store in her home.


She works all day every day.  What is difficult for her is the competition because there are stores around her that have more products.  With the loan she would like to buy items such as rice and sugar.  In the future she would like to have another store in another part of the city.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar and supplies for her store

loans.name: Gladys Elisa

texts.es:
El Banco comunal se denomina “ SEÑOR DE COYLLURITTI DE CCORAO”; Este Banco se encuentra situado en el Poblado de Ccorao - Pisac, perteneciente a la Provincia de Calca, Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Gladys, la socia tiene 35 años de edad, la socia es casada, la socia tiene 2 hijos de 6 y 12 años de edad; la socia compra y vende artesanía, ella vende la artesanía que compra al por mayor en Pisac en los almacenes grandes y los lleva a vender a Qorao que es otro poblado para no tener mucha competencia. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de artesanía. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida y desea expresar que cumplirá de manera  disciplinadamente con los pagos de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Señor de Coylluritti de Ccorao” and it is located in the town of Ccorao – Pisac, which forms part of the Province of Calca and the Department of Cusco.

Gladys is 35 years old, married, and has two children who are 6 and 12 years old. She buys and sells handicrafts, buying them at wholesale in Pisac at the large warehouses and then bringing them to sell in another town called Qorao, where there is little competition. She is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of handicrafts.

Gladys is grateful and wishes to state that she will be disciplined and make her loan repayments.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of handicrafts.

loans.name: Segundo

texts.es:
Segundo tiene 58 años, es casado vive con la esposa y con los hijos en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 9 hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO PUCARA se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad Pucara Parroquia Guanujo, cantón Guaranda a una distancia de 15 minutos de la oficina de la cooperativa, esta ventanilla integran 22 socios que se dedican a la agricultura, crianza de animales y a la comercialización de venta de legumbres.

Segundo se dedica al comercio de granos y gramíneas y a la agricultura tiene cuatro cuadras de terreno, siembra papas, maíz, trigo y cebada tiene cinco cuadras de ganado. Las compras las realiza en el mercado de Guaranda y las vende en el mercado mayorista de la misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos y alimentación de los animales. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es mejorar el negocio para un bien futuro a sus hijos.

Le gusta lavar el vehículo, participar en las fiestas del pueblo y ser colaborador.
texts.en:
Segundo is 58 years old, married, and lives with his wife and children in Guaranda canton, in Bolívar province.  He has nine children.

The Pucara Group community bank is located in Pucara community, in Guanujo parish, in Guaranda canton, 15 minutes from Cooperativa's offices.  This bank has 22 members who work in farming, livestock raising and vegetable sales.

Segundo sells grains and grasses.  He also farms.  He has over six acres of land where he sows potatoes, corn, wheat and barley.  He has five head of cattle.  He makes his purchases in Guaranda market and makes his sales in the wholesale market in Guaranda.

Segundo is requesting this loan to buy supplies and feed for his animals.  The support of this loan will help him to financially cover his needs.  He faces challenges in his work such as pests, plant diseases and changes in the weather.  His dream is to improve his business so that he can provide a good future for his children.

Segundo enjoys washing his car and taking part in his village's fiestas.

loans.use: to buy supplies and feed for his animals

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es: Vicente, tiene la edad de 54 años, está casado y vive con su esposa y sus 5 hijos, que son su mayor prioridad. el pretende con el dinero realizar la compra de almacigo para sembrarlo. El cuenta con el terreno y tiene una parte que se encuentra en condiciones regulares por lo cual sembrara mas cantidad de matas para poblar esa área y mejor la calidad del cafetal. El lo que pretende es generar ingresos para el bienestar de su familia y así poder seguir adelante con sus proyectos y mejorar su cafetal. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Vicente is 54 years old and married.  He lives with his wife and five children who are his main priority in life.  He plans to use his money to buy seedlings to sow.  He has a plot of land and part of it is in decent condition so he will sow a larger quantity of plants to cover this area and improve the quality of his coffee plantation.  What he plans to do is generate income for the well-being of his family.  He plans to make progress in his projects and improve his coffee plantation.

This is the first loan that Vicente has received from FUDECOSUR.  He has not received previous loans from state banks but FUDECOSUR have offered him this loan with better repayment terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy seedlings

loans.name: Erika

texts.es:
Doña Erika tiene la edad de 32 años, estudio solo la preparatoria y esta casada con el señor Jose Alfredo el cual trabaja de agricultor, ellos tienen un pequeño hijo de nombre Alfredo de siete años de edad que asista a la primaria, Doña erika y su familia viven el el estado de Oaxaca en una comunidad llamada Tetela la cual se caracteriza por estar ubicada en una zona cañera a solo 15 minutos del ingenio productor de azucar don pablo machado.

Doña erika nos platica que hace un poco mas de dos años decidio iniciar a trabajar para poder ayudar a su esposo con os gastos del hogar, asi que decidio iniciar a vender cosmeticos y perfumeria por catalago, con sus amigos y vecinos de la comunidad, ella nos platica que primero lleva sus catalagos a mostrar con sus clientes, posteriormente levanta un pedido y lo encarga con sus proveedores, cunado llega el pedido lo entrega y resive el pago por sus productos, ella nos dijo "Gracias a Dios siempre hay un poco de venta El da para todos", ella necesita este cretito para invertirlo en la compra de catalogos, cosmeticos y perfumeria para su posterior venta. ella espera que con este credito su negocio prospere ya que desea que dar a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida y darle mas estudios.
texts.en:
Doña Erika is 32 years old and only has a preparatory school education. She is married to Sr. Jose Alfredo, who works as a farmer. They have a seven-year-old son named Alfredo who attends elementary school. Doña Erika and her family live in the community of Tetela, which is in the State of Oaxaca. This town is located in an area known for growing sugar cane and is 15 minutes away from the Don Pablo Machado sugar mill.

Doña Erika says that more than two years ago she decided to start working so that she could help her husband with the household expenses. She sells cosmetics and perfumes through catalogs to her friends and neighbors in the community. Erika says that she brings the catalogs to show to her customers. After she receives an order, she submits the request to her distributors. When she delivers the order, Erika collects payment for the products. She says, “Thanks to God, I always am able to make a few sales. He gives me everything.”

Erika needs this loan to invest in the purchase of catalogs, cosmetics, and perfumes for later resale. She hopes that this loan will help her business prosper. Erika wants to give her son a better quality of life and help him further his education.

loans.use: to purchase catalogs, cosmetics, and perfumes.

loans.name: Kibet

texts.en:
Kibet  is 38 years old and married with four children between eight years and two years old. His spouse is a business lady who supports him in meeting some of the family's financial needs and other obligations.

He is a livestock trader who started this business two years ago. He gets a profit of KES 16,500 per month from this business. He has borrowed a loan of KES. 5,000 from KADET Ltd. He intends to use the money to purchase young livestock to fatten and later resale them.
 
He intends to use the profits from the business to build rental houses in his plot. His dreams is to educate his children and build his family a good residential house.

loans.use: To purchase more stock

loans.name: Elchin

texts.en: Elchin has been in the business of cattle ranching for the last eight years. He is only 29 but already a very experienced and successful entrepreneur. He has a good client history with AqroInvest. With his previous two loans, he was able to expand his business and purchase more sheep for his herd. The breeding business requires a lot of dedication and effort, since it requires the strict control of each animal, including feed and care for those that are older. Through this business, Elchin is able to support his family. He applied for a 1500 AZN loan to purchase more sheep and to expand his farm.

loans.use: to purchase twenty sheep.

loans.name: Diyaa

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 34 years old and married.

Diyaa has been a tailor since 2004. He makes and repairs men’s clothing. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs and a good reputation and he is well known in his area.
 
He is requesting a $2400 loan to buy  a diesel generator. He is aiming to earn more profit so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a diesel generator.

loans.name: Babina

texts.en:
Babina is 51 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Babina is borrowing PHP 19,500 through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to raise. She has been raising livestock for six years and earns additional income by farming rice.

She is working tirelessly towards her dream of expanding her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional livestock to raise.

loans.name: Akif

texts.en:
Akif  is a married father of three children. He runs a small grocery store selling food products in the downtown area of his hometown. Akif 's store is well-known in this neighborhood as he serves his customers well and works late hours, which are very convenient for many customers who work late and go shopping after they are finished work. Akif has been in this business for 7 years and his monthly profit is about 180 AZN. 

Akif's son actively helps him in his business. Akif is seeking a loan of 1,500 AZN to purchase foodstuffs to increase the variety of his selling products. This will allow Akif to increase his monthly profit and improve his family's life.

loans.use: to purchase more foodstuffs to increase product variety

loans.name: Noemii Luz

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN RAFAEL”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Noemi Luz; ella tiene 51 años de edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de ferretería, ella vende clavos, pinturas, tornillos y repuestos, la socia trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 9:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de ferretería. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería como clavos, tornillos y pinturas al por mayor. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Noemi Luz belongs to the "San Rafael" community bank which is located in Cusco district, in Cusco province and department.

Noemi Luz is 51 years old, married, and has four children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her hardware business.  She sells nails, paint, screws and spare parts.  She works from 7.00am to 9.00pm and, through this business, she gets her children ahead in life.  Noemi Luz would like to expand her hardware business.  She is requesting this loan to buy merchandise such as nails, screws and paint wholesale.

Noemi Luz is happy to be receiving her loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as nails, screws and paint wholesale

loans.name: Hanezel

texts.en:
Hanezel is married with two children. She is 29 years old and lives in Fatima, Liloy, Zamboanga Del Norte.
Hanezel runs a grocery store to earn a living and has had this business for three years. Each month, she earns 11,000 PHP from her grocery store business and her other business. She has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase grocery stock.
Hanezel has been a member of Kiva partner, PMPC, since 2011. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase grocery stock.

loans.name: Khudoynazar

texts.ru: Худойназар житель района Кубодиён. Возраст, 57 лет. Он женат. У него шестеро детей. Худойназар более 10 лет занимается торговлей на рынке. Он арендует торговую точку, где продает рис. Кредит берет для приобретения разных сортов риса.
texts.en: Khudoynazar lives in the Qubadiyon district.  He is 57 years old, married and has six children.  Khudoynazar has been involved in retail sales at the market for over 10 years.  He leases a retail outlet, where he sells rice.  He is requesting this loan to buy different varieties of rice.

loans.use: to buy different varieties of rice

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 61 years old and lives in the small village of Tinago, Province of Siquijor.  She is married with four children.

Alicia has a general store to earn a living and has had this business for one year.  Each month,  she earns PHP 2,000 doing this type of work.  She has requested a loan of 7,000 pesos to purchase stock for her general store.

Alicia has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for nine months.  In the future, Alicia hope to have a savings deposit and able to renovate their house.

loans.use: To purchase  stock for her general store.

loans.name: Dina  Doris

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal ”LAS TRIUNFADORAS”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Andahuaylillas en la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Dina; La socia tiene 34 años de edad, la socia es conviviente, la socia tiene 2 hijos de 11, 9 años de edad, la socia trabaja vendiendo tejidos en la ciudad de Cusco, la socia teje a mano chompas para bebes, ella compra al por mayor lanas y botones para la elaboración de los diferentes tejidos como chompas, chompones, ropones, botones, babuchas y otros en lanas, gruesas y delgadas. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de lanas al por mayor delgadas y gruesas, y en todos los colores, también comprara botones en motivos animados.

La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Dina belongs to the "Los Triunfadoras" communal bank, located in Andahuaylillas district, in Quispicanchis province, in Cusco department. She is 34, lives with her partner, and has two children, ages eleven and nine. 

She sells woven articles in the city of Cusco. She knits baby sweaters by hand. She buys wool and buttons at wholesale, for making different woven articles such as sweaters, long sweaters, baby gowns, buttons, slippers, and other woolen articles, fine and coarse.

She is applying for the loan to buy wool at wholesale; both fine and coarse gauge, and in all colors. She will also buy cartoon character buttons. 

Dina is grateful for the loan, and promises to pay her instalments in accordance with the schedule of payments.

loans.use: To buy wool at wholesale; fine and coarse, in all colors, and also cartoon character buttons

loans.name: Twigarukire Group

texts.fr:
Médiatrice est une commerçante âgée de 42ans qui habite la localité de Bwoga de la Province de Gitega au centre du pays. Elle fait le commerce de produits alimentaires (haricots, riz, huile végétale…) depuis 5 ans. Elle est aussi cultivatrice. Elle a fait ses études jusqu’en 6e année primaire. Elle est mariée et mère de 8enfants dont 6étudient. 
 Le crédit Kiva  de 100,000 francs burundais qu’elle obtient lui permet d’augmenter son capital pour acheter de grandes quantités de produits alimentaires (haricots, riz, huile végétale…)  à revendre  afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices. 

Elle est membre  du groupe  communautaire« Twigarukire»
texts.en:
Médiatrice is a 42-year-old merchant who lives in the town of Bwoga, in the Gitega province, in the center of the country.  She has been buying and selling grocery products (beans, rice, vegetable oil) for five years.  She is also a farmer.  She attended school up to the sixth year of primary school.  She is married and the mother of eight children, six of whom attend school.
The Kiva loan of 100,000 Burundi francs will increase her capital, allowing her to buy large quantities of items (beans, rice, vegetable oil) to sell in order to make large profits. 
She is a member of the “Twigarukire” community group.

loans.use: to increase her capital, allowing her to buy large quantities of items (beans, rice, vegetable oil) to sell in order to make large profits.

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un jeune célibataire sans enfants.Après avoir arrêté ses études au collège, il est embauché par son oncle comme conducteur de motocyclette de transport urbain.Il épargne pendant deux ans et achète sa propre moto qu'il conduit lui- même.Cette activité lui assure des revenus assez substantiels.Il prend ainsi en charge une bonne partie des dépenses d'alimentation de sa famille et appuie ses frères dans l'achat de fournitures scolaires et le paiement de certains frais scolaires.Il sollicite un prêt de 200000f pour compléter son capital et acheter une seconde motocyclette.Son ambition est de constituer un parc de moto de transport.
texts.en:
Mamadou is a young, single man with no children. After dropping out of high school, he was hired as a motorcycle driver for his uncle's urban transport business. He then saved up for 2 years so that he could buy his own bike. His income is quite substantial and enables him to take care of a large part of his family´s food expenses. He also helps his brothers with their educational expenses, including buying school supplies and contributing to tuition fees.

Mamadou is requesting a loan of 200 000 francs so that he has enough money to buy a second motorbike. He would eventually like to build a fleet of urban transport motorcycles.

loans.use: to buy a second motorcycle.

loans.name: Maasai Dip A Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Maasai Dip A Group in Western Kenya! Jackton is the facilitator of the Maasai Dip A group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Jackton takes care of three children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to access One Acre Fund's best prices offered and to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds to ensure quality farm produce. In the recent 2011 season, Jackton had a very good maize yield harvesting 18 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, he was only able to harvest one bag of maize on one acre of land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Jackton and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Jackton will educate his children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Maasai Dip A group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Maku Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Maku Group in Western Kenya! Jane is the facilitator of the Maku group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Jane is a mother of two children. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Jane had a very good maize yield harvesting 9 bags on 1/2 an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Jane was only able to harvest 5 bags of maize on 1/2 an acre of land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Jane and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

With income from maize sales, Jane will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing. In 2012, the members of Maku group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Chanboreth

texts.en:
Chanboreth is 26 years old and lives with his wife in a village about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 2009 and have one young daughter.   

Chanboreth and his wife are garment workers. They stay with his parents, but they want to live in separate home by building their own house. Hence Chanboreth is applying for his first loan in the amount of $1,000 in order to construct the building.

loans.use: To build his own house.

loans.name: Yuriy

texts.ru:
Юрий выращивает ранние овощи – помидоры и редис. У него уже есть три большие теплицы и две маленькие (для рассады). Участок земли у него достаточно большой, поэтому Юрий хочет развивать свой бизнес дальше и строить еще одну теплицу.  Ему нужно успеть построить ее до морозов и вовремя посеять семена. Юрий – трудолюбивый и ответственный. Эти качества помогают ему преуспевать не только в бизнесе, но и в жизни.
Юрий просит предоставить ему кредит в размере 20,000 гривен на постройку теплицы и покупку пленки.
texts.en:
Yuriy grows a variety of vegetables, including tomatoes and radishes.  He has three large greenhouses plus two small ones for seedlings.  He has enough space to expand his business, so he wants to put up another greenhouse.  He needs to build it and plant seeds before the frost.  He's hard-working and responsible, qualities which help him thrive not only in business but in life.

Yuri is seeking a loan of 20,000UAH to build his greenhouse and purchase plastic sheeting.

loans.use: to build another greenhouse and purchase plastic sheeting.

loans.name: Eleonor

texts.en:
Eleonor is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Eleonor has a pigpen and sells grown and mature pigs. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy animal feeds for the pigs.

Eleonor has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Eleonor hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Mayra Alejandra

texts.es:
En la ciudadela La California de  Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Las Divinas.

Aquí conocimos a Mayra tiene 19 años  de edad y está soltera, estudia Auditoria en una Universidad en la ciudad de Manta. Vive en casa de sus padres.
 
Ella además de estudiar también trabaja en sociedad con su mamá, ellas tienen una pequeña copiadora/papelería en su casa en la cual vende  útiles escolares y dan el servicio de copiado, allí trabaja en las tardes y noches ya que en las mañanas tiene que ir a su universidad, en la mañana su mamá se encarga del negocio.  Ellas llevan  con este negocio dos años en los cuales les ha ido muy bien.
 
Este crédito es una parte para comprar útiles escolares para el negocio y también para pagar gastos de sus estudios. Lleva 5 ciclos en el Banco Comunal, es la fiscal de reglamentos y le gusta por la ayuda que le brinda la institución.
 
Sus sueños terminar sus estudios y tener un gran negocio.
texts.en:
The Las Divinas Community Bank meets every fifteen days in the town of La California de Portoviejo, the capital of Manabi and known as the city of real tamarinds. 

Mayra, 19 and single, studies accounting at a university in the city of Manta. She lives with her parents. 

Along with keeping up with her studies, she partners with her mother to run a small stationery store out of their house. There they sell school supplies and make copies. Mayra works in the afternoons and evenings, and while she attends class in the morning her mother runs the store. They started the business two years ago, and it has been successful so far. 

A portion of this loan will be used to purchase school supplies for their business, and a portion will be spent on Mayra's school expenses. She has been with the community bank for five loans and is the officer in charge of rules and regulations. She likes all the help she receives from the institution. 

Her dreams are to finish her studies and run a great business.

loans.use: purchase school supplies and pay for university

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
ENGLISH

Catalina is 48 years old and she was born in Monterrey, N.L. and she sells shoes and jewelry. She works selling her merchandise from house to house, offering credit to her clients and repayments monthly. She has more than 50 clients in her portfolio and she gives to them everything they need regarding school articles and home articles. Catalina has more than 6 years of experience as a business woman; she is married and has 4 sons. She needs a loan of $1,200 to invest in merchandise and be prepared for the last quarter and is requesting 6 months to repay. Caty is determined to establish her business in a formal way.

SPANISH

De 48 años de edad, Catalina es originaria de Monterrey, Nuevo León y se dedica a la comercialización de Calzado y Joyería. Ella trabaja vendiendo casa por casa, su mercancía en abonos, y cuenta con una cartera de más de 50 clientes, a quienes le surte todo lo que necesiten en cuanto a artículos escolares y aparatos para el hogar. Cuenta con mas de 6 años de experiencia como comerciante, esta casada y tiene 4 hijos. Caty esta solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de $13,000 a 6 meses para poder surtirse y estar preparada para las ventas del ultimo tetramestre del año. Tiene como proyecto a futuro poder establecer formalmente su negocio en un local fijo.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her business

loans.name: Seyfulla

texts.en: Seyfulla Z. lives in the Ulguc village in the Agsu region of Azerbaijan. He raises cattle and sheep. He is 46 years old and is married with four children. He wants to purchase additional animals to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase additional animals

loans.name: Lusia Alosio

texts.en: Lusia of Seesee has made a beautiful stall in front of the dairy shop for selling Samoan favorite foods such as Palusami (cooked taro leaves mixed with coconut cream), taro, banana and yam. Lusia only opens her business on Mondays, Tuesdays and Saturdays and other days, she works collecting coconuts, taro, banana and yam from the plantation for the preparation of her food stall.  Her husband works full time on their plantation and he provides great support to her business. She normally earns a net profit of $180 from selling her food products to the public. This lady manages her business very well. She is requesting a loan so she can purchase supplies for processing her the food she sells.

loans.use: To purchase more supplies for the processing of food

loans.name: Marcial

texts.es:
Marcial is a young man of 27 and is married but does not have children. He is the only child of a single mother and was never able to count on the support of his father. Because of this, he helped his mother with the household income from the time he was very young. When he was 12 years old, he began selling blankets in the streets, a traditional activity in Carapeguá. When he was 15 years old, he began selling things on his own, working hard even when it was cold, raining, or very hot, always enthusiastic and with a desire to get head.

After several years of sacrifice and saving, he began another business with his new companion in life. He and his wife opened a bar where they sell fast food and also grocery items. He wishes to return to selling woven blankets, because his wife handles the bar very well, and in order to increase their income, he wants to begin selling blankets again. He is asking for a credit of $450.00, which he will use to buy various types of blankets. This will help him prepare to receive the children he and wife dream so much of having.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Marcial es un joven de 27 años, casado pero sin hijos. Hijo de madre soltera no contaba con el apoyo de un padre por lo que desde muy pequeño ayudo a su madre con los ingresos de la casa. Desde los 12 años ya se desempeñaba como ayudante en las ventas ambulantes de colchas, actividad tradicional en Carapeguá. A los 15 años se independizó iniciando su actividad por cuenta propia, sacrificándose en días de frío, lluvia o intenso calor, entusiasmado por el deseo de progresar. Luego de varios años de sacrificio y ahorro, se inició otro negocio con su nueva compañera en la vida, el abrió junto con su esposa un bar donde se dedican a la venta de comidas rápidas y también una surtida despensa. El desea reinvertir en su actividad inicial, ventas de colchas de hilo, pues su esposa se desempeña bastante bien en el bar y para aumentar los ingresos de ambos el desea volver a vender las colchas. El esta solicitando un crédito de $450 que los invertirá en la compra de diversos tipos de colchas, para prepararse a recibir los hijos que tanto sueñan tener junto con su esposa.

loans.use: To buy woven blankets for re-sale

loans.name: Maria De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
Maria de los Ángeles is a very hardworking and responsible woman. She is married, and has a 27 year old son. They are originally from Escobedo in Nuevo León. Her husband receives a very small salary and it is not sufficient to meet the expenses of the house. Because of this, Maria has set herself up to the sale of natural products and thanks to their good quality she has succeeded in pulling in large numbers of clienents and has been able to expand her business

Maria is asking for a loan in the sum of $750 so she can fill her current log of orders. She has dedicated herself to repay the loan in 6 months, and with it she hopes to improve the quality of her service and continue expanding as before. Maria sincerely thanks you for the confidence and help you give her.

Translated from Spanish by Eric Strader, Kiva Volunteer

Maria de los Ángeles es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable, está casada y tiene un hijo de 27 años de edad, ellos son originarios de la localidad de Escobedo en Nuevo León. Su esposo recibe un salario muy bajo y no es suficiente para solventas los gastos de su hogar, por esta razón desde hace 10 años Maria se dedica a la venta de productos naturales y gracias a la buena calidad de éstos ha logrado incrementar sus clientes y ha hecho crecer su negocio.

Para poder cubrir los pedidos que tiene Maria está solicitando un crédito de $ 750 dólares mismos que se compromete a regresar en 6 meses, con esto ella espera mejorar la calidad de su servicio y continuar creciendo como hasta ahora. Maria agradece sinceramente la confianza y apoyo que le birndas.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Lucrecia Alcántara

texts.en: Seven years ago, this 33 year old woman, who is the mother of three children, started her business.  Lucrecia sells clothes and curtains.  Every two weeks, she goes to Santo Domingo, the capital, to purchase the goods then resells them in her community.  Generally, she operates the business in her house, but during the holiday season she goes to the public place to lay out her products to increase her sales volume.  With the loan requested, the entrepreneur will purchase more clothes and curtains to sell for the period.  She will also introduce tablecloths in order to diversify her inventory.  That way, she will increase her income and will be in a better situation to improve her children’s life.

loans.use: To purchase clothes and curtains for her business.  Also to introduce tablecloths, in order to diversify inventory.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander has a business selling vinyl windows from a little office near the bus station in Novomoskovsk, Ukraine. There is a huge demand for these quality insulated windows in Novomoskovsk and throughout Ukraine. Aside from being used in new construction, many people are remodeling their apartments and homes with new windows which are much better at keeping the cold out and the heat in. Alexander has been in this business for about two years. His business is doing well and he has been able to help many excited customers replace their old wooden windows with new efficient ones.

Alexander would like to continue working hard to improve his business and support his family. He has requested a loan of $1000 to purchase a new computer that will help him work more efficiently and continue offering professional service.

loans.use: Purchase a computer

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en: “I have two children and live in a small town called Vehari with my family. Our town is located about 350 km from the second largest city in Pakistan, Lahore . Since our town is so far from the city, it is difficult for people to obtain the most basic medicines. We provide a much-needed service and sell basic medicines for colds, fevers, and flus. We need a loan to purchase medicines in bulk so that we can make a reasonable profit by saving on the costs.”

loans.use: Purchase medicines to re-sell to people in my neighborhood

loans.name: Ladimiro

texts.en:
Ladrimiro C. is a successful father and dedicated husband. He has three children, one who is studying nutrition, another who is studying law, and his youngest is still in elementary school. Ladimiro began a small grocery store in 1995 with a small capital of savings which he earned as a carpenter. He was assisted by his wife who prepared and cooked empanadas, pies and other foods to sell at their store. Today it has grown greater and become more popular.

He is asking for a loan so that he may expand the variety of goods that are sold in his store. Flip flops, backpacks, mops and brooms, along with rice, oil, pasta and powdered drinks, are all goods that he will add to his store.

loans.use: To buy flip flops, backpacks, brooms, mops, rice, cans of oil, pasta, flour, and powdered drinks.

loans.name: Santos Carmela

texts.es:
Mrs. Santos Carmela A. C. is 46 years old, she has two children, but only one still requires her care. She lives in the small town of Cuyuchugo in the district of Usquil, Otuzco province, La Libertad department in Peru.

Mrs. Santos only studied until 9th grade of school. In her study center, in the class of "Education for the Job", she was taught how to make simple clothing, and since then she has practiced what she learned, making aprons, dresses, skirts, and other articles of clothing. For some time she traveled through different settlements to offer her creations. Her sales were good and with the profits she set up a small general store.

She started buying basic need products, and little by little she expanded her business. Mrs. Santos is part of the communal bank, "San Juan de Miraflores", where she received her first loan for S/. 300.00, with which she bought cloth, thread, and zippers for her creations.

With the loan for S/. 2500.00, which she will pay back in 4 months, she will travel to Trujillo to buy a sack of rice, sugar, a box of oil, tuna, pasta, and sweets.

Mrs. Santos' dream is to have a business in a central place in Otuzco.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Santos Carmela A. C. tiene 46 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos pero sólo uno aún necesita de su cuidado. Vive en el Poblado Menor de Cuyuchugo del Distrito de Usquil de la Provincia de Otuzco del Departamento de La Libertad – Perú. La señora Santos estudió sólo hasta el tercer año de secundaria. En su centro de estudios, en el curso de Educación para el Trabajo, le enseñaron a confeccionar ropa sencilla desde entonces puso en práctica lo que había aprendido, cocía mandiles, vestidos, faldas y otras prendas; después de un tiempo viajó por diferentes caseríos a ofrecer sus confecciones, las ventas le fueron bien y con las utilidades que obtuvo acondicionó una pequeña bodega. Empezó comprando productos de primera necesidad y poco a poco está ampliando su negocio. La señora Santos forma parte del Banco Comunal “San Juan de Miraflores” lugar en el que le dieron un primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 , con el que compró telas, hilos y cierres para sus confecciones. Con el préstamo de S/. 2500.00 que cancelará en 4 meses viajará a Trujillo para comprar un saco de arroz, azúcar, una caja de aceite, atún, fideos y golosinas. El sueño de la señora Santos es poner un negocio en un lugar céntrico en Otuzco

loans.use: Buying sacks of rice, sugar, and other products for her general store (Con el prestamo comprara sacos de arroz, azucar y otros productos para su bodega)

loans.name: Matluba

texts.ru:
Matluba K. lives in the town of Vahdat. She owns a small business - she sells clothing and shoes at a space that she has at a central market. She has been in this business for the past 6 years. She imports her merchandise from Dushanbe, where she purchases it from distributors. After that, she sells the purchased items at a market in her town. She is 48 years old and has 4 children. He husband does not have a very high income, and for that reason, she must develop her business. Currently, there is a new season and she needs to get a new assortment of the merchandise. To do so, she needs to obtain a loan. This will help her to buy the necessary products and attract new customers. All that will bring her the planned profits. Both her family will be better off and the local residents, who will be able to get seasonal merchandise without leaving the town. She plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Кобилова Матлюба проживает в городе Вахдат. Нигде не работает , но занимается частным бизнесом в сфере торговли. Имеет торговую точку на центральном рынке. Торгует одеждой и обувью. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже около 6 лет. Привозит товар из Душанбе , покупая у поставщиков. А затем реализует на базаре у себя в районе. Клиентке 48 лет и у нее 4 детей. Муж зарабатывает очень мало, поэтому клиентка просто необходимо развивать свой бизнес. Сейчас новый сезон и необходимо закупить новый асортимент товара . Но для этого ей нужно получить кредит для того чтобы увеличить оборотную сумму. Это поможет ей завести новый товар и привлечь новых клиентов. Все это принесет ей запланируемый доход. И в ее сеье все будут довольны и население сможет покупать сезонные вещи , не выезжая за приделы города. Погасить кредит клиентка планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase the inventory

loans.name: Collins

texts.en:
Collins is a married man and he has three children. Two of them are in school. He has been selling pharmaceutical drugs like anti-malarial drugs, cough mixtures, pain relievers, antacids, and other drugs for his village. Due to income to expand his operation, he has planned to register with the National Health Insurance Scheme where patients can buy approved drugs in his facility.

He therefore wants to use his new loan to buy more pharmaceutical drugs to enable him increase sales and income to support his wife who sells fish in the village market and also pay for the kids’ school fees.

He is a member of the group called “Awurade Akae Me”(meaning: God has remembered me). Group members agree in principle to guarantee for each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of anti-malarial drugs, cough mixtures, antacids, etc.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Installée au marché central de mbour Fatou D. vend des tissus ,des pagnes et  des perles trés prisés par les femmes.elle en est à sa premiere demande de crédit et compte renforcer son fonds de commerce. Elle est une mere de famille tres courageuse et travailleuse, avec ce crédit, elle pourra améliorer ses revenus et son niveau de vie et celui de ses enfants. sa clientele est composée essentiellement de femmes mariés.

loans.use: Fonds de Roulement

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Chan N. is 52 years old and has been working as a grocer since 1998. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, transporting passengers from place to place in his town. There are only a few grocery stores in her community and her store is the biggest compared to the others. She can typically make on average around $5 per day of income, while her husband makes around $2.50 per day from a motor-taxi. Chan N. has four children. One is single and is a student and the rest are married and stay outside the family’s home. Recently, Mrs. Chan N. requested a loan from KIVA to purchase more groceries to keep expanding her inventory as well as to meet her customer demand.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to expand her inventory

loans.name: Sao

texts.en:
Mrs. Sao R. is 54 and the mother of six children, one of whom is a construction worker while four others are attending the local school. The last one is too young to work or study.

Mrs. Sao R. is a farmer in Au Krosa Village in Kampong Speu Province. Her husband, Mr. Thon Phan, is a farmer and a bed maker. Since his business is now going well, Mrs. Sao R. decided to ask for a loan to buy wood to make beds. Previously, Mrs. Sao R. obtained a loan from AMK to start her husband's business and she has fully paid it back. Her husband is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy wood to make beds.

loans.name: Essenam

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de 4 enfants, S. Essenam est née le  11/08/1979 à Ahépé. Son mari est chauffeur sans emploi durable et contribue par moment au besoin du foyer.  Ainsi la majorité des dépenses reviennent à la femme. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour l’achat  des produits cosmétique pour développer son activité car malgré sa bonne volonté et son talent elle est limitée par les moyens financiers dans son activité.
texts.en:
Married and a mother of 4 children, S. Essenam was born on 11/08/1979 in Ahépé. Her husband is a driver without long-term employment and he only occasionally contributes to the household needs. Thus the majority of the expenses fall back to the wife. She is requesting this loan in order to purchase cosmetic products to build her business, because despite her good will and talent, she is limited in her activities by a lack of financial means.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of cosmetic products

loans.name: Nen's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nen V., 58, sells porridge in the primary school, and earns around $2.20 per day. She has six children; three are married, one daughter is a hairdresser, and one son is a restaurant cook. Her husband, Mr. Yun Yen, 63, is a taxi driver with a bicycle that has a trailer. With an increasing number of customers, Nen needs to expand her business. She is requesting a loan of $350 to purchase more raw ingredients and meats to make porridge.

Mrs. Nen is a group leader with two other group members. Mrs. Touch Y., 31, sells vegetables. She requests a loan of $250 to purchase more vegetable to sell. Mrs. Saroeun K., 38, provides a photo-scanning service. She requests a loan of $350 to purchase a second-hand motorcycle to use for business transportation. They live in the Ratanak Commune, Battem Bang Province.

loans.use: Purchase more raw ingredients and meat to make porridge to sell

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr:
Agée de 48 ans, Mme Afi D. est une veuve ayant quatre (04) enfants à sa charge. Après le décès de son mari, elle continua l’activité commune qu’elle menait avec ce dernier, c'est-à-dire la culture du mais pour subvenir aux dépenses scolaires de ses enfants et de sa famille. 
Elle sollicite un crédit pour acheter des engrais et accroître sa surface cultivable.
texts.en:
48-year-old Afi D. is a widow with four children in her care. In order to pay for her children’s schooling and to support her family, after her husband passed away, she continued the business they had had together, raising corn. She is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and to increase the amount of land she has under cultivation.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer and to increase amount of land under cultivation

loans.name: Wilma

texts.es:
Wilma es socia del Banco Comunal Ccori Soncco II que significa Corazón de Oro en quechua.
Wilma es casada, tiene 32 años y 2 hijos, Wilma tiene un puesto en el mercado F. Vivanco que esta ubicado en el centro de la ciudad de Ayacucho, en donde vende carne de cerdo, los animales los compra en distintas ciudades como Andahuaylas a donde viaja los viernes y regresa los días domingos, los animales los beneficia en el camal y también vende al por mayor. 
Wilma necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cerdos.
Wilma sueña con tener una bodega surtida en su casa y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Wilma is a member of the Communal Ccori Soncco II Bank, which means Heart of Gold in Quechuan. Wilma is 32 years old, married, and has 2 children. Wilma has a stall in the market F. Vivanco, located in the center of the city of Ayacucho, where she sells pork. She purchases the animals in different cities like Andahuaylas which she travels to on Friday and returns on Sunday. She makes a profit by slaughtering the pigs and also by selling them wholesale. Wilma needs a loan of $325 that she will invest by purchasing pigs. Wilma dreams of having a small stocked store in her house and providing a good education for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Jeanette Chase, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Wilma needs a loan of $325 that will be invested in buying pigs.

loans.name: Bernabé

texts.es:
El señor Bernabé H. tiene tres hijos que a los cuales les quiere dar la mejor educación, para esto su esposa lo apoya incondicionalmente para lograr sus objetivos.
Su lugar de trabajo es un punto público de la ciudad, él presta el servicio de polarizado de autos, a pesar de esto su estancia es permanente y con los 16 años de experiencia su clientela se asegura de buenos resultados, tambien acude a los domicilios cuando se lo solicitan para polarizar los ventanales y las puertas de las oficinas.
Desea comprar material por mayoreo, para esto necesita contar con un buen capital para realizar sus compras en la Cd. de Monterrey, esta operación le mantendrá abastecido por un largo periodo y así podrá obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Bernabé H. has three children to whom he wants to give the best possible education. His wife supports him unconditionally in this goal. Bernabé provides window tinting services for cars. His workplace is on public property in the city, in spite of this it is a permanent location and with his 16 years of experience, his customers can be assured of good results. He also provides his window tinting services at people's homes, to tint their windows or doors. He wants to buy materials wholesale. For this, he needs working capital to buy in the city of Monterrey. This will keep him stocked for a long time and in so doing he can make greater profits.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy material

loans.name: Bilma

texts.es:
Bilma es socia del Bancomunal Perlas de la Sabiduría
Bilma es viuda tiene 55 años, siete hijos de 36 hasta 16 años esta en la  escuela 
Empezó vendiendo tamales  en el norte y ahora que esta en Lima también se dedica a las ventas de tamales
Bilma necesita un préstamo de 800 soles para ampliar su negocio y comprar mas ingredientes para hacer sus tamales y  llevar a otras zonas. 
Los sueños de Bilma son tener su carrito sanwichero y que sus hijos tengan buen trabajo
texts.en:
Bilma is a member of the “Perlas de la Sabiduría” (Pearls of Wisdom) Communal Bank. Bilma is 55 years old with 7 children ages 36 to a 16 year old still in school. She began selling tamales in the north and now that she is in Lima she continues to sell tamales here. Bilma needs a loan for 800 soles to expand her business and buy more ingredients to make her tamales and take them to sell in other areas. Bilma dreams of having a sandwich cart and that her children have good work.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand her business

loans.name: Zinabu

texts.en:
Zinabu M. is forty-five years old. She is married with three children who are currently schooling. She is a petty trader who trades in rice, vegetable oil, tinned tomatoes, yams, onions, beans, maize, dried fish etc. on the top of a table in the local market.

Zinabu says through hard work, she has managed to support two children to finish junior high school and they are about to pursue higher education in senior high school this year, but the last one is primary school. She wants to increase her working capital so that she can purchase stock in bulk. She believes she can achieve more progress and make increased profit and conveniently support her family and her kids’ education. She also believes in education and matters of her kids’ education are of utmost concern to her. She is a member of the community group called "Mpaebofo (prayerful) Trust Group". In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loans and provide support in handling repayment.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and spices in bulk

loans.name: Estela

texts.es:
La Sra. Estela D. de 48 años de edad esta casada con el Sr. Aniseto Cespedes de 50 años, ellos tienen 3 hijos, 1 de ellos esta cursando sus estudios secundarios, los demas ya estan trabajando.
Doña Estela empezó con este negocio aproximadamente en el año 2.005.- con un pequeño capital que poco a poco ahorró de su venta de ropas como macatera, ella decidió abrir para su copetin debido que tiene su local cerca de un colegio, donde tiene gran concurrencia de los alumnos y otras personas, gracias al buen trato y servicio que ofrece.
La Sra. invertiría este crédito para comprar más mercaderías para ofrecer variedades de productos a sus clientes
texts.en:
Estela D., 48, is married with Aniseto Cespedes, 50; they have three children: one is in high school and the other two are already working. Estela opened her business around 2005 with a small amount of capital which she had saved little by little from her street-vending clothing sales business. She decided to open a cafe as she is near a high school where there is a lot of foot-traffic of students and other people, thanks to the good treatment and service which she offers. She will invest this loan in the purchase of more merchandise in order to offer a greater variety of products to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise to retail

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
La señora Vilma C. Z., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Moralinas”, vive en el Jr. Los Andes Nº 636, Distrito de Morales, Departamento de San Martín. Es casada, tiene 51 años, y es madre de 05 hijos, 01 que todavía depende de ella.

Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00, que fue por iniciativa propia, se inició con un pequeño negocio en venta de abarrotes. Tiene 02 años trabajando con el Banco.

En la actualidad continúa con el mismo de negocio, como aceites, fideos, leches grandes y pequeñas, enlatados como atunes, sardinas; galletas dulces y saladas; chicles, chupetines y caramelos, y con el préstamo de S/1,200.00 a plazo de 06 meses, lo piensa invertir comprando más productos para surtir su negocio.

Ella es quien maneja los gastos y ganancias de su negocio. En lo personal, siente mas tranquila, más segura, responsable con el pago de sus cuotas y toma sus propias decisiones.

Vilma, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Vilma C. Z. is a member of the Banco Comunal “Las Moralinas.” She lives in the Morales District in the department of San Martín. She is married, 51 years old, and has five children, one of whom still lives at home. With her first loan of 300 soles, requested on her own initiative, she started a small business selling groceries. She has been working with the communal bank for two years. Currently, she is still running the same business, selling oils, pastas, milk, canned goods like tuna and sardines, cookies and crackers, and candies. With this loan of 1200 soles, to be paid off in 6 months, she plans to invest in more inventory to stock her business. She manages her business's expenses and earnings. She feels calmer and more secure, is responsible in making her payments, and makes her own decisions. Vilma expresses her gratitude to Manuela Ramos for enabling her to grow as a business owner and as a woman.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase stock for her store

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary A. is a 35 year-old mother of three children aged 16, 13 and 5. They are all in school and she hopes she can finance their studies all through at least high school so they can get good jobs. She cooks “chips” in Nyamasaria slum to pay her children’s school fees. As a widow, she is supporting them on her own and asking for 10,000 KSH to expand her business.

loans.use: Food Supplies to expand her business

loans.name: Jesus Confio En Ti (Jesus Has Faith In You) Group

texts.es:
Este banco se encuentra compuesto por 10 integrantes, el banco de emprendimiento se encuentra en tercer ciclo.
RONALD AÑEZ R..- Es el presidente del banco d emprendimiento este Sr. Cuenta con 29 años de edad, vive en el barrio 3 de mayo de la guardia, lado del estadium, el vive en casa familiar con su esposa la Sra. Sandra Flores, ellos cuentan con dos hijos los cuales están en la primaria del colegio. 
La actividad con la que actualmente trabaja el sr. Ronald es la venta de bebidas, su esposa la sra. Sandra, se dedica a la venta de refrescos, en su mismo domicilio. Tienen la idea de seguir trabajando y aumentando su capital para lograr comprarse un lote de terreno. El es una persona que tiene muchas ganas de seguir trabando con nuestra institución.
MARGARITA R. E..- La sra. Margarita, es la tesorera del banco, cuenta con 26 años de edad, vive en casa familiar con su esposo el sr. Joaquín Parejas y su hijo pequeño.
Cuenta con la actividad de venta de ropa nueva juvenil, negocio con el que viene trabajando hace más de una año. Su esposo trabaja en un taller de mecánica como operario. Su mayor anhelo en este caso el esposo es colocar su propio taller de mecánica. 
KATHERINE B. E..-  Es la secretaria del banco comunal, a pesar de tener una corta edad fue nombrada como secretaria del banco comunal. Vive en la zona de la guardia Barrio Victoria, de la plaza a una cuadra. Alquila un cuarto en el cual vive con su esposo y su hijo.
Tiene el negocio de la venta de desayunos, en el mercado de la guardia. Y su esposo trabaja de ripiero, sacando del río material de construcción.
texts.en:
This bank of enterprises is composed of 10 members and is in its third cycle.

RONALD AÑEZ R.: is the president of the bank of enterprises. He is 29 years old, lives in the neighborhood of 3 de Mayo de la Guardia, beside the stadium. He lives in a family house with his wife, Mrs. Sandra Flores, and they have two children who are in primary school. The business that Mr. Ronald currently works in is the sale of drinks and his wife, Mrs. Sandra, is in the sale of sodas in their home. They have the idea of continuing to work and increasing their capital in order to be able to purchase a piece of land. He is a person who very much wants to continue working with our institution.

MARGARITA R. E.: is the treasurer of the bank, is 26 years old, and lives in a family house with her husband, Mr. Joaquín Parejas and their small son. She is in the sale of new youth clothes, a business she has been doing for more than a year. Her husband works in a mechanic’s shop as an operator. Her greatest wish in the case of her husband is that he has his own mechanic’s shop.

KATHERINE B. E.: is the secretary of the communal bank. In spite of her young age, she was named secretary of the communal bank. She lives in the Victoria neighborhood of the La Guardia area one block from the plaza. The rents a room where she lives with her husband and their son. She has a business selling breakfast in the La Guardia market. Her husband works in construction, getting contruction materials out of the river.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock their businesses

loans.name: Lizbeth

texts.es:
Lizbeth  es socia del Bancomunal Mujeres Emprendedoras.
Lizbeth es soltera tiene 21 años, termino el colegio y estudio diseño de modas, llevo curso de costura en una institución pro joven donde aprendió el manejo de maquina   y se puso a confeccionar sabanas y edredones,. 
Lizbeth necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para compra de maquinas industrial para confeccionar. Ahora ella quiere confeccionar polos
Desde que esta en Finca, aprendió a ser responsable con los préstamos y responsadle en su trabajo, también aprendió ahorrar
El sueño de Lizbeth es tener un talle de confecciones.
texts.en:
Lizbeth is a member of the community bank, Bancomunal Mujeres Emprendedoras.

Lizbeth is single, 21 years old, and has finished her studies in fashion design. She took sewing courses in a pro-youth institution where she learned to use a machine and began sewing sheets and comforters.

Lizbeth needs a loan of 1000 soles ($350 USD) to buy industrial sewing machines. Currently, she sews polos.

Since she has been with the Finca, she has learned to be responsible with the loan and responsible with her work. She also has learned to save.

Lizbeth’s dream is to have a sewing workshop.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy industrial sewing machines

loans.name: Emerita Del Socorro

texts.es: La Señora Emerita B. tiene 49 años de edad, casada su esposo de oficio auditor, tiene tres hijos que trabaja y le ayudan a sus padres. Los planes a cortos plazo es terminar la construcción de su casa ya que necesitan algunos arreglos y cambios nuevos. Doña Emerita se desempeña como docente de un centro de estudio desde hace 12 años brinda sus conocimientos para formar hombres y mujeres de bien.Mujer emprendedora y con el apoyo de su esposo e hijos compro una unidad de taxi siendo un ingreso más para la economía del hogar. Como planes es comprar un nuevo vehiculo para brindarles mayor comodidad a sus clientes. También ofrece apoyo de estudio a alumno de primaria y segundaria.Gracias al préstamo que solicita en Afodenic lograra comprar materiales de construcción como: cemento, hierro, bloques, verjas, zinc y otros materiales para construir un cuarto ponerle las puertas. Obteniendo mayor protección.

loans.use: Comprar materiales de construccion para terminar de hacer unos cuartos

loans.name: Ayélé

texts.fr:
Cette femme est une infirmière accoucheuse, pour pouvoir aider les malades qui ont peu de moyens de se procurer des médicaments ; elle a entamé la vente de produits génériques. Une partie de son stock est épuisée, elle veut se réapprovisionner et les moyens dont elle dispose étant insuffisant, elle sollicite un autre crédit de WAGES pour acheter 10 cartons de quinine, 15 cartons analgin injectable, 5 cartons de « lufanter », 10 boite de « surdex », 16 boîtes de serum glocosé.
Elle est mariée et mère de 01 enfant
texts.en:
This is a woman who is an obstetrics nurse. To help patients who have little money for acquiring medicines, she started selling generic pharmaceutical products. Part of her inventory is exhausted. She wants to stock up again. But since the means at her disposal are insufficient, she’s requesting another loan from WAGES to buy: ten boxes of quinine, fifteen boxes of injectable Analgin (painkiller and fever reducer), five boxes of Lufanter (anti-malarial drug), ten containers of Surdex, and sixteen boxes of glucose serum. She is married and the mother of one child.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell generic pharmaceuticals

loans.name: Moussa

texts.en: Moussa is a 39-year-old married man with 2 young children. He has owned a car mechanic repair shop since 2001 and he has been in this sector for the past 15 years. Today, Moussa is requesting to borrow US$ 1,200 to purchase a machine for his job to increase his income.

loans.use: purchase a machine for auto repair

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles N., aged 38 years, is married to Mirian and blessed with two beautiful children aged 11 and 7 years. He lives at Kayole Estate which is near the Soweto slums, and his trousers stall is at Mutindwa market 6 km from his rented house. Charles has been running his trousers stall for eight years and his monthly profit is about 10,000 Kenyan shillings (approximately $130). His wife Mirian operates their electronics shop. Charles wants to use this loan to increase the stock of ladies’ trousers in his shop, as well as to buy bulbs, aerials (antennas) and electrical wires for their electronics shop. Charles hopes that the generated income will enable him to provide for his children's school fees, food for his family, and the ability to live in a better house. He aspires to improve his standard of living in future and to be able to take care of his siblings.
