However, like a river which starts from a small point and then it flows, she would like to start with 3 and then reach 20 or more.

loans.use: Nayioma wants to buy 3 medium size steers.

loans.name: Arzu

texts.en: Arzu A. lives in Agsu city where he has owned a booth at the local bazaar selling household items for the past 10 years. He is married with three children. With this loan he wants to purchase more stock for his business and offer more variety.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to improve his business

loans.name: Faavava

texts.en: Faavava started her grocery store in her village at Mulifanua because she realised there was a big market but hardly any stores to cater for the needs of people in the area. She now cater for one of the most sparsely inhabited areas in the country.

loans.use: To buy sack of twisties and boxes of chicken and turkey tails

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase 2 blow driers, a steam machine and renovate her salon

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
The clothing business is one of the favorites for microentrepreneurs, as everyone needs clothing and there's a ample profit margin in sales of such. In the case of the "pacas", we are talking of even higher margins than those usually found in the business, as these are pressed bundles of new and used clothing that are sent to poor countries as assistance, but end up being traded in an "open" market in this country. The business is even more profitable when you buy unopened bundles, as the element of surprise makes the initial sales price lower for lack of real knowledge of what's in the bundle.

Usually the bundles are made up of clothing which is much more appreciated in the market than the real price paid for the unopened bundle. (Sometimes one can get 'burnt' in the process, but this is a rare occasion, and usually one can at least 'break even' under the most negative clothing bundle conditions.)

Even though Francisca is a young mother, she now needs to take care of her offspring, and therefore is going to start out in this business, which she feels is the most lucrative she can develop. Or as she affirms..."for the time being".

loans.use: To purchase "pacas" (bundles of new and second-hand clothing) for resale

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
JUANA is 37 years old and has three children. She makes and embroiders comforter slips and sells her products with people in her community who take them to sell at tourist areas inside and outside of the state. She belongs to a group called Bajucu 3 together with Ms. Dalia Hernández Méndez (Handicraft Artist) and Ms. Romelia Méndez Hernández (Handicraft Artist). With their loans they will invest in the purchase of cloth and thread in order to increase production and in this way help out with family expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Pendleton, Kiva Volunteer.

JUANA tiene 37 años, tres hijos. Se dedica a confeccionar y bordar blusas de manta, sus productos los vende con gente de su comunidad que los lleva a comercializarlo a lugares turísticos dentro y fuera del Estado. Pertenece al grupo llamado Bajucu 3 junto con doña Dalia Hernández Méndez (artesana) y doña Romelia Méndez Hernández (artesana). Con sus préstamos invertirán en la compra de telas e hilos para aumentar la producción, y de esta forma contribuir al gasto familiar.

loans.use: Handicrafts

loans.name: Véronique

texts.fr:
Mrs. Véronique Z. was born in 1969 in Afagnan and lives with her husband in the village of Ahonlogoé. She is a hairdesser and has had her salon for almost 25 years. Very ambitious, she added the sale of extensions and beauty products to her business. Because of her insufficient means she cannot fulfill her customers’ needs. She is requesting a loan of $150 to stock up on extensions and cosmetic products.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Madame Z. Véronique est née en 1969 à Afagnan et vit actuellement avec son mari dans le village d’Ahonlogoé. Elle est coiffeuse de profession et elle a son atelier depuis bientôt 25 ans. Très ambitieuse, elle a ajouté à son activité la vente des mèches et de produits de beauté. Devant ses maigres moyens, elle n’arrive plus à satisfaire sa clientèle. Elle sollicite un apport financier de $150 pour s’approvisionner en quantité de mèche et de produits cosmétique.

loans.use: Purchase and sale of cosmetic products and extensions

loans.name: Sarswati

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarswati M., 35 years old, lives in Thecho. Thecho village is famous for agriculture and farming. She lives in a nuclear family with her husband, two sons, and a daughter. Her daughter left school and now works in a carpet factory. Her sons are studying in grades 10 and 7 respectively.

Her husband's name is Kazi Babu M.. He is a carpenter and opened his furniture shop 7 years ago. All the requirements of the family are supplied from the shop income. Therefore Mrs. M. is requesting a loan in the amount of US$ 175 to buy timber so that they can fill all their orders for furniture. Her husband makes different varieties of furniture such as beds, tables, and chairs, and also windows and doors .

loans.use: To buy timber for their carpentry workshop

loans.name: Deysi

texts.es:
Deysi is a young, 23-year old mother of little Shanelly, three years old, who has become the light of Deysi’s life and the reason for her daily progress in her job selling prepared meals. Deysi’s partner Luis Alberto, an assistant teacher at a high school, supports her and shares all his decisions with her. They work very hard in order to give little Shanelly an education and give her everything she currently needs. Deysi would like to expand her business selling food, and as she already has her own space, she wants to one day have a restaurant. For this she will need capital to invest, which will make her goal possible in unexpected time. With your help Deysi will achieve her objective in a short period of time.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Deysi una joven madre de 23 años de edad, Shanelly su pequeña de tres años se ha convertido en la luz de su vida y la razón de su progreso diario en su ocupación de venta de platillos preparados. Deysi y su conviviente el señor Luis Alberto, quien es trabajador dependiente (profesor de educación secundaria) la apoya y comparte todas sus decisiones y trabajan muy arduamente para brindarle a la pequeña Shanelly estudios y por el momento darle lo ella necesita.La señora Deysi quiere ampliar su negocio de venta de comidas y como cuenta con un local propio quiere llegar a tener un restaurante y para esto necesariamente requiere de un capital de inversión el cual hará posible su propósito en el tiempo menos esperado. Con tu ayuda la señora Deysi logrará su objetivo en corto tiempo.

loans.use: Expansion and improvement of her store in order to establish a restaurant there.

loans.name: Nelly Rosa

texts.es:
Mrs. Nelly Rosa A. Z. is 50 years old and completed her education through elementary school. She has three dependent children. She lives in the district of Agallpampa in the province of Otuzco in the city of La Libertad, Peru.

Nelly dedicates herself to the sale of animals such as pigs, sheep and bulls. She butchers them and sells their meat in distinct places in the country around La Libertad. She began the business with her husband, but after encountering some difficulties she decided to work alone and she is very happy with the results that she has obtained.

Through some neighbors she was able to join the communal bank “Jesús Nazareno” (Jesus the Nazarene). Through the bank she obtained her first loan of S/. 300.00 (approximately $100.00 U.S.). With this money she purchased two rams.

She is asking for a loan of S/. 1500.00 (approximately $500 U.S.) which she will repay in 6 months. She plans to purchase four rams and a cow.

Nelly dreams of starting a store in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Nelly Rosa A. Z. tiene 50 años de edad, estudió solo primaria completa. Tiene tres hijos que aun dependen de ella. Vive en el Distrito de Agallpampa de la Provincia de Otuzco del Departamento de La Libertad – Perú. La señora Nelly se dedica a la compra de animales como cerdos, ovejas y toros para sacrificarlos y vender sus carne por distintos lugares de la sierra liberteña, este negocio lo inició con su esposo pero después de pasar algunas dificultades decidió dedicarse sola a esta actividad y se siente muy contenta por los resultados que obtiene. Por medio de unas vecinas pudo integrarse al banco comunal “Jesús Nazareno” En este banco comunal obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/.300.00 con este dinero compró dos carneros. Con el préstamo de S/.1500.00 que cancelará en un periodo de 6 meses comprará 4 carneros y una vaca. La señora Nelly sueña con implementar una tienda en su casa.

loans.use: To purchase 4 rams and a cow

loans.name: Mahmadalli.

texts.ru:
Mahmadalli H. lives in the Gissar region. He is 31 years old, is married, has 2 children and does not have an education. Mahmadalli raises livestock. He purchases calves, feeds them for 40-45 days and then sells them for a profit. This business is the sole source of income for his family and he has been in this business for 4 years. The livestock business is the most popular business in the rural area and thus provides a profit.

Today, Mahmadalli’s working capital has decreased due to the cold winter and he had to sell several calves in order to buy feed for the rest and now he needs to expand his inventory. This is why he needs a loan. This will allow him to restore his business and income which his family needs. He will pay back the loan over a 12 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Холиков Махмадалли живет в районе Гиссар. Возраст 31 год , женат и имеет 2 детей. Образования не имеет. Занимается животноводством. Покупает бычков, откармливает их 40-45 дней , а затем продает по более выгодной для него цене с учетом расходов. Этот бизнес является единственным источником дохода его семьи. Занимается этим 4 года. Этот бизнес самый распространенный в сельской местности, поэтому дает доход. На данный момент у клиента уменьшилась оборотная сумма в связи с холодной зимой . Ему пришлось продать несколько голов бычков , чтобы запастись кормом для остальных, и ему необходимо пополнить товарооборот. Для этого клиенту нужно получить кредит. Это поможет ему восстановить бизнес и получаемый доход , который так не хватает его семье. Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase calves

loans.name: Veronica's Juhudia Group

texts.en:
Veronica is 24 years old and is married. Veronica is a vegetable seller. She started her business in 2007. Every day, she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more vegetables for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Sinoritha, who has a food vending business.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables for her business.

loans.name: Sergey

texts.en:
Sergey is married and has a daughter. He sells women’s footwear at the city market in Novaya Kahovka, Ukraine. Sergey purchases all of his inventory from national shoe factories which produce good quality and durable footwear. He started this venture 4 years ago. Today his business is well known in the city for having assorted merchandise.

Sergey’s venture is the only source of income for his family. He operates it as a family business based on Christian values. Sergey always sticks to principles of integrity and responsibility. We believe this loan will help him expand his business, having a positive impact on his trade profitability and helping to further improve the economic and social situation of his family.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.ru:
Gulchehra U. lives in the Abdurahmon Jomi district. She is 36 years old, married, and has two children. She is a housewife, but also practices agriculture. She has a plot of land where she grows a variety of crops. Now is the corn planting season, so she needs to buy fertilizer and seeds. To do this she decided to take out a loan, to be repaid over 6 months. This will help her earn money and help her husband.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer.

Умарова Гульчехра жительница района Абдурахмони Джоми.Возраст 36 лет , замужем и имеет двоих детей. Домохозяйка , но занимается земледелием.Имеет участок земли , которую засеивает различными культурами. Сейчас сезон посева кукурузы , поэтому для посева ей необходимо закупить семена и удобрения. Для этого она запланировала получить кредит и погасить его в течении 6 месяцев.Эта деятельность помогает ей зарабатывать деньги и помогать мужу .

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer and corn seeds

loans.name: Sabzhumor

texts.ru:
Sabzhumor T. has been working in sales for ten years. She has a shop in the center of town. She trades in foodstuffs and some clothes. She is married and has five children. She wants to take out a loan to bring in goods before the new season. She gets the goods in the city of Dushanbe, buying at wholesale prices. She sells the goods with a small markup. Her profit margin is not very big. Therefore, to increase her income, Sabszhumor wants to take out a loan to diversify the assortment of goods she offers. She plans to pay off the loan in 9 months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa, Kiva volunteer.

Тошева Сабзхумор десять лет занимается торговлей. Имеет магазин в центре своего кишлака. Торгует продуктами питания и еще некоторыми видами одежды. Замужем имеет пятерых детей. К новому сезону хочет получить кредит и привезти товар. Приобретает товар в городе Душанбе ,покупая у оптовых реализаторов. Продает товар с небольшой наценкой. Прибыль нен очень большая. Поэтому для того , чтобы увеличить доход Сабзхумор хочет получить кредит и разнообразить ассортимент товара. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 9 месяцев

loans.use: Increase the assortment of goods

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is 25 years old. She is married with 3 children between 8 and 3 years old. She owns a small shop and she has been a charcoal seller since 1999. Every day, she works from 6:30am to 9pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about US$ 125 from her sales.

Halima now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal and other items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and other items for her shop

loans.name: Sokina

texts.en: Sokina K. is 41 years old. She is married and has five children. Sokina’s husband is currently working in Russia. It was the only way for him to earn money and support his family.  He could not find a job near home and was without a job for a long time. That is how Sokina ended up as an entrepreneur. Sokina sells children’s clothing in the central market. She offers a large variety of clothing items at a reasonable price. Sokina has been in this trade for 11 years and gained a rich experience in this kind of activity. Today Sokina is requesting a loan of $1000 USD to purchase winter clothing for children. She promises to repay the loan within 12 months. Her long-term plan is to open one more vending facility. Moreover, Sokina is hoping to use the profit to help her daughter get a good education in the University. We believe her enthusiasm, motivation, and desire to improve her living standards will guarantee prompt loan repayment.

loans.use: To buy children's winter clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase goods such as tablecloths and curtains to add to her inventory.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia tiene 37 años de edad, es madre soltera, con dos hijos que están estudiando en el colegio. Desde niña ayudaba a la chacra, ahora ya con sus hijos, siembra solo para su consumo; papa y maíz. Hace 6 años aperturó una bodega, actividad que había  empezado con unos cuantos productos, y al pasar el tiempo ha ido creciendo, a la vez no deja de sembrar sus chacras, también hace algunos años está criando carneritos, en horas de la tarde, cierra su bodega para llevar sus carneros al campo. A ella le agrada estar en contacto con la gente, solo que a veces se incomoda cuando no le alcanza el dinero para que pueda surtir su negocio, por ello le prestará mayor dedicación a la chacra sembrando arvejas, de ese modo ganar dinero adicional para invertir en su negocio. Es su 7mo préstamo, en los pagos, no tuvo dificultad en pagar puntualmente. Con S/1.000.00 comprará mercaderías para incrementar su bodega, la otra parte la usará para adquirir los fertilizantes, comprará 6 bolsas de este.
texts.en:
Sonia is 37 years old, and is a single mother with two children who are both studying in school. From the time she was a girl she helped on the small farm, but now that she has her own children she only plants potatoes and corn for their own consumption. 6 years ago she opened a neighborhood store, which she began with a few products, and as time has passed it has continued to grow. At the same time, she has not stopped planting on her small farm, and a few years ago she began raising sheep. In the later hours of the day she closes her neighborhood store to take her sheep into the fields. Sonia enjoys being in contact with people, however, sometimes she finds it difficult when there is not enough money to stock her business. For that reason, she plans to dedicate more of her time to her small farm by planting peas in an effort to earn additional money to invest in her business. This is her 7th loan, and she has never had difficulty making her payments on time. With 1,000.00 PEN she will purchase merchandise to develop her neighborhood store, and the rest she will use to acquire 6 bags of fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her neighborhood store

loans.name: Nuevo Porvenir Group

texts.es:
En la zona Panamericana, se encuentra ubicado el centro focal del mismo nombre, a este pertenece la asociación “Nuevo Porvenir” Un grupo muy simpático y particular formado por 16 miembros que trabajan de manera organizada en todas sus actividades de grupo, cumpliendo mas de un año de trabajo junto a Pro-Mujer.  Las actividades que realiza la asociación Nuevo Porvenir, son de todo variadas; se dedican a la venta de verdura,  otras realizan tejidos de chompas, también se  dedican a la venta  de adornos para el hogar, venta de ropa, entre otros.
Afirman que necesitan mayor capital para la compra de productos al por mayor, están seguras que sus ventas se duplicaran por las fiestas de fin de año, de este modo obtendrán mayores ganancias y beneficios para sus familias
texts.en:
In the Panamerican zone exists a focal center by the same name. Here belongs the association named “Nuevo Porvenir” (“New Future”). This is a very agreeable group made up of sixteen members who work in an organized manner in all their activities, having celebrated one year of working with Pro Mujer. The activities realized by the members of Nuevo Porvenir are varied. Some members sell vegetables, other knit sweaters, while some also sell decorations for the home, clothing, and other items. They state that they need additional working capital to purchase products at wholesale. They are sure that their sales will double during the holiday season and, in this manner, they will obtain greater profits for the benefit of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase products at wholesale.

loans.name: Betty

texts.es:
Betty es socia del Bancomunal San Juan
Betty es separada tiene 53 años, dos hijos de 31 y 18 años, el mayor esta casado y él ultima estudia en la universidad. Betty tiene un negocio de cabina de locutorio empego alquilando el teléfono de su casa a sus vecinos luego puso tres cabinas de locutorio 
Desde que comenzó en Finca tiene Seguridad de pertenecer por que puede seguir solicitando prestamos, le gusta los momentos de amistad en las reuniones 
Ella necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles para el  pago de  computadoras     
El sueño es tener un centro de computo e investigación.
texts.en:
Betty is a member of the community bank San Juan. She is separated and is 53 years old. She has two children, of 31 and 18 years of age. The eldest is married and the other is studying in university. Betty has a business of telephone booths, where she rents the telephone in her house to her neighbours, and has recently put in three telephone booths. Since she began with Finca, she has had the certainty of belonging, and so she is able to continue asking for loans. She likes the friendly moments in the meetings. She needs a loan of 1200 soles in order to pay for computers. Her dream is to have a computer and communications center.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for computers

loans.name: Grupo El Tamarindo #2 Group

texts.es:
Este es el grupo El tamarindo #2 que cuenta con tres integrantes que son María del Carmen D., Jessica María C., Estebana del Carmen D. R. y María Esther M. H.; originarias de la comarca Las Flores, perteneciente al municipio de Masaya. Trabajan con Adim porque desean asistir a capacitaciones donde les enseñen a como mejorar en su negocio y porque pueden obtener el crédito sin garantías ya que no cuentan con ellas. Tienen como objetivo salir bien en sus pagos para poder conservar el crédito.
Estebada del Carmen D. vende verduras y perecederos en el mercado oriental desde hace 10 años, tiene 45 años con 3 hijos adolescentes que trabajan por cuenta propia, ella aprendió esta actividad de su madre. Su esposo trabaja en el campo y le ayuda con el poco salario que gana. Ella necesita el crédito para comprar cosechas que se compran por anticipado en las fincas y luego van cortando en diferentes tiempos, generalmente cada quince días, esto garantiza tener producto fresco y  fruta toda la temporada.
Espera poder seguir creciendo en su pequeño negocio y poder comprar cantidades más grandes para obtener mejores precios. Está consiente que para tener siempre el crédito debe de ser puntual en sus pagos. Está participando en los talleres de capacitación en Adim y expresa que está muy contenta aprendiendo cosas importantes.
texts.en:
The group El Tamarindo #2 has four members that include Maria del Carmen Davila, Jessica Maria C., Estebana del Carmen Davila R., and Maria Esther Munoz Hernandez. They are natives of the Las Flores region in the city of Masaya. They work with ADIM because they would like assistance with training to improve their business and because they would like to obtain a loan without collateral (which none of them have). They have the goal to pay their bills on time in order to maintain the loan. Estebada del Carmen Davila has sold vegetables and fruits in the Oriental market for the past 10 years. She is 45 years old and has 3 teenage children that work on their own account. She inherited this business from her mother. Her husband works in the fields and he helps only a little with the salary he earns. She needs the loan to purchase crops that are anticipated from the farms and harvested in different seasons. Generally, every fifteen days she buys fresh seasonal products. She hopes to continue growing her small business and to buy larger quantities of fruits and vegetables that would allow her to receive better prices. She believes that she will always make her loan payments on time. She is participating in the training workshops offered by ADIM and she expresses her happiness to be learning these important things.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in the business in order to guarantee its longevity

loans.name: Limpia

texts.es:
La señora Limpia P. tiene 49 años de edad y está casada con el señor Carmelo Martinez de 63 años, ambos son padres de 9 hijos.
La cliente se dedica al comercio hace más de 25 años, y comenzó con un pequeño ahorro que contaba. Su marido es carpintero y fabrica muebles para la venta, y mas adelante desean adquirir un camión para distribuir sus productos en zonas más lejanas ya que tienen muy buena venta.
El dinero del préstamo será destinado para la compra de madera para la fabricación de juegos de comedor, que serán vendidos a mueblerias de la zona.
La señora sueña con un pais con mayor seguridad y más oportunidad para los jovenes.
texts.en:
Limpia P. is 49 years old, married to Carmelo Martinez who is 63 years of age, and they are the parents of 9 children. She has dedicated herself to commerce for more than 25 years, and started her business with a small amount of savings that she had. Her husband is a carpenter and makes furniture to sell. Further ahead, they would like to acquire a truck to distribute their products throughout distant zones since they have very good sales. The funds from the loan would be destined to purchase lumber to make dining room sets to be sold in the furniture stores of the area. Limpia dreams of a safer country with more opportunities for young people.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of lumber.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es: Elvira tiene 35 años, vive con su esposo y sus hijos en su propia casa. Desde hace un año se dedica a la venta de extintores para incendios, inició este negocio porque tiene unos contactos que le facilitan la adquisición de este tipo de artículos, junto a su esposo reparten a los establecimientos que requieren de este producto, además promueven y aconsejan a todo tipo de negocio la compra de extintores para estar preparados ante algún accidente donde se produzca fuego. Elvira considera que su negocio es bueno, ya que aporta para la seguridad e integridad de las personas, además conociendo mucho del tema, vende sus extintores con insumos de muy buena calidad. El deseo de Elvira es crecer en su negocio y  establecerse en un local comercial, porque al momento atiende en su casa. Es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo, y está muy contenta con esta nueva experiencia en un banco comunal, se compromete a ser responsable en sus pagos. El total de la cantidad requerida es para comprar más extintores, para el incremento de sus ventas y por ende, de sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Elvira is 35 years old. She lives with her husband and children in her own house. For a year she has sold fire extinguishers. She started this business becuse she has contacts that help her acquire extinguishers. With her husband, she distributes to establishements that need fire extinguishers. Futhermore, they promote and advise that all types of businesses buy extinguishers so that they may be prepared in case an accident occurs where a fire may be produced. Elvira considers her business to be good, because it invests in the security and integrity of people. Furthermore, knowing a great deal about the subject, she sells extinguishers of very high quality. Elvira's wish is to grow in her business and to establish herself in a local comercial market, because at the moment she sells from her house. This is the first time that Elvira is asking for a loan, and she is very happy with her initial experience with a comunal bank. She is committed to making her payments responsibly. The entire amount she is asking for will be used to buy more extinguishers, to increase her sales and in turn, increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Matt Capetola, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more merchandise.

loans.name: Unidos Venceremos 2 Group

texts.en:
This is one of the newest groups in the Unidos Venceremos Bank of Hope, from San Pedro de Macoris. All five members are in business sell clothing, accessories, cosmetics and health care products. Due to the current economic situation, they need to infuse some capital into their businesses to keep them going.

Bladimir C. is the group's representative and has a varied sales business. He sells mostly accessories, so he will use this loan to buy accessories and perfumes, which is his newest offer to customers. Bladimir also sells tennis shoes, which sell well. He hopes to make his business grow into a store where he can sell a wider variety of merchandise and move to an administrative position where he supervises supplies, purchasing and the staff.

Please help us support the first steps of Bladimir's dream as well as the rest of this Bank of Hope group. Thank you!

loans.use: Purchase supplies to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formo a traves de la Sra. Zunilda Benitez. 

Podemos hablar de un miebro del comite, quien se llama Sra. Juana A..  Ella tiene 53 años y se dedica en la venta de pescado en el mercado de abasto.  Ella es una mujer sacrificada: sale de su casa a las cinco de la mañana y regresa a las 11de la mañana. Por la tarde ella pesca con su marido en el rio Paraguay para sacar el pescado de distinta variedades y luego lo limpia y guarda en el refrigerador para su posterior comercializacion.  Gracias a la fundacion, Juana esta saliendo adelante con su familia.

Los otras miembras del comite son: 

1	Candida A.. - 	Venta de frutas - 
2	Maria I. M.. - 	Copetin - 
3	Maria L.C.. - 	Kiosco - 
4	Saturnina G.. -  	Venta debebidas - 
5	Ana Maria S.. -  	Venta de verduras - 

6	Eulalia S.. - 	Venta de verduras y frutas -  
7	Sonia E.G.. -  	Venta de ropas - 
8	Ana Rosa S.. -	Venta de ropas - 
9	Juana B.A.. -	Venta de pescado - 
10	Antonia D.. - Venta de frutas y verduras - 
11	Isabel Maria P.. -	Venta de remedio yuyos - 
12	Sebastiana S.. -	Ventas de comidas - 
13	Gregoria R.. -	Despensa -
14	Lucila F..  -	Peluquera -
15	Isabel S.. -	Venta de frutas -
texts.en:
This committee was formed through Mrs. Zunilda Benitez. One member of the committee is Mrs. Juana A.. She is 53 and sells fish in the provision market. She is a self-sacrificing woman: she leaves her house at five in the morning and returns at 11 a.m. In the afternoon she fishes with her husband in the Paraguay River. She catches a wide variety of fish which she cleans and stores in her refrigerator in order to sell it later. Thanks to the foundation, Juana is coming out ahead with her family. The other committee members are: 1 Candida A.. - Fruits - 2 Maria I. M.. - Snacks - 3 Maria L.C.. - Kiosk - 4 Saturnina G.. - Beverages - 5 Ana Maria S.. - Vegetables - 6 Eulalia S.. - Vegetables and fruits - 7 Sonia E.G.. - Clothes - 8 Ana Rosa S.. - Clothes - 9 Juana B.A.. - Fish - 10 Antonia D.. - Fruits and vegetables - 11 Isabel Maria P.. - Herbal remedies - 12 Sebastiana S.. - Food - 13 Gregoria R.. - Groceries - 14 Lucila F.. - Hairdresser - 15 Isabel S.. - Fruits -

Translated from Spanish by Jonathan Bradshaw, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of clothes such as: shirts, shorts, blouses, pants, skirts, towels;  Kiosk sales: pies, juices, refreshments, cigarettes and sweets; and others

loans.name: Edrelina

texts.en:
Edrelina I. is a store owner living in Tuburan village, Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur. She is married to Benjamin I., who works as mechanic in a shop. They have three children: all are studying in school.

She has applied for a loan of PHP 8,000.00, which she will use as additional capital to purchase additional merchandise. Her sari-sari store provides income to help them in their daily needs. She plans to expand the space of her store and have it painted to make her store neat and attractive.

loans.use: To improve her sari-sari store business.

loans.name: Señoras Del Sur Group

texts.es:
En la zona de villa Exaltación esta ubicado el centro focal que lleva el mismo nombre, a este pertenece la asociación “Señoras del Sur”, esta  formado  por diez  miembros y trabajan junto a Pro-Mujer hace mas de tres años.
La elaboración y venta de comida es la actividad principal de este grupo, algunas  tienen pensiones otras venden en puestos  fijos en las calles y también a pedido. Desean ampliar sus ventas, por lo que necesitan abastecerse de mayores insumos para la elaboración de sus variados platillos. Todas las ganancias que generen serán invertidas en la educación de sus hijos, afirman.
texts.en:
In the neighborhood of Vila Exaltación there is a community center with the same name. The "Señoras del Sur" (Women of the South) association is a part of it. It is made up of 10 members and they have worked with Pro-Mujer for more than 3 years. This group's main activity is the preparation of meals. Some have established customers; others work at street stands or with custom orders. They would like to increase their sales, so they need to purchase more ingredients for the various meals they prepare. They promise that all of the profits that they generate will be used for the education of their children.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase traditonal East African cloth and cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Estheer Achieng

texts.en: Estheer is a mother of four who runs a business selling vegetables in the Oile market of Kisumu, Kenya.  She started small over ten years ago and now cannot keep up with the large orders of her customers.  She would like to get a loan to increase her supply, so that she does not have to turn any customers away.  Her business is the only way that she can cover her children’s nutrition and schooling costs.  Estheer can be heard in the video saying, “I want to improve the capital so that I can be billing it in bigger quantity.”

video.title: Kiva Entrepreneur Estheer Achieng from  Kenya

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Galina

texts.en:
Galina is married. She sells various products, like cosmetics, clothing, dishes, etc. at small market in Kamenka. She has been in this business for 12 years. Her monthly income is 3-4 thousand UAH.

Although Galina has many repeat clients, she practices an individual approach. She changes her products with the seasons. Galina's business goal is to develop her business and attract even more clients and increase her sales. Galina loves to grow vegetables in her garden and loves to play with her granddaughter, who is only a few months old.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal goods

loans.name: Isabel Raquel

texts.es:
La señora ISABEL RAQUEL V. V., tiene 32 años, vive en el distrito de Moche , provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Las Delicias II.
La empresaria presenta estudios superiores de OBSTETRICIA, ejercio durante 5 años, pero al casarse se dedico a la crianza de su hijo el cual tiene 3 años de edad y depende económicamente de ella.
ISABEL se dedica  a la preparación de pasteles, bocaditos y tortas.
El crédito de 300 nuevos soles lo invirtió en la compra productos alimenticios para elaborar sus pasteles, bocaditos, y tortas, como: mantequilla, pasas, huevos, vainilla, harina, entre otros.
 Este crédito de 800 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de un horno industrial puesto que su negocio ha ido incrementándose y necesita preparar con mas frecuencia sus pedidos.
ISABEL sueña con ambientar su domicilio, para poder colocar allí una fuente de soda y vender sus postres.
texts.en:
32-year old Señora Isabel Raquel V. Velásquez lives in Moche district in Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Peru. She is a member of the Banco Las Delicias II. Isabel is a businesswoman who has also studied obstetrics. She practised this profession for five years, but when she got married, she concentrated on raising her son who is now three years old and dependent on her. She now earns her living by baking cakes, snacks, and tarts. Her previous loan of S/.300 loan was used to buy ingredients for the cakes, snacks, and tarts such as butter, raisins, eggs, vanilla, flour etc. This S/.800 loan will be used to buy an industrial oven as her business has been growing, and she needs to bake more frequently in order to fill her customers’ orders. Isabel’s dream is to convert part of her home into a soda fountain and sell her baking there.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy an industrial oven

loans.name: Isolda Graciela

texts.es: Doña Isolda de 49 años de edad, reside en el barrio 380 en la capital de Managua, tiene un hijo de 22 años estudiante universitario, su negocio es un caber el cual esta administrando, anteriormente tenia un taxi lo vendió y puso el caber el cual hasta ahora le ha ido bien ya que es visitado por muchos jóvenes, los problemas es cuando se va luz eléctrica y no puede atender es una perdida de entrada económica. Con este préstamos comprara una computadora nueva para dar cada día un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Da las gracias Afodenic por los préstamo que le han dado este es su séptima ciclo el cual ha administrado en mejoras a su vivienda como en su negocio.

loans.use: Comprar computadora

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha B. is from the village of Alangilan in Sagay Camiguin. She is 33 years old. Editha is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Editha runs a sari-sari (variety) store where she sells food and daily use products in the local community. Editha has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Editha joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Editha has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Editha is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Editha from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Elena Macías P.  es socia del Banco Comunal Dapreydi, ubicado en Tosagua, Provincia de Manabí, ella es profesora y dueña de una escuelita de la localidad en la que atiende junto a su esposo, llevan en esta actividad desde hace 20 años, en la mañana dan clases en su institución y por la tarde en un colegio fiscal donde laboran como maestros.

Doña Rosa tiene 140 estudiantes en su escuela, trabajan con 10 docentes, la labor de esta socia empieza desde muy temprano y termina a las 6:30 de la tarde y el  fin de semana se dedica a descansar y a preparar  material de trabajo para la siguiente semana, es una tarea que necesita de mucha dedicación y esfuerzo pero no le importa porque ama lo que hace.

Rosita nos comenta que hace un tiempo atrás  tenían un negocio de venta de fritada y hamburguesas  les iba muy bien pero el tiempo no les alcanzaba para desarrollar las dos actividades por lo que decidieron  cerrar el negocio de comida rápida.

El préstamo que Rosita está solicitando a la Fundación  lo va a invertir en el mejoramiento de la escuela, pintar las aulas, arreglar las bancas,  así como también en la compra de productos para implementar el bar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa Elena is a member of the “Dapreydi” Community Bank located in Tosagua, in the Manabi Province. She is a teacher and the owner of a local little school in her town. She shares ownership with her husband. They have been working at this activity for more than twenty years. In the morning they teach classes at this institution and in the afternoon they teach classes at a public high school where they work as teachers. Mrs. Rosa has 140 students at her school. They work with ten teachers who work from early in the morning until 6:30 in the evening. On the weekends they rest and prepare lessons for the next week. This work requires much dedication and effort but that isn’t important because they love what they do. Rosita told us that in the past they had a business that sold frittatas and hamburgers. It went well but they didn’t have enough time to develop two businesses so they decided to close the food business. The loan that Rosita is asking for from the Foundation will be invested in school improvement. She will paint the classrooms, fix the benches and also she will buy products for the snack bar.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve her school, paint the classrooms, fix the benches, and buy products for the snack bar.

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es: El grupo “Nuevo Amanecer” esta representado por la señora Catalina y conformada por 13 Miembros D. los cuales la mayoría se dedica a la prestación D. servicios es decir está en el sector del transporte y el resto del grupo se dedica la venta D. comida rápida y otros a la confección D. artesanía, actividades que constantemente requieren D. un capital por que debido a la competencia en estas áreas les es un poco difícil generar un ahorro considerable, por ello este grupo ya se encuentra en su cuarto ciclo trabajando con nuestra institución, siempre viendo una perspectiva D. seguir con nosotros por las ventajas que ellos encuentran en nuestros servicios, al margen D. todo ello estas familias desD. hace ya un año ve que a mejorado en gran manera la calidad D. vida D. quienes componen su hogar.
texts.en:
The group "Nuevo Amanecer" is represented by Catalina and maD. up of 13 members, the majority of whom work in the transportation sector. The rest of the group works in fast food sales or making handicrafts, activities that constantly require capital, because due to the competition in these areas, it is a little difficult for them to generate a considerable savings. For this reason, the group already finds itself in its fourth cycle working with our institution, always seeing a reason to continue with us because of the advantages they find in our services. AsiD. from all of that, for the last year these families have seen that the quality of life has improved greatly for those in their home.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Job capital

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a young man working as a policeman in the Palestinian National Authority. He takes home a monthly salary of 470 USD. He currently lives with his family: his father, who is a daily paid worker, his mother and his brother. Jamal appears in the photo at the FATEN office in Tulkarem.

Mahmoud applied to FATEN to receive a loan of 2,000 USD in order to buy his brother a computer as his brother is studying in the university. Part of the loan will also be used to obtain a license to start building his own house since he plans to get married in a couple of years.

loans.use: To buy his brother a computer and to get a licence to build a new house

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie B. is now 50 years old married to Ernesto B., now working as driver for one of the families in their area. They have six children: Eilyn, 21; Ma. Layne, 19; Merilyn, 18; Laarnies, 15; Errol, 12 and John Ernie, 10. Most of their children are now currently studying, so there are more expenses for their education. Aside from the salary of her husband, she also buys and sells secondhand appliances, frozen foods, and rice as the sources of their income. They need to work hard to pay the expenses of their big family.

She joined Kiva field partner Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) in 1999, and since she became a member of this institution their life started to change. Her business continues to grow because every loan that she received is properly used, and she been able to send her other children to college and some of them have finished already. That is why she is very thankful to ASHI. Now her 12th loan will be use to improve her secondhand appliances business; she will buy different secondhand appliances for resale. She is hoping that this will help her business to grow more.

Now she is just praying that her business will continue to improve for her to be able to send all of her children to college. And she assures ASHI that she will work hard so that the chances that they give her will never be wasted.

loans.use: For buying of different secondhand appliances for her buy and sell business

loans.name: Sim

texts.en: Sim K. is 24 years old and lives with her husband and one young child in the Takeo province. She makes and sells hammocks at the local market to earn a living of US$1.60 of profit every day, while her husband is a seller and makes US$10 in revenue each day. He rides around to sell mosquito nets, pillows and hammocks in various locations around the community.  Sim K. would like to take out a loan of US$1200 that her husband needs to purchase a stock of mosquito nets, pillows and hammocks. (Sim K. is pictured with her husband)

loans.use: Sell mosquito nets, pillows and hammocks.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
Nuestro socio ALEJANDRO tiene 38 años, es casado, es natural de la ciudad de Cusco y pertenece al banco comunal “PATRON SANTIAGO DE SANTIAGO” de la Asociación Arariwa. El tiene dos hijas.        
 
El socio hace servicio de transporte en la ciudad del Cusco. Ya son dos años con el servicio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Todos los días sale muy temprano de su domicilio para hacer el servicio de transportes. Nuestro socio es un padre trabajador y emprendedor que saca adelante a su familia. El socio requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento al carro pues es el único medio de ingresos para su familia.        
   
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
ALEJANDRO, 38, is from Cusco. He's married and the father of two daughters. He is a member of Asociación Arariwa's “PATRON SANTIAGO DE SANTIAGO” communal bank. He provides public transportation services in the city of Cusco. He has been in this line of work for two years now and has done well thanks to the effort he puts into his work. He leaves home very early each day to provide his transportation services. He is a hard-working, enterprising father who struggles to get his family ahead in life. He needs financing to service his vehicle because it is the family's only source of income. He is grateful for the opportunity granted by this means and pledges to make his repayments in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Tesla Cesilia

texts.es: La señora Tesla Cesilia, tiene 60 años de edad, es madre soltera y sus hijos están ya mayores de edad. La señora Tesla tiene la venta de ropa. Ella dio inicio a este negocio hace 11 años, el cual lo inicio para buscar fuentes alternativas de ingresos, debido a que no tenia empleo y un medio de ingreso para sus hijos. Con una buena administración le ha ido bien en su negocio. El crédito será invertido en la compra de mayor cantidad de ropa, principalmente desea invertir en vestidos, que son los que más busca la gente debido a la temporada navideña. Ella sueña en el futuro llegar a tener un mini súper, ya que vive en un barrio con bastante demanda de productos básicos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Tesla Cesilia is 60 years old and a single mother of adult children. Mrs. Tesla works selling clothing. She started this business 11 years ago in order to look for supplemental sources of income, since she was no longer employed and needed income for her children. With her talented administration, the business has gone well for her. The loan will be used to purchase a greater quantity of clothing; she especially wishes to buy dresses, since they are especially desired for the Christmas season. Her dream in the future is to have a small grocery store, since she lives in a neighborhood with a lot of demand for those basic products.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Merchandise

loans.name: Koem Seng

texts.en: Mrs. Koem Seng P. is a villager in Cheav Bdei Khang Kaeut village in Takeo province. She is farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Khun Sophal, is a primary school director in the local village. Although they try to work hard, they still don't earn enough income to support the family. Thus, Mrs. Koem Seng P. decided to ask for a loan to buy two cows to start a new breeding business. Mrs. Koem Seng P. is a mother of two children who attend the local school. Her husband is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy two cows to start a new breeding business.

loans.name: Trabajando Para El Mañana Ii Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal "Trabajando para el mañana II", está conformado por 16 socias, todas muy emprendedoras y trabajadoras.   Viven en el distrito D. Callería, región Ucayali y sus negocios son variados, desD. la compra y venD. D. productos D. abarrotes, hasta la venta D. cosméticos.

Su primer crédito fue D. 6,300 soles con el cual las socias pudieron comprar sus productos para abastecer sus negocios.

Su presidenta es la Sra. Biqui Melita, es una mujer muy trabajadora, vive en el Distrito D.  Calleria, región Ucayali, tiene 30 años, madre D. dos menores D. edad, ella se dedica a administrar su negocio, cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo quien es chofer D. motocar.  Ella es coia D. este Banco Comunal desD. hace un año y medio.  La meta D. Biqui Melita, es tener una discoteca en la maloca que posee  y poner su tienD..

Actualmente este Banco requiere D. un préstamo D. S/. 6,900 soles, que será invertido en los diferentes negocios.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "Trabajando para el Mañana II" (Working for Tomorrow II) consists of sixteen members. All of them are enterprising and hardworking women. They live in the District of Callería in the region of Ucayali and operate various retail businesses selling products such as groceries and cosmetics.

The group president is Sra. Biqui Melita, a hardworking woman from the District of Calleria. She is 30 years old and a mother with two dependent children. Biqui manages her business and has the support of her husband, who is a motorcycle taxi driver. She has been a member of this Communal Bank for 1½ years. Her dreams are to open a discothèque in the “maloca” (an ancestral long house) that she owns and establish a store.

At the moment, the entire Communal Bank is requesting a loan of 6900 soles to invest in their various businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase merchandise to restock her business

loans.name: Gloria's Group

texts.en:
Gloria E. is from the village of La Paz, Cabatuan, Isabela. She is 47 years old. Gloria is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Gloria is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Gloria owns & operates a food stall. The main source of income for the business comes from tending a canteen in the local community. Gloria has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Gloria joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gloria is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Gloria from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Shiirev

texts.en:
For the past five years Shiirev, 38, has been living with his wife and daughter in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent, in Uvurhangai Province, Mongolia. Purchasing the necessary machinery parts and raw materials from Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, Shiirev has operated an auto repair business since 2005 and has steadily expanded his business as more and more people have bought cars in Mongolia in recent years, Previously, he operated a transportation business between Ulaanbaatar and Uvurhangai Province with his own car. His wife Tuya has been operating a hairdressing business since 2000, and also helps Shiirev's auto repair business.

Shiirev is a very hard-working person with a great business mind. He says, “I would like to expand my business and open a larger auto repair center.” He is now requesting a 3,500,000 tugrugs (~ 2450 USD) loan to purchase machinery parts at wholesale prices for his business.

loans.use: To purchase machinery parts

loans.name: Celso

texts.en: Celso M. is from the village of Salay, Misamis Oriental. He is 30 years old. Celso is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Celso owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling bananas in the local community. Celso has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2010, Celso joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Celso has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Celso is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Celso from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Gloria Jaso Group

texts.en:
Gloria J. is from the village of Macabayao, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is the leader of a five-member group loan offered by Kiva partner, PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.
Gloria is 53 years old, married, and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling different dried goods products in the community. Gloria has been engaged in her business for over 14 years and earns approximately 3,400 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2008, Gloria joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from PMPC. This loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Gloria is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her fourth from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Cristian

texts.es: Cristian P. S., tiene la edad de 23 años, está casado, tiene 1 hijo de un años, que es su mayor prioridad. El crédito lo quiere para la siembra y la compra de insumos para el desarrollo del cultivo de tiquisque. La idea es  darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo de tiquisque, para que cuando estén listos para cosechar los puedan vender y obtener mayores ganancias. El desea poder asistir el cultivo para lograr un mejor desarrollo del mismo,  y así lograr una mejor producción.Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Cristian tiene muchos años de experiencia en la agricultura.El está seguro de que le va a ir muy bien en el nuevo  proyecto.El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.
texts.en:
Cristian P. S. is 23 years old, married, and a one year old son who is his highest priority. This loan will be used to buy supplies for planting and growing “tiquisque” (a tuber crop similar to taro root). He wants to adequately maintain his crops so that he can generate better revenues when it comes time to harvest and sell his output. Cristian also attends to his crops as a means of self-development so that he can continue to improve production. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR and he is very happy with the services that have been provided. Don Cristian has many years of experience in agriculture. He is sure that he will do very well in this new project. Cristian hopes in the future to provide his family a better quality of life and greater financial stability. In addition, he wants to continue growing as a person and as producer.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase farming supplies for growing “tiquisque”

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda M. is from the village of Capatan, Tuguegarao City. She is 58 years old, married and has 3 adult-aged children. Erlinda owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Erlinda has been involved in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2005, Erlinda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 17,000 PHP from ASKI. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to buy soft drinks, canned goods, condiments and other commodities which are in demand in her village. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Erlinda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Flor

texts.es: Flor, de 36 años, es una mujer solidaria, vive con su esposo, que es albañil, y junto a sus 2 hijos en su casa que es propia.Desde hace 10 años, junto con su pareja, se propusieron construir de a pocos su casa. En verano, trabaja por las riberas de la playa, ofreciendo gaseosas y refrescos helados. Con estas utilidades ayuda a llevar la carga familiar, y también con los ingresos del trabajo de su esposo. Desde entonces, de a pocos, han ido preparando las vigas, paredes y el techo de su añorada casa, es por eso que Flor se encuentra muy satisfecha por el trabajo mancomunado y los logros que obtienen juntos. Su mayor anhelo inmediato es revestir las paredes de su casa, para evitar que se alojen los insectos, y mas adelante tiene planeado colocar mayólicas en su piso. De ese modo espera  brindar una calidad de vida más confortable  para sus  hijos.Este es su primer crédito que tiene con MFP, y sabe que el préstamo le será muy beneficioso para continuar con las construcciones de su casa, por ello se compromete a pagar con todas sus cuotas oportunamente.Flor tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de tubos para la instalación de luz, además de arena fina, cemento y otros materiales, de esta manera desea seguir progresando.
texts.en:
Flor, 36, is a woman with a strong sense of community. She lives with her husband, a construction worker and their 2 children in a house that they own. She and her husband have wanted to improve the house for 10 years. During the summer, Flor operates a business selling cold drinks along the beach. This extra income helps, with her husband's income, to move the project along. Over the years, they have been working on the framing, walls and roof of their much-desired house. Flor is happy with the progress they have made together. Her goal now is to treat the walls for insects. Next, she wants to tile the floors. Her overall goal is to provide a comfortable place for her children to live. This is Flor's first MFP loan. She knows that it will help her to continue building her house and, consequently, she is committed to repaying the loan on time. She will use the money from the loan to buy tubing for the house's lighting, along with sand, cement and other building materials.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction materials

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en:
Guillerma B. is a 32 year old woman who lives with her husband and two children, ages 3-16.  She supports her family by making and selling Choco tablets (choco tablet made of cacao). She lives in Brgy Banhegan Cebu City.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of Php 8,000.

Guillerma is now borrowing Php 15,000 of additional working capital for her business.  This will be her 6th cycle loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon.  Her previous loan of Php 15,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom.  Guillerma aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the “Dungganon” way.  

------------------------------------
About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita G. is from the village of Anito, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 51 years old. Carmelita is married and has 7 adult-aged children. To make a living, Carmelita owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making and selling specialty and native delicacies usually for snacks like halo-halo or flavored ice-crushed, sweetened rice or suman, and salted peanuts in the local community. Carmelita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Carmelita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carmelita is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Carmelita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en: Luzviminda E. is from the village of Balugo, Tambulig, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 46 years old. Luzviminda is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Luzviminda raises livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Luzviminda has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2009, Luzviminda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luzviminda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. Luzviminda is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. This will be the second loan taken out by Luzviminda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: El Triunfo 3 Group

texts.es:
el grupo El Triunfo 3 esta ubicado en el Barrio la Libertad de la Comunidad de EL Triunfo, Choluteca. esta integrado por 3 mujeres muy trabajadoras y con muchas ganas de salir adelante. a continuacion se detallan las diferentes actividades que ellas realizan para ganarse la vida diariamente:

la sra Ada Teresa H. se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene una pulperia desde hace varios años, Teresa es madre de 4 hijos los cuales los tiene estudiando en la escuela de la comunidad
doña Teresa se levanta a las 4 de la mañana para atender a su clientela ya que vive en una zona bien productiva, Teresa y su esposo trabajan duro para sacar adelante a su familia, en sus tiempos libres lo dedica  para asistir a la  iglesia y criar gallinas.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas mercaderia y asi surtir su pulperia.

la joven Vanyi M. se dedica a la fabricacion de coronas y piñatas desde hace 5 años, esto lo aprendio junto a su madre que tambien le ayuda con la fabricacion de las piñatas, Vanyi se acaba de casar y con la ayuda de su esposo estan trabajando duro para comprarse una vivienda ya que viven con su madre, en su tiempo libre  se dedica  al estudio ya que tambien estudia en la universidad.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas materiales para fabricar las coronas y las piñatas.


la joven Elsania A. es una joven emprendedora que se dedica al negocio propio venta de refrescos y 
 charamuscas en su casa de habitacion, Elsania vive con su madre que tambien le ayuda a la venta.
Elsania se levanta a las 5 de la mañana para hacer su producto y tenerlo listo para el resto del dia, el dia que mas vende son los domingos.

su tiempos libres lo dedica a la iglesia.
el prestamo lo utilizara para comprar mas refrescos y materiales para la fabricacion de las charamuscas.
texts.en:
The 'El Triunfo 3' group is located in the La Libertad neighbourhood of the El Triunfo community, Choluteca. Its members are three very hard-working women who really want to succeed. The different activities they are involved in to earn a living are described below: Ada Teresa H. sells everyday consumer goods and has been running her grocery shop for several years. Teresa is a mother of 4 children who all go to the local school. Teresa gets up at 4am to serve her customers, as the area she lives in is very productive. Teresa and her husband work hard to provide for their family. In her spare time, she goes to church and breeds chickens. She will use the loan to buy more stock for her grocery business. Young Vanyi M. has been making garlands and piñatas for 5 years. She learned the skill from her mother, who now helps her to make the piñatas. Vanyi has just got married and together she and her husband are working hard to buy their own home, as they currently live with her mother. In her spare time, she studies because she also attends university. She will use the loan to buy more materials with which to make her garlands and piñatas. Elsania A. is a young entrepreneur who has her own business selling soft drinks and twisted candy from her home. Elsania lives with her mother, who helps herto sell her products. Elsania gets up at 5am to make her produce and get it ready for the rest of the day. She sells the most on Sundays. She goes to church in her spare time. She will use her loan to buy soft drinks and materials for making her twisted candy.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Stansfield, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beans, rice, sugar, corn, tortillas, flour, butter, oil, cereal, soft drinks, paper, coloured paper, glue, pumps, paper decorations, colours, bookmarks, artificial flowers, plastic bags, fruit,  artificial flavourings.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma P. is from the town of Bunawan. She is 44 years old. Alma is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Alma owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Alma has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities. Alma also helps her husband at the farm. She helps plant and harvest rice crops.

Alma joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alma is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase young livestock to raise & sell in future. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Alma from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase young livestock to raise & sell in the future

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Elenita B. is from the village of Kanitoan, Initao, Misamis Oriental. She is 32 years old. Elenita is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Elenita owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Elenita has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Elenita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elenita is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Elenita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Vodacom Group

texts.en:
Zuwena M. is in her early thirties and is married with four children. She has been running her own food stall since 2009. The stall is open daily between 12 and 9 pm and earns Zuwena a good monthly profit.

This will be Zuwena's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. With this loan, Zuwena hopes to to increase her stock to meet rising demand for her goods. Her dream is to one day expand her stall into a proper food shop.

Zuwena will share this loan with her loan group Vodacom, which totals 15 members. The group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans.

In the picture, Zuwena can be seen in the front, in the center, wearing a bright blue dress with a black scarf.

loans.use: Increase stock of goods.

loans.name: Koitumet

texts.en:
Koitumet K. is a 28 year old farmer and he supports a family of three children. His spouse is Nemuta K. and she works with her husband. Their children are between the ages of one year and ten years old. Koitumet had been farming for the last eight years.

He learned about Kiva's partner, the Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET), from other members in a group already registered with KADET in his area of residence. This will be his second loan which he is planning to spend to prepare land for planting wheat. Wheat has been doing well in her area due to good climatic conditions. He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand his farming activity from small scale to commercial farming.

Koitumet’s dream is to become a large scale farmer and buy a bigger piece of land for wheat farming. He is a hard working man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: To spend Ksh 50,00 to prepare land for wheat planting.

loans.name: Musum

texts.en: Musum K. is currently in the business of selling beans at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of beans to sell.  Musum is 29 years old and single. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a shop.

loans.use: To stock more bags of beans to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more oil, onions, seasoning, pepper, salt, rice, etc. for resale

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian S., age 58, offers transportation servies in her local community. Vivian has been engaged in her business for over a year now and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. Vivian is widowed and has two school-aged children. The family lives in the city of Las Aguada Ozamiz. 
 
Earlier this year, Vivian joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. Her goal was to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Vivian is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to repair her vehicle for better service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Vivian from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair her vehicle for better transportation service

loans.name: Florinda

texts.es:
Florinda, es socia del Banco Comunal Obelisco, es casada y tiene 5 hijos. Florinda se dedica a la venta D. artesanías en el Distrito D. Quinua. Los hijos D. Florinda realizan trabajos D. artesanía en cerámica, para vender sus trabajos, decidió abrir un stand D. artesanía, venD. bien, pues el distrito D. Quinua recibe muchos turistas ya sean locales ó nacionales.
