El prestamo que solicita Florinda lo invertirá en la compra D. artesanías en piedra D. Huamanga y tejidos, para surtir su stand.
A Florinda le gusta las reuniones D. su Banco Comunal porque pueD. ahorrar y recibe capacitaciones por parte D. su promotora. Su sueño es que su negocio crezca y que su hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Florinda is a member of the Communal Bank “Obelisco” (Obelisk). She is married and has five children. Florinda sells handicrafts in the District of Quinua. Her children create handcrafted works maD. of ceramic and then she sells what they produce. She decided to open a crafts stand and her sales have done well. Many local and national tourists come to the District of Quinua.

Florinda is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of stone crafts from Huamanga and woven fabrics to restock her stand. She enjoys the Communal Bank meetings because she is able to save and receiving training from the staff. Her dreams incluD. growing her business and seeing her children become professionals.

loans.use: Purchase stone crafts & woven fabrics to sell

loans.name: Dembagnouma Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Dembagnouma, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 44 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Fana, quartier Banankabougou, préfecture de Dioïla; Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font le commerce de charbon de bois, de bois de chauffe et la vente des cartes de crédit téléphonique.                                                                                    
Les femmes du groupe Dembagnouma sont à leur huitième prêt solidaire et  FRANCOISE T., compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des cartes de crédit de recharge téléphonique, régulièrement avec les grossistes de la place.  Elle effectue sa vente quotidiennement à son domicile au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes passagers.
Elle espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 40 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer le prêt, prendre en charge les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Dembagnouma  group are all married, are on average 44 years old with three children, and live in traditional extended families in the city of Fana, in the Banankabougou district, in the Dioïla prefecture of the Region of Koulikoro (the second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

The know each other through family ties and are involved in the business of selling charcoal, firewood and telephone cards. 

The women of the Dembagnouma  group  are on their eighth group loan and FRANCOISE T. plans to use her loan to buy rechargeable telephone cards on a regular basis from the wholesalers in her area.  She makes her sales daily from her home for cash and on credit, to a clientele of men and women. 

She hopes to make a monthly profit of 40,000 CFA which will be used to repay the loan, cover health related expenses, and pay for food and school expenses, with the rest being  reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy telephone cards

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is a 38-year-old woman from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is married and has four children, aged 19, 17, 12 and 9. Elsie raises crops for a living. She plants and harvests rice crops that she sells to the market. Rice farming has been her family's source of income for more than a few years now. She hopes for her business to be stable.

Elsie joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsie has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. 

Elsie is requesting a new loan of 17,000 Philippines pesos, which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other inputs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and other inputs

loans.name: Dalias De Rancho Viejo Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Dalias de Rancho Viejo”,  se ubica en la localidad de Rancho Viejo, Municipio de San Andrés Huaxpaltepec Oaxaca, aproximadamente a 17 minutos de Pinotepa Nacional, el nombre se le atribuye a la flor de dalia por su belleza única, ya que las integrantes se simbolizan con dicha flor y cada una de ellas se siente representada e identificada con dicha especie floral. Este grupo se conforma con un total de 13 mujeres, su representante es la señora María Isabel R. M..  
Esta narración nos enfocaremos a la vida de Antelma R. C. de 45 años de edad, ella esta casada con Rosaelio de 44 años, el es profesor de primaria, tiene 3 hijos, Cinthia de 9 años estudiante de cuarto año de primaria, Darinel de 8 años quien cursa el tercer año y Rosaelio de 6 años quien apenas ingreso al primer año de primaria. Antelma tiene una papelería en su domicilio, negocio que inicio desde hace mas de 4 años aproximadamente, lo que la  motivo a iniciar este negocio en primer lugar fue la necesidad de la gente que habita en la población, ya que existe un gran número de niños y jóvenes que estudia en diferentes escuelas dentro y fuera de la comunidad y que carecen de materiales didácticos necesarios para elaborar sus tareas y trabajos escolares, antes de iniciar la papelería los pobladores tenían que viajar a la ciudad de Pinotepa para adquirir sus productos, haciendo mas costosos los precios de los materiales didácticos necesarios para la educación de los estudiantes de su pueblo.
Antelma   se unió a un grupo de crédito para solicitar un crédito de dinero, para la compra de material didáctico y de papelería, como son: libretas, cuadernos, pegamento blanco, lápices de colores, lápices de grafito, bolígrafos, tijeras, carpetas, cartulina, hojas de papel Bond, juegos geométricos, regla de medir, compás para trazar círculos, ábacos, crayones, clips, cartuchos de engrapadoras, papel lustre, papel crepe.
Las ganancias que Antelma, son destinadas par la compra  de mas  materiales y mercancía necesaria para su papelería, también para cubrir los pagos de su crédito. Otro de los proyectos que esta admirable mujer va a emprender es un ciber café, por la necesidad de este servicio en su comunidad, ya que las personas que estudian carecen de esta indispensable herramienta para su preparación escolar.
La esperanza que tiene Antelma, es tener buena salud para seguir aportando los medios necesarios que su pueblo requiere para un buen  desarrollo, hacer crecer su negocio, mejorarlo en todos los aspectos, ampliar su papelería, impulsar sus proyectos, y que su situación familiar siempre este estable y llena de armonía y comunicación.
Lo que mas desea es que  sus compañeras de grupos no dejen de hacerse responsable con su crédito que a todas ellas les valla de lo mejor, de igual manera desea que los niños que dependen de estas familias no les falte nada.
Antelma agradece la confianza que le da fundación realidad, al otorgarle su crédito, a Kiva que sin conocerlas le brindan este gran respaldo económico.
El grupo “Dalias de Rancho Viejo”, se conforma por un total de 13 mujeres, que a continuación se dan los nombres de las personas que lo integran, así como su actividad personal de cada integrante.

Yuvanitzi Semei F. C..-Venta de zapatos
Silsa Vianey V. T..- Abarrotes
Emiliana García C..- Venta de frutas y verduras 
Anita Marroquín M..- Venta de frutas y verduras
Martha R. M..- Venta de productos por catalogo
Antelma R. C..- Papelería
María Isabel R. M..- Servicio de taxis
Alberta C. E..- Venta de Chiles y Semillas
Cleofas C. García.- Abarrotes
Ernestina García Alavés.- Venta de ropa
Reynalda M. Vásquez.- Servicio de Molino de semillas
Adriana Elena López Díaz.- Venta de jugos de fruta		
Alicia García M..- Elaboración y venta de antojitos
texts.en:
The "Dalias de Rancho Viejo" group is located in Rancho Viejo, in San Andrés Huaxpaltepec Oaxaca.  It is about 17 minutes from Pinotepa Nacional.  The name comes from the dahlia flower for its unique beauty and because each of the members feels represented by and identifies with this floral species.  The group is made up of 13 women and their representative is María Isabel R. M..

We will focus this narrative on the life of Antelma R. C. who is 45 years old and married to Rosaelio who is 44.  He is an elementary school teacher.  They have 3 children, Cinthia who is 9 and in 4th grade, Darinel who is 8 and in 3rd grade and Rosaelio who is 6 and just started first grade.  Antelma has a stationers business in her home and has been working at this for over four years.  She set up the business because there was a need for school materials for all the children who study in the community.  Before she began her business everyone had to go to the city of Pinotepa to buy everything and this made it all more expensive.

Antelma joined the group to apply for a loan to buy school materials and stationery suppliers such as notebooks, binders, glue, colored pencils, lead encils, pens, scissors, folders, cardboard, Bond paper, geometric games, rulers, compasses, abacus, crayons, clips, staples, tissue paper, crepe paper.

Antelma's earnings are used to buy more materials and goods for her store and also to pay back her loan.  This admirable woman also wants to set up a cyber cafe because her community needs one and the students do not have this very necessary tool available for their education.

Antelma hopes to have good health so she can continue contributing to the needs of her town.  She wants to develop and expand her business and improve it in all regards.  She wants to carry out all her projects and maintain a stable, harmonious lifestyle for her family.

What she hopes for most is that her group colleagues are able to pack back the loan, and that things go well for all of them so that their children have what they need.

Antelma appreciates the confidence shown by Fundación Realidad and by Kiva in granting this type of economic support.  The "Dalias de Rancho Viejo" group is made up of 13 women, whose names and occupations follow:

Yuvanitzi Semei F. C..- Shoe sales
Silsa Vianey V. T..- Groceries
Emiliana García C..- Fruit and vegetable sales 
Anita Marroquín M..- Fruit and vegetable sales
Martha R. M..- Catalogue sales
Antelma R. C..- Stationers
María Isabel R. M..- Taxi service
Alberta C. E..- Chile and seed sales
Cleofas C. García.- Groceries
Ernestina García Alavés.- Clothing sales
Reynalda M. Vásquez.- Seed grinding service
Adriana Elena López Díaz.- Fruit juice sales		
Alicia García M..- Snack sales

loans.use: To buy notebooks, pens, glue, pencils, erasers, bond paper, cardboard, tissue paper and a computer

loans.name: Rosa Amanda

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Virgen De Guadalupe. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Rosa, tiene 30 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cinco hijos de 15, 11, 10, 6 y de un año y cuatro meses, la mayor esta en colegio y los tres siguientes estudian en la escuela. El marido es comerciante.
 
Se dedica junto a su esposo a la venta  de frutas y legumbres en su casa  donde tienen  un puesto desde hace ya  ocho años, en el trabajan ambos por el bien de su familia, se levantan bien de mañana y van al mercado mayoristas a comprar a los agricultores que llegan con sus productos desde el campo para  luego llevarlos a su local y vender a sus clientes un buen producto.

Este crédito lo van a emplear en comprar frutas y legumbres  para la  venta, está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio hace dos ciclos ya que este es un banco nuevo. Le gusta por lo fácil que es conseguir los créditos en la institución. Sus sueños son sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The loan group called Virgen De Guadalupe meets every two weeks in the city of Charapoto. This place is know for its traditional culture and also for being just a few minutes away from two of the best beaches in the province, San Jacinto and San Clemente.
In this place, we met Rosa, who is 30 years old and has a common-law husband and 5 children aged 15, 11, 10, 6, and 1 year and four months. The oldest is in high school, and the next 3 are in elementary school. Her husband is a merchant. 
Along with her husband, she sells fruit and vegetables from their home, where they have had a stall for 8 years. They work there together for the good of there family. They get up early and go to the wholesale market to buy from the farmers who take their produce their from the fields. Later they transport the produce to their stall and sell their customers a good product. 
They will use this loan to buy fruit and vegetables to sell. Rosa has been in the loan group since it started, which, as this is a new group, means through just 2 loan cycles. She likes it because it is easy to request loans from the institution. They dream of moving forward in life with their children.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en: Bernard is 48 years old and a member of Light Brothers group in Kiva partner, Faulu Kenya. He does printing and sells stationery to earn a living.  He has been engaged in this business for three years. Being a married man with four children in school, he works hard to provide for them. He has gained a lot from joining Faulu Kenya, including saving his money, sharing business ideas with his group members and accessing loans easily. Bernard has requested a second loan of 50,000 KES from Faulu Kenya. He will use the money to buy a computer monitor and printer.

loans.use: To buy a computer monitor and printer

loans.name: Nget

texts.en:
Mrs. Nget was born in 1947.  She is a widow and has one child who is a construction worker. Mrs. Nget is a farmer who owns a 1.5-hectare plot of land where she grows rice to sell as well as to feed her family.  

At the present, Mrs. Nget has a problem because her son's work place is far away from her home.  To fix this problem, she would like to ask for a loan to add her savings to buy a motorcycle for his transportation.

loans.use: buy a motorcycle for her son to commute to work

loans.name: Rene

texts.es:
Don René , nació en un pueblo llamado Susucayan localizado en los alrededores del departamento de Nueva Segovia, tiene 38 años de edad , es casado, tiene 4 hijos, de oficio mecánico. Comenzó a los 18 años de edad en la ciudad de Estelí cuando se vino a la ciudad en 1983, el era ayudante de mecánica, también trabajo como conductor para una empresa. Antes del  taller de mecánica el tenia un taller de bicicletas al cual le dedico 12 años de su vida, vendía repuestos nuevos de bicicletas, a los 19 años se caso, mantenía a su familia con lo que le generaba el taller de bicicleta, su esposa es ama de casa y ella le ayuda ya que tiene un molino con el cual ella trabaja en casa y coopera con lo poco que le genera. El lamenta mucho no haber podido estudiar ya que su familia no tenia los recursos económicos para apoyarlo solo llego hasta sexto grado de primaria, por esa razón es que el trabaja muy duro cada día para que sus hijos no pasen por lo que el paso. El se gana la vida ofreciendo sus servicios como mecánico, vendiendo repuestos usados de carro en las afueras de Estelí en un local que el alquila.
Solicita el crédito para comprar un lote de repuestos de vehículos, tales como resortes, ascensores, diferenciales, manecillas, bushin etc. Esto le ayudara ya que al surtir mas su inventario de repuestos podrá atraer a más cliente, aumentar su venta de repuestos, ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
Tiene como plan futuro, comprar un terreno donde pueda poner su negocio y no tener que alquilar un local y ahorrarse esos costos .Como meta próxima poder asegurarles una carrera universitaria a sus hijos y poner una venta de todo tipo de llanta.
texts.en:
Don René was born in a village called Susucayan in the department of Nueva Segovia.  He is 38 years old, married and has four children, and is a mechanic by trade.  He started in 1983 when he was 18 years old and had arrived in the city of Estelí.  He worked as a mechanic assistant and also as a driver for a company.  Before setting up his auto repair shop he had a bicycle repair shop for 12 years and sold repair parts.

He married at age 19 and was able to maintain his family with the income from the bike shop.  His wife is a homemaker and operates a mill at home which gives her a little income to help her husband.  René is sorry he was unable to get an education.  His family could not help him financially so he got only as far as 6th grade.  He works very hard so this won't happen to his own children.  Besides being an auto repairman he also sells used car parts at of the property he rents on the outskirts of Estelí.

He plans to use the loan to buy auto repair parts such as springs, lifts, differentials, pointers, bushings, etc.  This will help him expand inventory to attract more customers, increase sales of repair parts and offer better service.

In the future he hopes to buy his own property so he doesn't have to rent and can save money.  His goal is to provide his children with a college education. He also wants to branch out into tire sales.

loans.use: To buy auto repair parts

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en: Elsa is a member of the communal bank "Union II" at FINCA Peru. She has two children: a 20-year old son studying engineering in Lima and a 14-year old daughter studying in Ayacucho. She has been a member of FINCA Peru for 15 years now, and started off with a business selling ice and cosmetics. Now she also rents rooms to students in Ayacucho, and rents the first floor to a commercial tenant. She is currently adding a fourth floor to her building to have an additional 8 rooms to rent. She has 14 rooms right now, which are all occupied. She will be using her current loan of 1,750 PEN to help her purchase an apartment in Lima, where her son can live and she can rent out the extra rooms.

loans.use: To purchase an apartment to rent out in Lima

loans.name: Las Damas De San Blas Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son de Ramal – Piribebuy que dista a 12 km aproximadamente de la oficina de Caacupe.
Las integrantes del comité "Las Damas de San Blas", son personas muy trabajadoras, ellas están muy agradecidas con la Fundación Paraguaya porque gracias a las facilidades de las políticas de créditos ellas pudieron acceder a Kiva para solicitar ahora un préstamo de los inversionistas y de ese modo invertir en sus negocios y otras integrantes iniciar una actividad comercial.
La presidenta, la Sra. Catalina E. vive con su marido e hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de perfumes.
Ella junto con sus compañeras realizan constantes actividades para de ese modo poder adelantar el incremento de sus fondos comunes.
Catalina es una mujer valiente que trata de progresar con éxitos en cada emprendimiento y meta que se traza, por eso se anima a pedir créditos que la ayuden a alcanzar sus objetivos, pues sabe que sin ese aporte económico tropezaría en el camino que se decida seguir para lograr superar la pobreza.
texts.en:
The women in this group are from Ramal - Piribebuy, which is approximately 12 kms. from the office in Caacupe.

The members of the group "Las Damas de San Blas" are hard-working people.  They are very grateful to the Paraguaya Foundation for the good credit terms that have given them access to a Kiva loan to invest in their businesses, and in other cases begin business.

The president, Mrs. Catalina E., lives with her husband and children.  She sells perfumes.

She, as well as her team members, are constantly active in an effort to increase their common funds.

Catalina is a brave woman who strives to be successful at everything she does and for every goal she sets.  She uses the loans to help her meet her goals because she knows that without this support she would not be able to pull herself up out of poverty.

loans.use: To buy perfumes and colognes

loans.name: Judith

texts.es:
El Banco comunal se denomina “LAS EMPRENDEDORAS DE ANADAHUAYLILLAS”; Este Banco se encuentra situado en el Poblado de Andahuaylillas, perteneciente a la Provincia de Quispicanchis, Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Judith, la socia 32, la socia es casada y tiene 1 hijo, la socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la compra y venta de artesanía, la socia trabaja más de 1 año vendiendo artesanía en la plaza principal de Andahuaylillas, bello poblado típico y visitado por turistas que llegan de todas partes del mundo por su bella capilla llamada la capillita Sixtina de Cusco; la socia aprovecha este atractivo y junto a sus otras compañeras compran artesanía de Cusco y lo venden en la plaza. La socia desea invertir en la compra de artesanía. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de arenaria. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida y desea expresar que cumplirá de manera  disciplinadamente con los pagos de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
This community bank is called “LAS EMPRENDEDORAS DE ANADAHUAYLILLAS” (The Entrepreneurs of Anadahuylillas).  It is located in the town of Andahuaylillas, in Quispicanchis province, in Cusco department.

Judith is 32 years old, married, and has one child.  She divides her time between her household chores and her business buying and selling handicrafts.  She has been selling handicrafts in the main square of Andahuaylillas for more than one year.  This is a traditional and beautiful town which is visited by tourists who come from all over the world because of the town's beautiful chapel which is called "The Little Sistine Chapel of Cusco".  Judith makes the most of this attraction and, together with her companions, she buys handicrafts in Cusco and sells them in the town square.  She would like to invest in buying handicrafts.

Judith is grateful for the loan and would like to make it known that she will make her repayments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy handicrafts

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PEROLNIYOC”; La socia vive en el distrito de Urubamba en la provincia de Urubamba,  departamento del Cusco.

La  socia tiene 42  años de edad y La socia es casada y tiene 4 hijos de los cuales ella vive con dos de ellos de 16, 11 años de edad; la socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la compra y venta de animales mayores, la socia compra y vende toros, vacas; la socia desea invertir en la copra de 2 toros pequeños para criarlos y engordarlos y después de esto venderlos. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de animales mayores, la socia comprara dos toros.

La socia valora y agradece el crédito que le otorgarán para así mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This member belongs to, " PEROLNIYOC"; she lives in the district of Urubamba in the province of Urubamba and department of Cusco.  This member is 42 years old, married, and has 4 children, 2 of whom she still lives with, of ages 11 and 16.  She alternates her household activities with the purchase of older animals; she buys and sells bulls and cows.  She wishes to purchase 2 younger bulls in order to raise them and fatten them up to later sell.
This member solicits the loan to invest in the puchase of older animals, she would be buying 2 bulls.  This member values and is thankful for the loan given to her in order to improve her quality of life; at the same time she commits to fulfilling her payments withing the allotted time.

loans.use: to purchase older animals, this member would purchase 2 bulls.

loans.name: Eva Olinda

texts.es:
Eva de 34 años de edad, es soltera,  vive en casa de sus pades, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Reque que se encuentra a unos minutos de la provincia de Chiclayo.  Se caracteriza por que sus pobladores desarrollan la actividad agrícola y ganadera.

Eva se dedica hace algunos años a la compra, crianza y venta de aves de corral como gallinas,pavos,patos y gallos al por menor.   Los cría en su corral que se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa para mayor seguridad de sus animales, los alimenta con comida balanceada  y granos natural posible, una vez que han completado su desarrollo los vende a los distintos mercados de la zona y los ofrece a sus clientes, con los ingresos que obtenga podrá seguira ayudando a sus padres.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa para seguir comprando aves de corral y seguir incrmentando sus ventas e ingresos para su casa, cubriendo sus necesidades personales.  Eva es una mujer responsble, trabajadora y empeñosa conocida por los pobladores del lugar donde vive, por querer mejorar  económicamente y tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Eva is 34 years old and single  She lives in her parents' home which is located in a rural area  of the Reque district, within minutes of the province of Chiclayo.  The area is characterized by its people working in agricultural and livestock activities.

For the last few years, Eva has worked purchasing, raising and selling at retail poultry such as chickens, turkeys, ducks and cockerels.  She raises them in the pen that is behind her house for better safety of the birds.  They are fed a balanced feed and natural grains when possible.  Once they have completed their growth, they are sold to different markets in the area and she also offers them directly to customers.  With the income she earns, she is able to continue helping her parents.

She has requested a loan of 1,000 New Soles through Edpyme Alternativa, to continue buying poultry and to get incremental growth in her sales and income for her home, covering her personal needs.  Eva is a responsible woman, hardworking and earnest, who is well-known by the locals where she lives.  She want to improve economically and have a better quality of life

loans.use: to buy more poultry.

loans.name: Naama

texts.en:
Naama is a 35-year-old mother of six. She began selling sheets, blankets and pillows from her home. Her business draws a good clientele with Naama gaining a name in providing quality customer service and a special personal touch. Naama is now ready to move the business from her home to another location in her neighborhood.

Naama needed this loan to purchase additional stock, shelving and do some renovations.

In the future Naama wants to move into a store near the central market and continue to see her business expand.

loans.use: to purchase additional supplies, shelving, and do some renovations.

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla decided to start her multiservice company, Precise Multiservices, three months ago. After working in the multiservice industry (which offers clients access to legal, notary, and tax services) for 10 years, Perla realized that she could offer these services to a community that she felt needed them most.

Originally from Monterrey, Mexico, Perla began working in the multiservices industry in the U.S. when she was 16, gaining experience as a notary with a local multiservice company in Houston, Texas. The work was immediately gratifying to Perla because, as she says, she was “doing something for somebody that they wouldn’t be able to take care of on their own.” From her first job, Perla worked constantly to better herself and the community around her. Growing up with a strong sense of family values, she balanced work, school, and family responsibilities as she grew her experience in the business. 

While Perla valued all of the clients she served in the early years of her career, she found working with clients in the Hispanic communities in Houston particularly fulfilling. Many of these clients were members of low-income families with little or no education on how to complete the complex legal forms necessary to live in the United States. Because she was helping people with such unique needs, these clients quickly found a place in Perla’s heart. As a result, she slowly began to work independently with non-English speakers and their families to manage and file complicated immigration materials alongside her full-time work with larger multiservice companies.

Now, at 26, Perla is ready to take her business expertise to the next level. She says that she has been ready to start her own business for a few years but has been unable to do so for financial reasons. With this loan, she will make her dream come true. She will use the money to purchase office equipment and supplies for her at-home office space, professional business software to design a website and print business cards, and a color laser printer to offer her clients more prompt and reliable printing and copying services. 

When asked what she hopes for her business in the coming years, Perla remains faithful to her family-oriented upbringing: “I hope to turn this into a family business….to move our business into a location where our services are most needed.”

Without her loan, Perla says she wouldn’t have been able to turn her dream into a reality. With this in mind, her advice to aspiring entrepreneurs is to “never give up on your dreams. It might take a while, but, if you stay with it, something good is bound to happen.”

loans.use: to pay for office equipment and supplies, business software, and a color laser printer.

loans.name: Pascuala

texts.es:
La señora Pascuala vive en la comunidad de San Pedro pero pertenece a un barrio que esta lejos del centro, la señora camina un largo tiempo para poder salir y entrar a la comunidad, en su barrios hay bastentes milpas que la gente siembra para poder tener maiz, hacer tortillas a mano y utulizar el zacate para darles de comer a sus animales, es de mucho esfuerzo y trabajo sembrar la milpa.
La señora Pascuala tiene 19 años y 2 años viviendo en union libre, vive en casa de sus suegros y tiene 1 hijo de un año de edad, su esposo trabaja como albañil y sabe hacer muchas cosas en lo que a construccion se refiere, mientras tanto la señora Pascuala cria puercos para poderlos vender y tener una ganancia. Ella nos menciona que los puercos y los borregos son los animales que la gente mas busca para hacer de comer cuando tienen una fiesta o para poder vender; por ejemplo, la gente que vende tacos, por esa razon decidio criar puercos, lo que mas le dificulta es el alimento ya que estos comen mucho y todo el dia se la pasan comiendo y como no tiene mucho zacate para darles de comer a veces lo tiene que comprar, las metas de la señora son hacerse de otros animales como borregos para poderlos criar y vender. 
Sus sueños es hacer una casa aunque sea pequeña, pero quiere vivir ya aparte de sus suegros y tener sus propias cosas.
texts.en:
Pascuala lives in the community of San Pedro but in a neighborhood that’s far from the center.  She has a long walk to leave and get to the community.  There are many corn fields in her neighborhood that the residents plant to have corn and make hand-made tortillas and they use the grass to feed their animals.  Planting corn is very hard work and takes a lot of effort.

Pascuala is 19 years old and has been in a common law relationship for two.  She lives in her in-laws’ house and has a one-year-old son.  Her husband works as a bricklayer and knows how to do a lot of things related to construction work while Pascuala raises pigs to sell and have some profits.  

She mentions that pigs and sheep are the animals people seek to make food when they have parties or to be able to sell, like people who sell tacos, for example.  Because of this she decided to raise pigs.  

Her greatest difficulty is the feed because they eat a lot and spend all day eating and because she does not have a lot of grass available to feed them she has to buy it sometimes.  Her goals are to acquire more animals, like sheep, to raise and sell.  Her dream is to build a house, even if it’s small, but she wants to live apart from her in-laws and have her own things.

loans.use: to raise pigs to sell.

loans.name: Remy

texts.en:
Remy is 36 years old and married with three children ages seven, eight, and nine. He is a farmer who tills land in Banga, South Cotabato. Remy has been growing rice for the past ten years. His farming income allows him to feed his family and send his children to school.

Remy is requesting a loan to purchase seedlings, fertilizer, and other farm inputs. In the future, he hopes to have a stable income to sustain his children's education.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings, fertilizer, and farm inputs

loans.name: Dilshoda

texts.ru:
Дилшода занимается купля продажей детской одежды. Более 4 года она занимается этим бизнесом. Дилшода мать одиночка и она сама обеспечивают свою семью. Её сын учится в среднем школе, и она хочет, чтобы её сын  учился в престижную школу и в хороших учебных заведениях, так как такие школы стоит дорого, и она не может, учит своего сына в таких школах. Давайте поможем Дилшоде чтоб сбылась её мечта. Она запрашивает кредит в размере 1000$ США для покупки нового ассортимента детской одежды с целью расширение бизнеса. Дилшода очень надеется в вашу поддержку. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en:
Dilshoda is in the business of buying and selling children's clothing. She has been in this business for more than four years. Dilshoda is a single mother and supports the family alone. Her son goes to secondary school and she wants for her son to go to a better school, but such schools cost a lot and she is not able to afford it. Let's help Dilshoda make her dream come true. She is asking for a loan in the amount of $1,000USD to buy a new variety of children's clothing with the purpose of expanding her business. Dilshoda very much hopes to receive your support.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase a new variety of children's clothing

loans.name: Martha Cecilia

texts.es:
La Señora. Martha es socia del banco comunal Las Cuencanitas, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad tiene una hermosa arquitectura colonia y esta bañada por 4 ríos, su gastronomía es muy variada, su gente es amable, cordial y mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus padres.

Doña Martha tiene 42 años, es madre soltera de 2 hijos de 21 y 19 años de edad quienes trabajan. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

La Señora. Martha es vendedora ambulante de confeti y juguetes, actividad que la desempeña hace 15 años y trabaja de domingo a domingo sin horario fijo.
 
Este es su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de juguetes y confeti para su negocio.
 
Su sueño es continuar con su negocio pero con su propio capital y sin deudas.
texts.en:
Ms. Martha is a member of the communal bank Las Cuencanitas who lives in the city of Cuenca. This city has beautiful colonial architecture, and is washed by four rivers. The city's cuisine is highly diverse, its people friendly and polite, and they maintain the culture and traditions of their forebears. 

Doña Martha is 42 years old, the single mother of two children, 21 and 19, who are working. She does not have her own home and so she rents. 

Ms. Martha is a street vendor of confetti and toys, a business she has had for 15 years. She works seven days a week without a fixed schedule. This is her second loan with the communal bank and she will invest it in the purchase of toys and confetti for her business. 

Her dream is to stay in business but with her own capital and without debt.

loans.use: to purchase toys and confetti.

loans.name: Osiris Marlenis

texts.es: Osiris D. 27 años D. edad vive en la ciudad D. Cartagena con su hija D. dos años; allí se dedica a la venta D. mercancía variada, negocio que tiene desD. su adolescencia y en el que ésta empeñada en hacerlo crecer;  mas aun  porque con el genera el bienestar D. su pequeña hija. Osiris venD. productos a créditos, que compra a proveedores y que encarga a empresas mediante catálogos o guías especializadas; su mercado se ubica en los diferentes barrios D. la ciudad D. Cartagena especialmente son mujeres quienes le compran. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará ropa, calzado, productos cosméticos, bisutería, aprovechando las exhibiciones que traen sus revistas en  ésta época, y que vienen con buenos descuentos. Su desafío es la competencia agresiva con precios especiales, pero su trabajo y buena relación con sus clientes,  hacen que se minimicen las dificultades, además D. su indicadores financieros que muestran su potencial D. crecimiento y la facilidad con que pueD. responder a sus obligaciones financieras, con las que proyecta aumentar su capital D. trabajo y poder comprar facilmente.
texts.en:
Osiris, 27, lives in the city of Cartagena with her two-year-old daughter.  She sells assorted merchandise there, a business she’s had since her adolescence and which she’s determined to see grow especially because it generates wellbeing for her young daughter.

Osiris sells products on credit that she buys from suppliers and that she orders from firms via catalogues or specialized guidebooks.  Her target market is located in various parts of the city of Cartagena, especially women.

Her Kiva loan, the first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, will be used to buy clothes, footwear, cosmetics and costume jewelry taking advantage of the items on special promotion or sale appearing in her current seasonal catalogues.

Her challenge is the aggressive special price competition but her work and good customer relations minimize difficulties.  In addition, her financial indicators show growth potential and ability to easily respond to financial obligations to increase working capital and be able to buy easily.

loans.use: to buy clothes, footwear, cosmetics and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan, 52 years old, is a cake seller. Between her cake business and doing farming, she earns $5 per day. Her husband operates a motor taxi service, earning $3 per day. She has seven children: five are studying and two more are working in the factory, earning $8 per day for all. 

Every month, Chan spends $30 on food, $10 on school fees, $10 on transportation, and $15 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1200 to buy a new motorbike for her husband’s career, because the previous motorbike is old and needs a lot of fixing. In the future, she wants to repair her house and to send her children to study in the university when they finish high school.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike for her husband's career.

loans.name: Viola

texts.en:
Viola is a 23 year old married woman who has no children. She has a business of selling charcoal in Jigomoni branch, in Yei, south Sudan. She has been in this business for five years.

Viola requested this loan through BRAC, south Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business. She will use the extra income from this loan to build a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: to be able to purchase more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish farm in the Philippines.

Lilian requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish and feeds.

Lilian has been in this business for one year.

Lilian would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish and feeds.

loans.name: Yissegnon 1 Group

texts.fr: YISSEGNON 1 est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même  quartier. La représentante du groupe, Laure (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 29 ans et est mariée à un couturier nommé Pascal. Le couple a deux enfants à leur charge. L’un des enfants n’est pas scolarisé.Laure vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Laure a très peu fréquenté l'école. Depuis environs cinq  ans, Laure mène comme activité la vente des savons et des conserves. Laure s’approvisionne dans l’un des marchés du Bénin.C’est la troisième fois que Laure et les autres membres du groupe YISSEGNON 1 sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. Les deux premiers crédits reçus ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
YISSEGNON 1 is a group of three persons who all live in the same neighborhood. The representative of the group, Laure, who is raising her hand in the photo, is 29 and married to a tailor named Pascal. The couple are raising two children. One of the children doesn't attend school. 

Laure lives together with her husband and children. The couple share in supporting the family. Laure went to school for only a short time. For about five years, she has been selling soap and tinned foods. She buys her supplies in a market in Bénin. It is the third time that Laure and the other members of her group called YISSEGNON 1 are requesting a loan from ALIDé in view of growing their working capital and their businesses so as to better respond to the needs of their clientele. Their first two loans have been correctly reimbursed.

loans.use: to buy soap and tinned food.

loans.name: Njete Farmers Group

texts.en:
Simon is the facilitator of Njete farmers group. Simon and his group joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Simon and his group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

Simon takes care of eight children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to have access to One Acre Fund's low prices, to ensure food security for his family, and, later, to educate them. In the 2011 season, Simon had an excellent maize yield harvesting eight bags on three quarters of an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Simon was only able to harvest two bags of maize on that land. 

With income from maize sales, Simon will educate his children, build a house and invest in livestock rearing. 

In 2012, the members of Njete farmers group will each plant maize plots between ½ and one acre of land. 

The person standing on the far left of the photo is the field officer.

loans.use: To buy farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Tarana

texts.en: Tarana is a 32-year-old woman who raises and breeds sheep and sells milk products in the local community. Tarana has 3 years of experience in this field. She breeds sheep for meat and fur and keeps one cow to sell milk and yogurt, which are very popular products in Azerbijan. Tarana's profit per month is 250 AZN. Her husband works as taxi driver, but his salary is too low to cover the needs of the family. Tarana's business is the main financial source of income. She has applied for a loan of 1000 AZN to purchase sheep and a milk cow.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and a milk cow.

loans.name: Johanna Lissette

texts.es:
Johanna Lissette tiene 27 años de edad vive en unión libre tiene tres hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos de 12, 7, 5 años de edad en el Cantón Ventanas provincia de los ríos.

La VRC LUCHANDO JUNTOS, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Zapotal nuevo, Pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a Labores Comerciales en su mayoría. 

Johanna se dedica a trabajar en un salón de belleza es manicurista, las compras y las ventas lo realiza en manicurista en Ventanas. Solicita el crédito para poder aumentar la vivienda.

Con la ayuda del crédito le ayudaría a poder arreglar la casa y poderse cambiar.

El sueño es poder vivir mejor en los tiempos libres le gusta pintarse las uñas.
texts.en:
Johanna Lissette is 27. She is in a common-law marriage and lives with her husband and children, ages 12, 7, and 5. They live in the Ventanas canton, Los Rios province.

The Luchando Juntos communal bank is located in the Zapotal Nuevo district, belonging to the Ventanas canton. The majority of the members are merchants.

Johanna works in a beauty salon as a manicurist. She buys and sells products in a beauty salon in Ventanas. She is requesting this loan to expand her home.

With the help of this loan she will be able to fix up her house and make some changes.

Her dream is to have a better standard of living. In her free time she likes to paint her nails.

loans.use: to expand her home.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: La Señora Martha genera sus ingresos con el trabajo de transportista que su esposo desempeña en su movilidad. El crédito que solicita es para gastos funerarios de su hijo mayor el cual se encuentra en el hospital con vida artificial hace tiempo y es lamentable su estado de salud, de tal manera que se tomó la decisión de que descanse en la Paz del Señor.  Martha vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona  de Alto Sopocachi de la Ciudad de La Paz. Martha tiene cuatro hijos. Este es un caso muy particular y especial, en el que prima la voluntad de ayuda a Martha.
texts.en:
Sra. Martha generates income in the transportation business with her husband driving their vehicle. The loan she is requesting will be used to pay the funeral expenses for her eldest son. He had been in the hospital for some time on life support and was in a declining state of health. They made the decision to allow him to rest in peace with God. Martha lives in her own home in the District of Alto Sopocachi in the city of La Paz. She has four children.

This is a very unique and special case, so best wishes are being extended in order to assist Martha.

loans.use: to pay for her son's funeral expenses.

loans.name: Romel

texts.en:
Romel is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single. 

Romel provides a motorcycle or habal-habal service. He has had this business for three years. He requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for his service.

Romel has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for his service

loans.name: Sanzu A Group

texts.fr:
Lenatte est âgée de 33 ans, elle a  son restaurant  qui fonctionne depuis 5 ans. Elle habite à Ruyigi. Son ancienne activité est le commerce de la bière. Elle a étudié jusqu’en 6 è année primaire Elle est marié à Joseph, ensemble ont 5 enfants dont 3 étudient. Il a déjà bénéficié  10 crédits avec Turame. Le crédit Kiva, lui permet d’augmenter son capital en achetant d’autres ustensiles pour augmenter la quantité de nourriture  à vendre dans le restaurant.
Elle est membre du groupe  du  « Sanzu I  »
texts.en:
Lenatte is 33 years old and has run a restaurant for five years. She lives in Ruyigi. Her previous business was selling beer. She studied through six years of primary school. She is married to Joseph, and the couple have five children together, three of whom are in school. She has already benefited from 10 loans with Turame. This Kiva loan will allow her to increase her capital by buying additional kitchenware to increase the amount of food sold in the restaurant. 
She is member of the "Sanzu I" group.

loans.use: To increase her capital by buying additional kitchenware to increase the amount of food sold in her restaurant.

loans.name: Maria Riselda

texts.en:
Maria Riselda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling ready-to-wear clothes in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 15,000 PHP through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to buy more items like curtains, blouses and pants.

Maria Riselda has been in this business for three years. Maria Riselda earns more income from her variety store.

Maria Riselda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like curtains, blouses and pants.

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo is 42 years old and lives in Toril, Aloran in Misamis Occidental Province. He is married with three children. Romeo has a general store where he earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month.

Romeo has been a member of PMPC for two years. He has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase more stock for his store.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for his store.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
After graduating from junior high school, Hannah decided to set up her own small business in Elmina near Cape Coast. She is married to a mason and has five children.

She is a successful petty trader who sells items like toothbrushes, toothpaste, and soaps. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband pay their children’s school fees. 

Hannah wants to increase her inventory due to a growing number of customers. Unfortunately, she does not have enough working capital. As a result, this loan will be used to help her purchase an increased amount of toothbrushes, toothpaste, and soaps to sustain her business. Hannah aims to use her profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase toothbrushes, toothpaste, and soaps to sell.

loans.name: Melvis

texts.en: Melvis Merchan was born in Manabi, Ecuador and is a 44 year-old single woman. She own a small business, selling various household items in the Municipal de Bastión Popular. She starts work at 6am every day and usually closes her shop around 5pm. Her parents taught her how to operate the store, as they were the previous owners before Melvis took over. In the four years since she has been the proprietor of Bazar Melvis, Ms. Merchan has gained the customer loyalty she needs to now expand. She is asking for a $950 loan so she can buy food-packing items like Tupperware as well as other goods such as cooking utensils, which many local chefs purchase. More than anything, Melvis wants to be free of the “chulqueros” or loan sharks who charge high interest to poor Ecuadorians. She hopes that with this loan she can grow her business and be able to help her parents who are in need of more medical attention as they get older.

loans.use: Purchase goods such as plastic containers, cooking utensils, and marketing materials.

loans.name: Geray

texts.en: Geray is a man from Yardimli district of Azerbaijan. He started his private business in 1998, and in 2005-2006 borrowed three loans for a total of $1100.  Now he wants to borrow 700$ to increase assortment of goods in his shop.

loans.use: To increase business goods

loans.name: Nuon

texts.en:
Nuon N. is a tailor in Phnom Penh. She is 56 years old and lives with her husband and their two children. Nuon N. earns $2.50/day and her husband earns the same as a mototaxi driver.

She will use this loan to buy a sewing machine for her business. She also hopes to be able to fix up their house for the rainy season.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Tahir

texts.en: J. Tahir started his small business in 1999 when he purchased a cow and a few calves for meat purposes. Now he is going to enlarge his business and bring in additional income from animal breeding. He is going to purchase one calf and mixed fodder and has applied for a 700 USD loan from Aqroinvest CU to achieve his goal.

loans.use: Going to purchase a calf for meat purpose and fodder.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: T o expand his clothing business.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesús

texts.es:
Teresa is married and has a small 6-year-old son. They are originally from San Nicolás de los Garza in the Mexican state of Nuevo León. Her husband's salary is low, so to improve her family's quality of life, Teresa decided to start her own business selling perfumes three years ago. With the help of her husband she started getting supplies to present to clients, and fortunately her clientele has increased and her sales are improving every day.

To cover the orders of her clients, Teresa is requesting a loan of $475, which she plans to repay within six months. With it, she hopes to improve her customer service and continue growing her business. Teresa is very grateful for the opportunity to keep moving ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Teresa es casada y tiene un pequeño hijo de 6 años de edad, ellos son originarios de la localidad de San Nicolás de los Garza en Nuevo León. Para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia Teresa decidió emprender su propio negocio con la venta de perfumes hace tres años, ya que el salario que su esposo recibe es muy bajo. Con la ayuda de su esposo comenzaron a surtir mercancía para darla a conocer, afortunadamente han logrado incrementar su cartera de clientes y sus ventas mejoran cada día.

Para poder cubrir los pedidos de sus clientes Teresa está solicitando un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que se compromete a devolver en 6 meses, con esto espera poder mejorar la calidad del servicio que ofrece y continuar creciendo con su negocio. Teresa agradece mucho la oportunidad que le brindas para salir adelante.

loans.use: Purchase supplies

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Ana Jose

texts.pt:
Ana is married and the mother of 4 children. She lives in Maxixe with her family. She works at a private company. She joined the loan program this year. She wants to use the money to buy some home appliances for her house. This is only the second loan that she is taking. The first one she used to purchase a freezer. Ana's husband is not employed. He lives from small jobs to support his family. For that reason, Ana joined the program in order to help her husband with household expenses.

Translated from Portuguese by a Kiva volunteer.

Ana e casada e mae de 4 filhos. Ela vive na Maxixe com sua familia. Ela e trabalhadora numa empresa privada. Ela entrou para o programa de credito ainda este ano. Ela quer usar o dinheiro para a compra de alguns electrodomesticos para a sua casa. Este e so segundo emprestimo que ela toma. o promeiro ela usou para a compra de um congelador. O marido de Ana nao esta empregado. Vive de pequenos expediente para poder sustentar sua familia. por isso Ana entrou para o programa como forma de reforcar o seu vencimento que e baixo ara poder ajudar o marido nas despesas da casa.

loans.use: Ana wants to use the money to purchase home appliances

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en: My name is Naseem P.. I belong to Lahore, a historical city in Pakistan. I am married and a mother of four: two sons and two daughters. I and my husband both sell video cassettes and audio cassettes in various cities on different festivals. I need a loan of $175 to buy cassettes in bulk for the New Year festival.

loans.use: Expand current business

loans.name: Lady

texts.es:
Lady Isabel is 33 years old and has two small children. They are the reason for her progress and she would like to give them the best she can so their development will be successful. Currently she works retail sales selling sodas, an activity that allows her to live peacefully, with the noble desire to increase her space soon in order to offer a larger quantity of beverages. Lady Isabel requests this loan as work capital in order to begin the expansion of her business. We can make her request possible, so that soon her business can be the biggest distributor in her beautiful city, Pucallpa.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Lady Isabel tiene 33 años de edad, ella es madre de dos pequeños niños, ellos son la razón de su progreso y desea brindarles lo mejor para que su desenvolvimiento sea exitoso. Actualmente se dedica a la venta de bebidas gaseosas al por menor actividad que le permite vivir tranquilamente, con el noble deseo de acrecentar sus espacios a corto plazo para ofertar mayor cantidad de bebidas. Lady Isabel solicita una suma de dinero como capital de trabajo para iniciar la expansión de su negocio. Posibilitemos su petición para que pronto se convierta en la distribuidora más grande su bella ciudad, Pucallpa.

loans.use: Increase capital to expand her business

loans.name: Sreymom

texts.en:
Miss N. Sreymom is single and lives with her old parents. She has four sisters, two of whom are married and live in separate houses. The other two sisters weave silk at home.

Her family has three looms, including hers. She started her business weaving silk in 2000. It’s a skill she learned from her sister.

Sreymom and her family live on an island of the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Sreymom is requesting a loan in the amount of $400 from MAXIMA. She will use this money to purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.name: Zumreta

texts.en: Zumreta lives with her husband and two children in the town of Rosulje, a suburb of Tešanj. Her husband has a full -time job from which he earns a monthly salary of 500 KM. Zumreta runs a small catering business and has applied for her first loan, for $950, to buy a grilling machine. The machine will help her expand her business and her family's income.

loans.use: To buy a grilling machine for a small catering business.
